reviews.text: B<br>Service was horrible!<br>I had to ask the waitress to remove the bread plates off the table..<br>The food took forever to come <br>The waitress was very inattentive veryy non chalant.<br>Would not recommend
Food was ok, wife rice was hard. The waitress provided her with another plate of it. Had an extremely long wait to be seated because of the social distancing. Would recommend making a reservation.
We visited one in Charlotte and ordered avocado egg rolls, it was delicious we all loved their sauces.

This was my second time to place an order from the Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m highly disappointed. They ask that we place an order to pick up. Well I arrived as I had already placed my order by call and told the representative that I will be there this evening. When I arrived the order was no place to be found and they gave me this. The female said that &#34;they must have given someone else my order because they&#39;re were two orders.&#34;<br>The female took this cheesecake from the front and added in the missing slices from a chilled cake from the back. This was to be a birthday gift and it&#39;s not even appetizing to look at.  <br>I understand there are multiple orders a day but when I spoke with the rep on the phone he asked for first and last name to avoid someone else pick up my order. This is so upsetting.

We&#39;ve been here twice since moving to the area.  This place has an attitude problem, a bathroom cleanliness issue, and a lack of quality control with the food.  Tonight we were celebrating a birthday and waited almost two hours for a table after being quoted an hour.  <br><br>I informed the hostess that the bathroom was a wreck and she could&#39;ve cared less.  Upon leaving it was even worse and there were no paper towels available.  There was a huge line outside and empty tables.  Many tables were requesting the manager because their orders were wrong or things took so long.  The customers looked upset and hungry - nobody was smiling or chatting. My son cried at one point.<br><br>Once seated, It took a long time to order waters/soda so we were ready and placed our food order.  It  Another 45 minutes went by and three of five meals came out and the other two people had to wait for their meals.  They didn&#39;t follow the requests for things on the side or to leave a burger plain.<br><br>We sat outside and there was a food delivery truck that was so loud we couldn&#39;t hear or talk.  A staff member loudly dragged a chair across the floor from one side of the patio to the other instead of carrying it.  Many servers looked annoyed by their tables.  The whole experience was rea

I came here on a Monday evening after calling first AND making reservations on yelp as they suggested, to eat outside. We got there 15 minutes prior to our reservation outside only to be told that they will not be able to seat us and we would have to wait 30 minutes to be seated outside. The customer service was terrible! I am extremely dissatisfied and disappointed.

This is the best place ever to eat!!! had reservations and got seated early. The waitress was on point with the service.  I have an awesome experience every time I&#39;m here. Please plan to come to Columbia, SC in the future.

We had an absolutely amazing experience at The Cheesecake Factory last night!! <br>The staff was amazing. The food was the absolute BEST!!! <br>The bar drinks were great!! Just the best experience. <br>Going again this morning for Brunch!!

The food was okay and the service was good. The wait was ridiculous, plan on walking around the mall for 45 mins to an hour before being seated. My food was good but my friends said that their food was semi cold and they felt like they could have made it themselves. Overall I would order my meal again but change the flavor of cheesecake it was a bit too sweet for my liking but they have many other delicious flavors ranging from $7-8 per slice, they vary.

Love this place! Placed reservation day before. They seated us when we got there. Everyone had masks on and seemed to keep areas very clean and disinfected. Tables are marked off, every other table. Pasta as always excellent. Cheesecake amazing! Server was hilarious, friendly, and very attentive. Always my favorite place. Keep up amazing work!!!! Daughters bday was that day. They couldn&#39;t sing but brought her out ice cream. Super thoughtful!!!

Went last Friday before finding out that Andrea Bocelli concert had been postponed. Anyway, came for an early dinner before the show right about 5:30ish. Believe it or not their was a wait. I haven&#39;t been to this place in years. I would always get the lettuce wraps. This time I decided to go for something different. I went with the bang bang chicken and shrimp. Mistake. Their was no bang bang at all.  I believe I counted 3 shrimp some chicken and a big mound of white sticky white rice.  Also, got their avocado egg rolls.  That made up for the entree. <br><br>A peach Bellini, app, entree, and one slice of cheese cake $62.00!! This includes tax and a modest tip. this was just for one person.  Ouch!   So expensive for just one person.  I would much rather spend that kind of money on a fancy upscale dinner.

I feel like the Cheesecake Factory is a place to go when you&#39;re expecting something a little bit fancier than Chili&#39;s right? I would say my experience did mostly fit with that sort of expectation, but ultimately it was a bit disappointing. The service and the ambience of the restaurant was exceptional, however one thing that I did notice was that it seemed a lot of plates or glasses seemed to be dropped around the kitchen as we heard at least it more than a few times. <br><br>Looking at the food I ordered, which was the Steak Diane, it looks rather delicious and our friends were wishing that they got it instead, but after tasting it they changed their mind. The mushroom/wine sauce was sweet and savoury, the mashed potatoes were flavourful, but the steak... not really. It was perfectly cooked to medium rare, tender, but it tasted kinda bland... as I feel like it was under seasoned. It was pretty disappointing because there was nothing else wrong with it I feel. <br><br>Anyways, the tiramisu cheesecake was pretty good so I recommend that. Ultimately, my overall review for this Cheesecake Factory is that everything looks good, cooked well with good ingredients, but the main course&#39;s star player missed that game winning shot.
Went to this place for lunch with a friend and the food was good. The place was clean. And the service was good as well. We had a lunch portion for our meals and they were still large.
Everything I have tried at the Cheesecake Factory has been really good.  The chicken enchiladas were amazing!  The wait staff are really friendly.  Try a cocktail too!

It&#39;s truly amazing when only the best is delivered by a favorite Cheesecake  Factory! Flawless and best Chicken Costaletta and Cheesecake ever! Superb  on -time and extremely attentive service! I will be back, one of South Park&#39;s best Gems for great meals and excellent service! <br>Awesome service during the holidays period on a very busy evening!  YOUR MOUTH will water and love Chicken Costoletta!  The meal sounds harmless with its &#34;lightly breaded&#34; chicken breasts, mashed potatoes and fresh asparagus, but the meal packs 2,610 calories, 89 grams of saturated fat and 2,720 milligrams of sodium.
With COVID-19 Cheesecake Factory have really stepped up to make sure everyone feel safe and can enjoy great food, great service and feel some type of normalcy in this serious pandemic time.

I know, I know... such a high rating for a behemoth hit-and-miss chain like The Cheesecake Factory may seem absurd, but for our second consecutive meal at this Southpark location, it checked all the boxes (that is, after we got past their always uninterested and unmotivated hostesses.) Of course, at this place two things are certain - you WILL wait and you WILL have a difficult time not ordering dessert. We only had to wait 25 minutes, and for us, cheesecake is always a given.<br><br>I&#39;ll begin with our delightful young server Leanne, who was friendly and attentive throughout our meal. One could easily spend an hour perusing their novelesque menu, however, I knew exactly where to go, which was their Fresh Country Salad starring beets, goat cheese and tender grilled chicken for $15.50. Along with their hot and delicious pumpernickel bread, it was easily substantial enough for a meal. The salad also included a mountain of fresh mixed greens, candied pecans, and grilled asparagus. I ordered the vinaigrette on the side. My mouth waters even now just thinking about it. <br><br>My wife went with their Tuscan Chicken at $17.95 off of their Skinnylicious Menu and claimed it was one of the most savory dishes she has ever had. After having a bite, I agreed. At only 580 calories, it consisted of perfectly grilled tender chicken breasts, cherry tomatoes, artichokes, capers, fresh basil and balsamic vinaigrette all served over fresh veggies and farro. What a wonderful mix of flavors!<br><br>Finally, yes we ordered a huge slice of their sinfully fabulous Oreo Cheese Cake for $8. I won&#39;t even attempt to describe how good it was but I will say that it was a whopping 1680 calories. (Ask me if I care.) We also split, which we both agreed, was maybe one of the best lattes in Charlotte for a reasonable $4.50. <br><br>Overall, we had a another great visit. This place seems well managed and is consistently clean. It had a 94.5 sanitary rating. If you can just make it past the snotty little hostesses, I think you&#39;ll have a wonderful time in their festive and cavernous dining room (especially if your server is Leanne.)

I&#39;m gonna go out on a limb and say that The Cheesecake Factory is probably the busiest business in Southpark.  I mean, from the time this place first opened they&#39;ve had out-the-door and down-the-walkaway, and through-the-mall lines since the very beginning.  Yet I cannot fathom why they don&#39;t take reservations and I don&#39;t understand why they are never adequately staffed.  Before yesterday, I haven&#39;t returned since the 2019 holiday season.  I visited 5-6 times during the holidays and service was slow EVERY SINGLE TIME.  The servers explained (and complained) that they weren&#39;t fully staffed EVERY SINGLE TIME.  Service was always slow but the food was usually good but one of their employees felt compelled to sing the birthday song whenever someone was celebrating and it was just unbearably awful EVERY SINGLE TIME.  <br><br>Fast forward to yesterday, my birthday (9/6/20), I ordered the California Omelette and requested extra cheese.  It arrived cold with minimal cheese, no avocado, and no sour cream.  Server tried to explain that the sour cream was &#34;baked in&#34;...&#34;so you can&#39;t see it&#34;.  That&#39;s a problem when the menu indicates &#34;served with&#34;.  I didn&#39;t eat it.  Well I also ordered a second drink which took a whole 30 minutes to arrive.  I didn&#39;t accept because we were just ready to go.  Server complained to us about how bad management is, that there was only ONE bartender serving the entire restaurant which was why it took so long to bring the drink, AND she actually said she was fully aware of the overall subpar service but that her hands were tied.  <br><br>Needless to say, I don&#39;t think I&#39;m ever going back.

Severely disappointed. Spent $71 for two white Romano&#39;s with extra sauce and cheese on the side, a burger and fries, and two lemoncello cakes. Couldn&#39;t eat the bread because they forgot the butter and I asked for separate butters because there&#39;s three people eating. The white Romano&#39;s were very bland. No flavor at all. We thought they didn&#39;t have any sauce because it was beyond dry. The noodles tasted like just plain noodles, the extra cheese and sauce barely made a difference because there was absolutely no flavor. Even the chicken didn&#39;t taste like it had a cheese crust. Definitely not a dinner portion for $19 each. The burger was good but there weren&#39;t that many fries. Have yet to taste the two cakes but my expectations are extremely low. The only meal I ever order is the white Romano and it is my favorite. Moving from Illinois to South Carolina, this is the closest Cheesecake Factory being an hour and a half one way. So this was meant for an exciting treat that ended up being a waste of money. I have never been more disappointed.

This was a birthday brunch celebration for my 18 year old son and the experience was not a pleasant one.  We made reservations and had to wait for close to 20 minutes to be seated.  The waitress was rude the entire time.   My guest food was cold.  We waited close to 20 minutes or more for our drinks and when it was time to sing happy birthday the waiter just sat the ice cream on the table and walked away without a word.  The customer service was horrible and ruined my sons birthday brunch.  The manager was called and she didn&#39;t help the situation.  She was just as cold and rude as the waitress.

Hello i toke my mom to cheesecake factory for her 70th birthday. An services was NICE AND WAITRESS WAS NICE.. IT WAD THE FOOD NASTY<br> MY MOM DIDNT ENJOY HER SELF AT ALL. The waitress told her manager an she toke it off our ticket..<br>Im one of the daughter&#39;s I started threwing up my food. My stomach hurts so bad.. Im trying to let yall know.. Im not feeling good... My legs aching.

You know what...I know it&#39;s COVID and everything but we are nearly 10 months into this. We&#39;ve gotta get it together. Unfortunately this restaurant doesn&#39;t have it together. I made sure to make a reservation ahead of time to make sure we had a table. I showed up 10 minutes early to check in and was told not asked to come back at my reservation time.  So we did. I came right back ON TIME and was told again not asked that I would need to wait 10 minutes for them to get my table ready. Ummmm what?!? Finally got seated but oh the table was STILL not ready.  Then I took my kids to the bathroom and was so GROSSED OUT!!  Why isn&#39;t there someone dedicated to making sure the bathrooms are cleaned and sanitized!  Ok so now to the food. It was terrible, well except the bread. Food was lacking major taste and way overpriced.  We went home hungry and grossed out. I only gave it two stars instead of one because the drinks were good. I&#39;ll make sure to never eat here again.

I always have mixed feelings about this restaurant. <br><br>I do like their Cheesecakes...but even more, I&#39;m addicted to their &#34;Louisiana Pasta&#34;. But that&#39;s where the love affair ends.<br><br>The line for this restaurant is just exhausting...almost disgusting!! It&#39;s way too popular for its own good. Just don&#39;t understand why they don&#39;t open a second branch in town. Just as when this place opened, their wait line is simply out of control...even on a lazy Sunday!<br><br>I signed in at 1:05 pm, the front desk girl said it&#39;d be a 30 minute wait...but it turned out to be at least a 50 minute wait. WTF?!? Honestly, I can&#39;t believe I waited that long. Oh Wait...I was there to use my Gift Card!<br><br>My order (mentioned above!) was delicious, and the waitress was fine on the most part (she was a bit slow with the Ice Tea refill)...and as usual, it was a satisfying dining experience.  <br><br>But was the wait worth it??? If I didn&#39;t have that free Gift Card to spend, I think I would have skipped it. Honestly, after going thru the hideous waiting process for a late Sunday lunch (nearly 1 hour wait?!?), not sure if I&#39;m eager to return anytime soon.<br><br>Back to mixed feelings. Despite being a multi-chain restaurant, I&#39;ve always liked this restaurant...very diverse, eclectic menu! Based on their ambitious menu, especially for their varieties of cheesecakes and the highly addictive &#34;Louisiana Pasta&#34; (not sure about the other entrees... since I mostly stick with my faves), I&#39;d easily give it a 4. Same with waitstaff service. But again, there&#39;s the long wait, never-ending line...beyond bad! So bad that I&#39;d easily give it a 0. Given how much I love that Pasta dish, guess I&#39;ll rate this a 3. If their ridiculous wait issue isn&#39;t resolved, I can&#39;t see how anyone would think they deserve ratings higher than a 3.

I always come to the cheesecake factory and I always get great customer service every time and the food is always great too. The only thing with me is I need to venture out and try other dishes because I have one dish that I love and I get that same dish every time. I went against the grain one time and got something different and it wasn&#39;t up to par like I wanted so I stick to the same dish all the time.  The meatloaf, they never let me down. The restaurant is clean and always busy because of the location.
Fodd was amazing, but served so slow. Environment was clean and they followed social distance well. Women&#39;s bathroom was bit dirty. Cheesecake was so good

Ahhthe Cheescake Factory...the menu is endless but everything I&#39;ve ever had has been delicious. My go to salad would be the Factory chopped salad (featured on the Skinnylicious Menu) however I tweak it a little bit. I subtract the bacon (I know, what the heck?!) and I sub blue cheese with goat cheese just as a personal preference and it is DELICIOUS! My two friends and I were served by Tavares who was a pleasure! He was a very thoughtful and attentive server! <br>My friends got the chicken piccata and the white chicken chili. The chili reminded me of a chicken tortilla soup with its spice and it will definitely be a contender next time I&#39;m there!

Our waiter was amazing. My drink was too. Food not so much. Food was cold, steak was a brick and cooked beyond well done when I asked for medium. I left not eating my food because it already took us 40 mins to get our food. They advised I would have to wait a while again. They did however take it off my bill.
I absolutely loved the #chickenasianwraps from #Cheescakefactory. Very light and health so I didn&#39;t feel so bad having cheesecake after!

I told the lady at the register that it was a front counter there was a fly in the refrigerated area of the cheesecake. Instead of her trying to get the fly out, she kept calling for her boss. The fly was landing on multiply cheesecakes and they only removed the one that the fly was landed on at the time they looked. They left the fly flying in the refrigerator!!!!! They didn&#39;t remove all the cheesecakes or nothing, just kept going cutting cheesecakes and placing more cheesecakes in there.

If you would like to go to a place that has great food and very well trained staff members this is the place to go. The decor is beautiful from the walls to the ceiling you will always have something to admire. The staff is always dressed to impress and they do just that. It is a very clean establishment and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to take their significant other to an amazing place. The price is a little steep but the environment is worth it.
Our waitress was amazing and the food was great. She was super on top of everything and constantly checked on us. The food was also really good.

We ordered and prepaid curbside pickup for Mother&#39;s Day. (We ordered and prepaid 2 days in advance) It was a mess!<br><br>When I order curbside pickup, I expect to pick it up Outside the restaurant. Curbside is not having to wait in line inside a crowded place.  <br><br>Once inside there were several long lines, with people attempting to keep 6 ft. of distance among themselves<br>Restaurant staff were both with and without masks. As a customer, I expect employees to wear masks. <br><br>I heard my name called, but had to wait some time until a very overwhelmed (and unmasked) employee handed me my bags of preordered and prepaid food. <br><br>When I got home, the food was barely warm. We reheated it in the microwave. <br><br>The food tasted OK. Food taste is not the problem. Service is. <br><br>Would I order again. No way, definitely not worth dying for.

Meh Nothing too spectacular here. The menu is endless so I can say everyone has something to eat here. The Pasta carbonara was good but really not that good for the price and wait. My server was good but wait time for a table and then for the food itself was forever. I&#39;d come back but I know it will be another couple of years.

Slice cost $8.95 and it was extremely thinly sliced for the price.. The guacamole was so old it was Brown!! 1 of the quesadillas had NO chicken in it.  This  is what you give people who have your food delivered, this establishment should be ashamed of themselves!!  If I had dined in, I am so sure they would not have done this, or the Manager would have definitely been requested.  Do not order food here for delivery, they clearly do not care.

I visited this location with my family of 4 for a dinner around 7 pm.  We received a buzzer and waited 2 hours for a table.  They gave us a buzzer and we periodically checked in.  Once we were seated it took another hour and fifteen minutes to receive our food.  By this time everyone was extremely hungry and tired.<br><br>Our waiter was friendly and did a great job. The food was good.  We had the parmesan crusted chicken, a shrimp dish, stuffed cheeseburger and another chicken dish.  We also tried desserts. The overall experience was poor because of the extreme wait times and the very long wait for the food. This establishment would be better served to offer reservations on Saturday nights to limit the traffic and better manage the situation.
Love the menu choices and cheesecake. Covid precautions in place. Only complaint is the inconvenient area the line to purchase cheesecake in the same location as the hostess stand - too crowded

I&#39;ve always loved this restaurant. The food is absolutely delicious. The garlic dipping sauce for the calamari is AMAZING and don&#39;t even get me started on the actual cheesecakes. The red velvet cheesecake is a little on the sweeter side but still really tasty, my absolute go-to. Definitely recommend the Chicken Madeira! Super soft &amp; juicy chicken and I love the mashed potatoes. Waited 2.5 hours today for a table but it&#39;s always busy so don&#39;t forget to make your reservation! The wait was totally worth it though.

We made reservation and it was amazing that we walked straight in and others waiting 2 1/2 hours. All employees friendly. Hand Sanitizer everywhere. Touchless menu and touchless paying was awesome. Waiter was very friendly. Others were constantly cleaning and sanitizing all computers and tables. Food always great.

I have been a fan of TCF for years, but today&#39;s experience ruined it. Of course the wait on a Sunday is expected to be long , but the service was disgusting. From the nasty host who seemed to be bothered to be working, to the waitress that was changed mid shift. Her attitude was awful as well. I myself who works in the FS business knows how to let a customer know when what they asking may not be possible, but a burrito doesn&#39;t need to have onions and peppers.<br>I ordered the pineapple chicken with no shrimp. An hour later we received our disgusting food. Mine had shrimp and my husband&#39;s burrito was burnt and salty. The new waiter we had, I believe his name was Bryan was a Delight and got the manager ASAP. All we got was free dinner , cool but an hour of wait for food plus an hour to sit just to be disappointed, not enough in my book. <br><br>Perhaps we can come back when the service is better and never on a Sunday.

Had a wonderful experience at the Cheesecake Factory. The food was delicious and our server John was great. Also had lots of COVID-19 precautions set in place which enhanced the experience. I highly recommend the Impossible taco salad and the Cinnabon Cheesecake

Very dissatisfied.  I ordered a Greek salad with Arugula and mini crab bites to go.  I repeated my order and yet I got home and saw old dead iceberg lettuce not the Arugula I requested.  I called and spoke to the manager, Jonathan and he said he could only partially refund my bill for the salad.  Now I have to be inconvenienced to go get another salad from somewhere else.  Terrible customer service and the manager needs to be re-trained.  I would have given 0 stars but it would not post without at least one.

The wait was 3 hours to eat so we opted for take out cheesecake. <br>It has now been 45 minutes there have to be 100 people waiting and only 7 orders have come out. <br>The manager keeps walking over with orders that no one is expediting. This place needs to stop taking orders and get some out to those waiting.

Poor customer service and the bread...the bread. Let&#39;s see how to keep this simple. So i grabbed a coworker and told him lets walk over to the CCake Factory.  I really wanted the Honey Truffle chicken. Cool, simple and easy...lunch and cheesecake. Upon being seated at our table(near the bar) our waiter took our drink order and asked if we wanted bread. Of course we want the bread lol!!!! So as i cut off a piece of bread and begin chewing, i notice something in my mouth.  I stick my figure in to retrieve it and felt like a clown that pulls a handkerchief out of his mouth and it never ends. The LONGEST string of hair ever! My coworker asked, what are you going to do? 1st thought...leave! As crazy as it was, i wanted the lunch. Trying not to draw attention(looking back, i should have made a scene) as people were within 3 feet away from us eating also. I got up and went to my waiter near the bar and let him know i had a long string of hair in my bread. His reply &#34;oh no&#34;. Expecting a manager to come check or atleast verify, the waiter brought us more bread...and left the plate with the hair. Speeding up the review,  he brought the food and I let him know, bro here is the plate with hair in it. He looked and had to realize it was not his as he was bald, not mine or the dude across from me. We ate our food and thinking maybe my meal would be discounted...or something. Dude came back...here&#39;s your cheesecake...you guys have a nice day. Some say i should have flipped out, i felt better going back to work and showing everyone the picture to make sure they dont go there for lunch or team luncheons.<br>***Update***<br>Generic response from Guest Services, directing me to complete another review/comments. No response after doing so. Completely unacceptable.

We love the crab bites, the cocktails, and the cheesecake. We always receive great service when we visit no matter how busy it gets. <br><br>We try to sit at the bar when we can, but a cozy booth is just as good. My favorite cheesecake is the Banana Cream, my husband likes the Vanilla Bean. Occasionally we switch it up, so this time I ordered the Cinnabon. It was really good...tasted just like a Cinnabon. The Pumpkin  Pecan is really good too. It&#39;s a winter seasonal, so it may not be around much longer. Get it while you can.
The service was just ok but it is always a great time at the Cheesecake Factory! Fried Mac n cheese balls along with orange chicken was delicious.

We ordered Curbside to go with a guaranteed pickup time of 6:40. We got there at 6:45 and called the number for 20 minutes with no answer at all. Went inside and finally found a worker that went to check on my food. Almost an hour later they brought me my food. I would have left but had already paid when I ordered. No apologies or comp of any sort. Got home and had ordered a chicken dish that was supposed to be served over veggies and farro....nope. About 3 half Spears of asparagus and a spoonful of brown rice...not even farro. Will never go back. Awful. The manager was trying to be friendly but anyone else I tried to talk to was rude and looked miserable.

Put our name in and we&#39;re told 1-1/2 to 2 hours. No big deal as we&#39;ve been here before and expect this type of wait. However after an hour and a half were told still 14 names still in front of ours. Over heard others say they&#39;ve been waiting over 4 hours. The staff should be trained way better than this and should know not to tell people a two hour wait. We got the excuse that people are just sitting and not leaving, yeah I get that but your whole restaurant? Cmon you&#39;ve got to do better.
Waited 2 hours for a piece of cheesecake. They could not  keep the line moving even though it should not be an issue. <br><br>Cheesecake was sloppy when I got it. Very disappointed!

Went here last Thursday for lunch with my visiting granddaughter.  She hadn&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory before so we thought we&#39;d try it.  Got there about 11:30 or so and had about a 10-15 minute wait.  We were seated in a nice booth after about 10 minutes.<br><br>The waitress quickly took our drinks of a Coke and unsweetened tea.  I wanted my granddaughter to try  the Avocado Egg Roll (my favorite item here) so we ordered that for an appetizer.  It&#39;s the best thing on the menu!  Hot (temperature wise), crispy and has the best sauce you&#39;ll ever find.  She loved it.<br><br>For entrees she ordered the lunch size Alfredo.  I ordered an Herbed Crusted Salmon with asparagus and sauce.  She really liked her Alfredo...took half home since she couldn&#39;t finish it all.  My salmon was good and it had a nice sauce of some type (either a lemon/cream or beurre blanc type).   The asparagus was good, but a bit too al dente for me.<br><br>Great restaurant.  One problem is they have such a huge selection on the menu it makes it hard to choose what you want.  The other is the price.  Quite expensive.  I noticed that their hamburgers were $12-$15.<br><br>Don&#39;t go here often and I probably won&#39;t due to the prices.   Great place and food, but the prices and other optional choices in the area put this lower on my list.  <br><br>I&#39;m only giving it 3 stars.  Food deserves 4-5 stars, but overall the pricing and other issues bring it down a bit.

Waitress was sort of lazy and kind of rude.  Every time we asked for something she left in a huff and just threw it at us.  She also barely came around to check on us.  The grilled chicken was so dry I almost choked.   No clue how so many people like to come eat here.   Still left a 20% tip because we are nice people. But that waitress has some serious customer service skills to learn.

C plus at best. We had reservations and were seated immediately. Restaurant was extremely cold. Did not appear to be that busy when we were there. Waitress was good with several exceptions.  We had to ask for salt and pepper. New York strip steak was cooked nicely but potatoes were warm at best and green beans were horrible. Wife didnt care for the skinny potpie   I had to actually ask for a steak knife. We ordered dessert and waited about 20 minutes for 2 cheesecakes which were delivered without clean silverware.  Wife&#39;s coffee came without a clean spoon.  Ladies Room was not properly equipped with paper products and men&#39;s Room had trash flowing out of each of the trash cans onto the floor. This was my 1st visit to your restaurant and I have no intention of returning. This was the occasion of our 32nd wedding anniversary and it was quite disappointing..

While most people might say you shouldn&#39;t leave the Cheesecake Factory without trying their delicious cheesecakes, I say you shouldn&#39;t leave without trying their Avocado Rolls (and their cheesecakes of course). <br><br>We ordered the Avocado Rolls ($11.95) for an appetizer and they came out warm and fresh. They TASTED AMAZING. I would add their avocado rolls to my favorite dishes of all time. They are filled with soft avocados, peppers, tomatoes(?), and some amazing magic because I honestly can&#39;t quite pinpoint why the flavor is so delicious! It also comes with a side of sweet green sauce that tastes really good with the rolls in moderation (I prefer less of the sauce since it is very sweet but it&#39;s entirely up to personal preference). The texture of the egg roll balanced with the filling inside is also perfect. It really was the highlight of the meal along with the cheesecake. <br><br>We also decided to try some of their sandwiches and they were both decent. I had the Chicken Parmesan Sandwich ($14.95) and my dinner date had the Cuban Sandwich ($13.95). Not anything that I&#39;d order again (since their pasta and other dishes are better in my opinion). It wasn&#39;t a bad sandwich, but it definitely doesn&#39;t compare to their other dishes on the menu that I&#39;ve had before. The bread on both the Chicken Parmesan and Cuban Sandwiches just seemed a bit dry and it was not the most exciting thing I&#39;ve had. <br><br>Lastly, their Red Velvet Cheesecake was amazing! Honestly I was glad we ordered a lighter entree to save our stomachs for the star of the show. It&#39;s the perfect texture and sweetness and honestly no one would expect less of a cheesecake from the CHEESECAKE factory. <br><br>I&#39;ve eaten at this location several times over several years and their staff is always very friendly and their quality of food is always up to par. Definitely coming back and so glad we got those avocado rolls.

I always make a stop here whether I&#39;m dining in or just to pick up a slice of cheesecake. This location is always busy doesn&#39;t matter what time of day you come. The staff are pleasant but at times you can see that they are over whelmed with the crowd. I always have a nice time desire the wait time. Plenty of parking and valet parking is offered here as well.

Drove 30 minutes to pick up my order. They handed it to me and I drove home only to find that they gave me half of my food.   Had to drive back to get the missing food. They did not offer anything other then to say that the food was remade fresh. At a time where you&#39;re trying to keep our local businesses going you would think they would appreciate the customer more.  Not that I wanted anything, but simply an apology would have been nice especially after spending $110.

I didn&#39;t get a picture of my food because by the time it came I was starving. The service was not as good as it usually was. The waitress wasn&#39;t warm and welcoming like I&#39;m used to. I ordered a salad and a lot of the lettuce was brown. Also the chicken on the salad was extremely salty. I&#39;d say the best part of my meal was the pineapple mojito. The mojito is consistently good! <br>(Visited on 6/20/19)

C&#39;mon cheesecake, get it together with your to go orders. Been here twice for lunch. Same order. Both times it was incomplete. Why is it so hard to make a Chinese chicken salad with extra dressing? <br>First time no dressing at all but there&#39;s bread with no butter. Second time there&#39;s dressing but 2 ingredients missing from salad and no bread. Wtf?

I have been to the Cheesecake Factory many time&#39;s. However the Cheesecake Factory at the South Park mall was terrible. I ordered wings and fries and the first time. I received the meal though the wings where uncooked with pink meat in the inside. The manager apologized and brung new wings after a thirty-minute wait. The new wings where hard as a rock! I would not recommend this place..

Can anyone tell me where is good service?  I&#39;m lacking good service in my life!:( .  Food was good my service was horrible, if I have to chase my server down for every request it&#39;s just not worth my time.

Me and a few friends went here for one of our birthday dinners. Me and my friend had the cheddar stuffed burgers and it was delicious. The food was amazing and the service was even better. Our waiter Justin did a very good job so he got a very good tip. Would definitely come back here. 10/10

Took my husband for his birthday - hadn&#39;t been in over 2 years...was a great day!  We always loved going for Sunday brunch so this was a wonderful trip.  The service, atmosphere &amp; food is always amazing - we loved that Covid had the seating spaced out more than usual - it gave a little more coziness to the seating &amp; less noise.  Finished off with banana cheesecake &amp; South Park shopping

The Cheesecake Factory has been a restaurant me and my family dine in on cinco de mayo Saturday every year. Each year things seem to be a little worse than before. <br><br>Pros : <br>Our server was polite<br> the wait time was not long at all <br><br>Cons : <br>The food quality has diminished tremendously.<br><br>We were served visibly burnt chicken wing appetizers, soggy cod fish with the fish and chips and the guacamole tasted like spoonfuls of salt. I&#39;m vegetarian so my impossible burger and avocado egg rolls were fine, however my family&#39;s food was not. When confronting the manager about the wings in particularly, we were told that the food is checked by a food quality manager before it is sent out. I&#39;m assuming the food quality manager is either blind or was off from work because there is no way anyone passed those chicken wings as acceptable. As a yearly family tradition, I think this may be our last visit. We have tried to work with this location but the last 2-3 times the food quality has just been piss poor.

This was my 2nd visit for actual food and not just cheesecake. It was lunch time so we just had an appetizer and small plates. The chicken taquitos were really good. Ate their mac n cheese balls for the 1st time and they were divine...frfr. I really need to learn and make these in my own. Our waiter (Marc) was awesome. Super comfortable to talk to and knew how to recommend menu items and just really be the type of server we needed. He always came to the table with a smile and it was genuine. I was highly surprised and happy that the chairs with arms were able to fit my derrière and it was comfy. <br><br>Ok, the negative. The bathroom was not clean. It was smelly (at times this can&#39;t be helped sit to people) and really needed some TLC. The prices of cheesecake I selected to go (Mango KeyLime) was not as good as the slice I had at the Factory in Chicago. I highly doubt the recipe changed but it was just not to my liking. I really disliked the super sweet coconut layer which sits between the cheesecake and the crust. I don&#39;t recall this layer in Chicago but I could totally be mistaken. Just my opinion today. <br><br>After this experience and service, I will return again. I said I wouldn&#39;t do it after going to the one in the Raleigh NC area but glad my friend suggested we come to this one.

We are very upset with the service and with our meals we received.  The 3 Crispy Chickens Costoletta were missing the sauces.  This is unacceptable due to the sauce is what makes this meal and why we order three of them.<br>We were also missing the Pineapple Upside-Down Cheese cake.  Unbelievable<br>We were told to be in the parking lot at 1pm.  Never received a text to let us know you were running 45 to an hour late!!!!!!!!  We waiting an hour for our food and then it was wrong.<br>I will put in a claim asking for my money back , $169.28 spent on this order and it was missing the sauces and a cheese cake.<br>Way to ruin a mother&#39;s day meal.<br>I want my money back or a replacement meal.<br>I expect an email reply today ASAP.<br>Very upset customer,<br><br>DO NOT ORDER AND SPEND YOUR MONEY AT THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Appetizer was Spinach &amp; artichoke dip which is always warm, creamy and amazing. I love the sour cream and salsa  on the side. My main entree Hibachi steak , mashed potatoes and Tempura Green Beans arrived kind of cold. Service was pretty good at this location. It was very busy. The waiter did his best to keep up on such a busy holiday weekend.

I have been to The Cheesecake Factory before and everything has been fine, I wish tonight would have been the same.  We had no trouble getting a table which is a big yay.  That is where the good ends.  We had to wait an hour for our food. Seriously, this is not an exaggeration. The medium burger was barely a rare if not raw.  The cheesecake order was mixed up and we had to wait again.  The bathrooms were a mess. I noticed employees carrying clean dishes that were balanced on their pants, I saw this happening more than once!  Our server, Johnathan, was very attentive and tried to make things right.  I guess he would be another yay.  I saw the managers walking around but not one bothered to check in with us, I guess our faces said it all. It will be a long time before I come back here.

It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory so the cheesecake is delicious. Unfortunately, the food is just so-so, and the service is TERRIBLE!!!!  Slow, uncaring wait staff, and a complete don&#39;t give a shit attitude from the top down completely ruin the experience. <br><br>Today we tried the &#34;Curbside-to-go&#34; in an effort to skip the shitty service, but alas it still took 20 minutes to get two pieces of cheesecake that we ordered 15 minutes before we arrived. <br><br>It&#39;s a good thing the cheesecake is so good, or I would never return. But the CHEESECAKE IS THAT GOOD, so next time I&#39;ll call foodie call or uber eats to deal with the crappy service and just have the cheesecake delivered.

Super slow service!!! Everytime I have been here be it a party of 2 or 10 we have observed slow service. No major complains about the food though but sometimes a long wait can just frustrate you. This recent visit on a Friday afternoon was similar with not even the bread being ready after 45 mins we were seated.Focusing on the food it&#39;s a little pricey but good portion. Love the Tex Mex eggrolls and chicken samusa.One time the server mentioned about the bang bang chicken &amp;shrimp is a love or hate dish. So you can choose accordingly based on the ingredients. The chicken enchiladas we&#39;re very average and lack of red sauce was noticable. They have good cheesecake and dessert options.

I got the eggplants Parmesan and whew so good! The chicken was breaded perfectly and the chicken wasn&#39;t dry like other chicken Parmesans I&#39;ve had. The pasta was perf as well. I would suggested requesting for a side of marinara sauce because the sauce that is on the chicken parm wouldn&#39;t be sufficient for the pasta. That&#39;s just a personal preference. I&#39;m super greedy as well and I just KNEW I was going to have room for cheesecake at the end, but this was a pretty heft portion. <br><br>The staff was super attentive and pleasant, especially considering we had a party of 12 and he took care of us on his own. If I had any negative to say about my visit, it would be the lighting but I&#39;m sure PLENTY of people complain about how dark it is in there LOL

This particular location does not honor yelp reservations.  The manager specifically told me that they won&#39;t honor yelp email confirmations after asking me if I had received it.  I show it to him and then he said since he did have it in his system, it would not be honored.  Horrible Horrible Horrible!  I am very disappointed Cheesecake Factory.   You just might loose this big spender. Sad!!!<br><br>Welp!   I made a bone head mistake! It seems as I selected the wrong time slot when I made my reservation.  Initially neither the manager nor I saw the PM on the reservation.  This was an odd moment as I have always received great customer service from The Cheesecake Factory.  So glad it was my error and I was able to fix my review.

Waited half hour to get my glass of wine. Waited one and half hours for dinner. Waiter never once came to<br>Check on us after got our food. When food arrived it was cold. Needed napkins and silverware. When waiter brought to us he brought bar napkins instead of dinner napkins and dropped hand full of silverware on our table. Wow. Never had an experience like this at a Cheesecake Factory before. It was awful.
This is the slowest restaurant I&#39;ve been to in my fucking life don&#39;t ever order to go or doordash here they&#39;ll make you wait a fucking hour and forget your entire order fuck this place

My grandson took me to the Cheesecake Factory for the first time in Charlotte. The service was great and the food was delicious. We had the <br>Louisiana Chicken Pasta and of course cheese cake with a cup of good old southern coffee.<br>    This was a night out to relax,talk and eat in a atmosphere where we felt safe and comfortable.

Didn&#39;t like this place at all!. It is very overpriced, the portions are very big but because the food is so nasty it&#39;s probably all leftovers no one eats. I got the Cajun jambalaya pasta and almost thru up when I saw it. The pasta had no flavor at all. Wouldn&#39;t go out of my way again for this place unless I was craving cheesecake slice. The host was extremely rude as well.

Generally, I&#39;m not the type to complain, and I&#39;m certainly not the type to write a review. But this time, I just felt totally disrespected. I called in for a take out order for my wife&#39;s lunch. Quick answer, but the wait to place my order was painful... 22 minutes! And when I finally got a response, I let the gentleman know that I had been on hold for 20 minutes. He proceeded to say, &#34;Nah. I just walked by. It couldn&#39;t have been 20 minutes.&#34; Well, attached is the phone log as a photo. <br><br>Now, perhaps I woke up on the wrong side of the bed, but even a small apology would&#39;ve been more acceptable!!! I know the job is stressful, but common courtesy over complete dismissal isn&#39;t too much to ask, in my opinion.<br><br>And after I walked in, I waited several more minutes in line to place my take out order. Then, after being told &#34;no more than 15 minutes&#34;, I waited 25 more minutes for a tuna poke and a cheesecake slice. <br><br>I like Cheesecake Factory, and my wife loves it. So I can&#39;t say this will be my last time here. I just know going in that I can&#39;t expect even decent customer service, and that&#39;s very unfortunate.

I have visited this location many times. Needless to say I am not impressed with the way the waiters handled cleanliness when I visited recently. The waiter touched his mask while talking to us and used the same gloves to open doors and handle food. To add insult to injury there was a dead fly in the cheesecake display. The girl behind the case smashed it with her finger then wiped it. I did not order cheesecake after witnessing that. The entire case is unappealing and could use a good cleaning. Definitely a turn off.

So just about 2 hours in. My rare steak has already come out as shoe leather. New steak makes it out after everyone is done. It&#39;s meh. Still no dessert but they sure made sure I had my bill.  Probably the single most disappointing Cheesecake Factory visit ever.  The cheesecake better be the bomb.<br>Yep still no cheesecake

Food was enjoyable but service was lacking compared to other cheesecake factories I have visited.  Visited for brunch and although there were not too many people- service was extremely slow for getting our drinks, food and even menus. The food was good as usual. I ordered the chicken and waffles eggs Benedict.

Just a word of warning...  if you&#39;re ordering pickup, go through Doordash.  I ordered online (direct) and ended up waiting 40 minutes beyond my pickup time, while watching the Doordash orders flying out.  They certainly seemed to be the priority.  Meanwhile my food was 40 minutes late, and room temp...   though I was told it had not been sitting around.<br><br>I know the cheesecake will make up for some of the lost time and mediocre meal, but probably not enough to bring me back.

Waited 30 minutes for table, waiter came immediately to table and took drink and food order.  50 minutes later still waiting, finally another waiter brought cold food and one dish, the chicken Alfredo was so runny and tasteless, was sent back with orders not to bring it again. While waiting on checks visited bathroom, was so disgusting, dirty, smelled, 2 stalls had no toilet paper. Will not visit this restaurant again<br>  Have to say the cheesecake was very good.  Would stop in to get cheesecake to go.

This restaurant has become totally unusable! This is my 2nd time trying to go because I love the food, but can&#39;t get in!  Instead of expanding at another location,  they are crammed into a tiny hole in Southpark Mall.  There is no room inside to move around and you can&#39;t  get a seat without a 3-hour wait.  Reservations?  Don&#39;t think about it!  Wait 3 hours so you can be crammed into a table where you can&#39;t move.  Suggestion:  since business is so good, why not open another nearby location like Concord or Huntersville?  Maybe get out of that expensive mall space and EXPAND!

I love the Cheesecake Factory in Greenville. This was my first time at the Charlotte location and I was very disappointed. First off it was freezing and we asked if we could sit outside we were told no it was closed. Ok no problem! We then waited about 15 mins before the waitress even address us. She walked pass several times but no assistance. She finally came took our order. Waited about 20 mins for bread... the bread came about 5 mins before our food came.  Food was bland and over cooked. I will not be returning to that location
This burger was so good and the fries are a plus! The Oreo cheese cake is a must try!!

Came here for the first time and the food did not disappoint! I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 because it seemed a little unorganized staff-wised but other than that, the food was amazing! I had the fried calamari as my appetizer and a miso salmon with brown rice (they ask if you want white rice or brown rice) and snow peas. Not sure if the peas were cooked or not, though, but still good! Will definitely come again for my birthday!

This is experience was very surreal it was absolutely amazing and the food was really fresh and good although my food got cold because of the air conditioning inside the building it was awesome here&#39;s quite a few pictures of me and my friends food

We had a very good experience here. It wasn&#39;t as crowded as we thought it would be. Our waiter Pierre was excellent suggesting our food. The shrimp and chicken jumbalya pasta excellent! Vegan menu was available also. Great experience which was surprising. We will try it again.

Second visit so knew more about what to expect.  Around a 25 min wait and was seated around the time given. <br><br>Server was polite, funny and provided great service.  Party of 9 and no one ever had to ask for a drink refill.  <br><br>The food was brought out quickly and everything was hot.  All the orders were correct.  <br><br>Everyone was pleased with their food.  <br><br>All in all a good experience.

It is amazing how inefficiently run this establishment is. I honestly believe the reason why this place has an extensive wait is because they do not know how to function efficiently. Sure, the food is good, and their menu has something for everyone, but that won&#39;t keep people coming back when their service is so terribly slow and poorly run. <br><br>Tonight was just a night to come in a get a slice of to-go cheesecake. Not a sit down meal, but just a cheesecake slice from the counter, boxed up to enjoy at home (as they were on a three hour wait at 8pm). I was able to walk up, choose my two slices from the counter and pay in record time, and was informed it would be about five minutes. Well, fast forward 40, that&#39;s right FORTY, minutes, I was still standing there, waiting for my to-go cheesecake. There were at least 6 employees behind the counter, but maybe 3 doing work. When my name was finally called, I gladly accepted my order, then stepped away to check it. Well, one of my cheesecakes was wrong, so back to the counter I went, where I was informed, rather rudely, that it would be about 20 minutes for my correct slice....that I could still see, sitting in the case. Rather than waiting, I just took the cheesecakes and left. <br><br>I&#39;m not sure the deliciousness of the cheesecakes can counter the amazingly poor experience I just went through.

We&#39;ve eaten here several times and although the menu is expansive, and the food is usually great, the service is awful. I truly wish there was another Cheesecake Factory in the area because no matter what time you come, you&#39;re looking at a minimum of an hour wait. We came to dinner at 5pm and it was an hour and a half wait and they couldn&#39;t even give us a buzzer because they had run out. We ended up eating at the food court instead and then waiting in line at the bakery for some to-go cheesecake. We waited 30 minutes to order our cheesecake and 30 minutes to actually receive said cheesecake. They have a horrible system with people everywhere. And disappointingly, the to-go cheesecakes are about half the size of you order in-restaurant (yeah that&#39;s right, I noticed). <br><br>When we&#39;ve actually sat down to eat here, waiters are impossible to find and cleanliness is hit or miss. The food has always been great, but seeing as it&#39;s a popular chain, I don&#39;t really want to rate it based on food quality. The bathrooms are always clean and the atmosphere is nice. Like I said, I truly wish there was another Cheesecake Factory because this one doesn&#39;t take the cake (pun intended).

I alway have a love/hate relationship with Cheesecake Factory. I love their food but I hate that you can&#39;t make a reservation, the waits is alway forever, and the portion is alway so damn big. <br>On the cold Sunday, it&#39;s no different. We were excited to have brunch at Cheesecake. Arrived at 12:30. Didn&#39;t get seated til 1:45pm but our waitress couldn&#39;t take our orders til after 2pm so we missed our brunch deadline! So I opted for small plates of chicken samosas and the crab cakes balls. Both were very salty. Therefore, I couldn&#39;t finish it. My usual herb crusted salmon with mashed potatoes was great. The kids love their options. All in all. Service was great. Our food took a long time to get to us as usual due to how busy they are. And it&#39;s nothing new there. But again, our server was doing the best she can!

Back story --Yesterday my boyfriend ordered from here because I love their pasta di Vinchi. We ordered a bunch of stuff , but the delivery person must have forgotten a bag or the order wasn&#39;t right because we were missing my pasta and some fries. The delivery person went back to the restaurant to sort it out and came back an hour later with the rest of our order. <br><br>While I was eating my pasta I found a piece of metal that looks like it&#39;s from a Brillo pad in my food.

This restaurant is beautiful but the customer service and food is terrible! We waited over an hour for our food after we ordered. One of the the entrees came out different then what was on the menu. When we told the waiter, he argued with us and told us there is nothing he could do. The second entree was the skinnylicious chicken pot pie. It tasted awful and was not fully cooked. This is the second time we tried this restaurant and we were upset both times.
I don&#39;t like how they won&#39;t allow you to call in reservations and that this app don&#39;t show the reservations open already!

It&#39;d been a couple of years since we&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory, so while visiting the area we decided to stop off and grab a bite to eat.  My wife had the Chicken Piccata and I had the Sante Fe Salad.  My wife enjoyed her dish very much, but my dish was a bit lackluster.  My salad had so much salad dressing that I was unable to finish.  By the time I got to the bottom of the salad it looked like chicken noodle soup instead of a healthy salad.  Next time (I&#39;m sure it&#39;ll be another 2 years) I&#39;ll make sure to ask for the dressing on the side.
Wow...<br><br>We had a great meal at the Cheesecake Factory. <br>The food was delicious and the bartender was extremely friendly. We will be coming back. The desert was incredible

My daughter treated me to lunch at The Cheesecake Factory. I was reluctant to go since I&#39;d been once before many years ago and found it to be too large and overwhelming, and only mediocre as far as the food goes. We went and I had the crusted chicken Romano, which came with pasta. My daughter had a steak with mashed potatoes and green beans. We had to wait quite a while for the complimentary bread. The waiter told us three times that it would be out soon. When it finally came I have to say it tasted perfect. Crusty on the outside, hot and soft on the inside, just the way I like it. My food was pretty good, but I wouldn&#39;t order it again because it wasn&#39;t anything special that I couldn&#39;t make at home. It wasn&#39;t hot when it arrived, either. Just warm, and I like my food hot. And the pasta was in a creamy marinara sauce which was too heavy for my taste. My daughter enjoyed her steak dinner. I heard no complaints about it. We were overwhelmed by the many cheesecake choices so we went with the waiter&#39;s recommendation, a cinnamon bun concoction. We shared it. It was DELICIOUS!!  It was of ample size to share. I was trying so hard not to keep eating it because the calorie count was incredible. I can only imagine the fat count!! We did manage to take part of it home. <br>If you visit during lunchtime be prepared to wait. Fortunately, even though we were told it would be 20 to 30 minutes, we only waited about five minutes or so. And I&#39;m so happy we were seated in a part of the restaurant that was more cozy and quiet. <br>Overall, a pretty good experience. I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;d be able to count on it the next time though. But I might try again another day.

This is not my first time here, I live very close so I normally come in for cocktails &amp; apps on a weekday, the weekend waits are always too long. Never really had any issues in the past. However, this weekend decided to bring my family that we&#39;re visiting. The service was horrible, the waiter acted like he didn&#39;t want to be bothered, we literally had to ask for silverware. The food had to be sent back several times for being cold, and over cooked. Come on,! How in the world do you serve burnt Belgian waffles? The drinks were watery. I saw several other people complaining and walking out. Others were sending their food back too. They really need to get it right. I asked the manager for a different server at the beginning and instead of addressing our concerns she blamed the bakery for slow hot cocoa drinks and didn&#39;t replace the server. Just a terrible experience. It&#39;ll be a very long time before I go back &amp; it would never be on my dime.

Food is not the worst - had the burger sliders and Texas style egg rolls - but the service is extreeeemely slow. I would also advise against getting the cheese cake as the wait for that added at least another 30 - 45 minutes to our already unreasonably long wait for service. I also overheard 2 other tables nearby complaining to management regarding the wait as well. <br><br>I had not been here in a long time and definitely will not be coming back.

Much better experience this time at CF. <br><br>5 stars for our friendly server !!<br>4 stars for yummy appetizers and cheesecake (still think the mushroom appetizer is a bit small) <br>2 stars for hostesses... we got our buzzer before several parties of two... and we were seated AFTER the other parties. Here I am 35 weeks pregnant and leaning against the wall beside hostess stand. Seemed a little unprofessional to not look out for people who clearly need to be seated in order (not special privledged or anything, just in order they arrived- in same party size). <br><br>Overall much better than past experiences and hopefully I can come try their wraps again sometime.

My daughter and I have been on a quest to eat every cheesecake on the menu. This is no small feat given the variety at Cheesecake Factory. Our once-a-month visits had taken us to CF locations all over the East Coast.  Sadly, this location ranks among the worst.  The lines are atrocious, service is mediocre, and even the desserts weren&#39;t fresh.  After three visits here, we&#39;ve decided enough is enough. The most frustrating element here is the worn out excuse the hostess gives to virtually everyone who inquires about the misstated wait time. &#39;I&#39;m sorry for the extra twenty minutes you&#39;ve waited...we had a large party, and as soon as we clean up after them we&#39;ll seat a bunch of people.&#39;  <br>I have eyes, and there is no large party; we&#39;re a group of two, so you wouldn&#39;t be moving tables to accommodate us; and you gave us that excuse last time.  Great menu, but you need improvements otherwise.

This place has just went down hill over the passed couple years. You&#39;d expect the cheesecake to be good but that wasn&#39;t great either. I ordered a piece of original cheesecake w hot fudge and by time I got it the fudge was cold.

I usually enjoy Cheesecake Factory. You would think by now they would know how to handle a Friday night. <br><br>First and foremost; your doors are broken. They slammed shut 1000 times in the lengthy time I was standing waiting on a slice of cheesecake to go. Someone is going to get injured.<br><br>The bathroom looked like Armageddon. Not a paper towel to be found, the box pried open, the sanitary napkin dispenser ripped open.<br><br>We waited forty minutes for our to go. The guy in front of us ordered his online and waited longer than us! The poor girl at the Togo register had to check people out, bag the cheesecake, and call the names. Occasionally someone would step over and say &#34;you got this.&#34; and move back. Completely ridiculous and inefficient system. I walked to cancel my order but it would have been next to impossible.<br><br>We were looking forward to lunch there today but have definitely changed course.

Sooo good! This was my first time at this restaurant and I was very happy. It was very busy with many people waiting for a seat... So being on my own I chose to sit at the bar. Roland, one of the bartenders, made me one of the best Long Island Ice teas (top shelf) that I&#39;ve ever had. The woman next to me tried (some sort of) peach drink and she seemed to really like it. I watched them making Mojitos and decided that I&#39;d definitely get one of those on my next visit. <br>   The Asian sesame cauliflower was really good and I fell off the diet wagon with some of the Peanut butter cup cheesecake. <br><br>Give Cheesecake Factory a try if you&#39;re at South Park Mall.. they&#39;ll give you a buzzer so you can browse the mall while waiting on a tab

Took my son here for dinner on his 18th Birthday. The wait was not long as it usually is probably because it was a Wednesday. The service was slow for some reason. It took a long time for our appetizers to come out. Also, the food was not that great. I had the herb crusted salmon and it was lukewarm. The mashed potatoes were not hot nor was the asparagus. The food was not up to the standards for what I expected from this restaurant. I think quality has really gone down over the years. I did get cheesecake to go. It was decent. The pieces continue to vary in size I guess depending on who cuts it and what kind. I don&#39;t know. If I go here again it will only be for the cheesecake. Nothing else.

We came to this restaurant to celebrate birthdays and Mother&#39;s Day. The wait is often long but worth it. We like going here because there is something for every taste. My daughter likes the pasta dishes while I like the sweet corn tamales. I always get them! My son had fish and chips while his girlfriend had a shrimp dish. My son in law had a burger and my husband had fish tacos. The dishes all came at the same time. Everyone enjoyed their meal. The portions are large and can often leave you with take home. I don&#39;t know if another restaurant that allows us to order such a wide variety and have every dish be so pleasing. The food is well seasoned. <br>I&#39;m not a big fan of the cheesecake, not that it is not good it is just not what I like.  My daughter and husband are fans and ordered it to go. <br>They have a full bar. The selection of beer was well represented. The prices are very fair for the quality of food. A great place to celebrate with the family.

We ordered dinner for seven tonight. Pick up went good, all food was there. All entrees were below average. Mushroom burger ordered rare was mid well and unseasoned. Fries unseasoned and not golden brown. At $15 for a burger I expect better. Salmon was dry, rice bland. Very disappointed overall.

There&#39;s no Cheesecake Factory&#39;s where I live so when I travel to an area that has one I&#39;ll always go! I arrived around 730p on a Sunday and it seemed to be a little bit of a wait by observation so I decided to sit at the bar. The bartender was attentive with getting my water and food order at a decent time after sitting. The bar was pretty empty about five minutes after I arrived so they had time to clean up and stuff.  Food came about fifteen minutes after I ordered and it was delicious! No complaints here.

Waitress was nice enough food was over cooked yet cold so I was a little confused.  The staff brought out food for other tables that did not belong to us several times after a while I canceled my food and watched my fiancé eat I was so over it. Will not visit this location again oh we came in on a Sunday during brunch never again!

Visited Cheesecake Factory yesterday for lunch with a friend. We were excited to go since our previous experiences were good. My friend ordered the filet mignon and I ordered the Chinese Chicken salad. The restaurant was about 1/4 full. Our food took a whopping 45 min to arrive at the table. In that time waiting the server came by only once to tell us the food was arriving but it still took 20 minutes.<br>My friend ordered her steak medium but when she cut into it it was rare. Almost blue. By that time the server did not come again to check on us. My salad was virtually tasteless as very little dressing was used. We did not have time to address food issues with the server because we were rushed on time.<br>We will  not be visiting the restaurant again

Met here for a friends birthday dinner &amp; I arrived first so I sat in the bar area since everyone was running late. I&#39;m so glad I did because I forgot all about their Happy Hour! (Food only of course) Me &amp; one other who arrived decided to order some HH apps since we were hungry and the menu is only available from 4p- 6p. We got the crab &amp; artichoke dip, chicken potstickers, and the pork belly sliders.<br>I also got the passion fruit margarita for my drink. All is the appetizers are $5.95 and the full size. The dip is amazing &amp; you can see and taste the lump of crabmeat all throughout it. You got 6 good sized potstickers that have a great flavor and 4 sliders that were really good just wish the pork belly was a little bigger on it. The margarita was freaking delicious I could have ordered 5 of them if they weren&#39;t $12 a piece. I will certainly be back to indulge in the happy hour again, just wish they had drink specials as well.

Took the family out for brunch while in town for the weekend. I had the chicken and waffles. I was not a fan of the chicken and it&#39;s breading. Overall we had a great experience with our waiter and it was an opportunity to connect with family.

What&#39;s not to love? Best place for cheesecake! Food is great as well! Just wish it was a little closer to my area! Whenever I&#39;m at SouthPark Mall this is is &#34;Mist stop&#34; for us though.. They lady at the dessert bar is on point with making sure the cheesecake orders are correct!  :)

Me and my spouse drove 40 miles for two slices of cheesecake. After leaving and driving approximately 20 miles I realized that the person who brought our order out did not give me my debit card back. I immediately called and the young lady said, oh yes, we have it. I told her we had driven over 20 miles and her response was just bring your ID. Not even an, I&#39;m sorry or no complimentary offer.<br>Well, when I picked up my wife&#39;s card after driving 15 miles to get back to the restaurant , I asked if we could get something complimentary and I was told that my wife failed to take her card out of the the card folder when they delivered the food to the car. I said so you are saying this is our fault and she said, &#34;that&#39;s what happened&#34;. I guess they don&#39;t train their workers to share any responsibility for the handling of debit cards. By the way, I had to ask the employee to go back and get eating utensils as well. This is not good  customer service. But I feel that they should share some responsibility for this. We live in Kings Mountain and will not be coming back to this location
I can go on &amp; on about this particular Cheesecake Factory! The drinks are delicious (honey bourbon). Quality customer service! The food is always flavorful &amp; served in a time

Well they successfully did it again! Slow Slow Slow terrible Service!! But that&#39;s not the worse part!! This location has managers that absolutely do not care!! This is two weekends in a row. <br><br>We came in the 10 o&#39;clock hour on a today on Saturday and ordered the combo and French toast. We were one of three tables on The patio. It took us over an hour to get our food. When we got it the bacon was not hot. My husband asked for salt and pepper, it never came....you know what else never came, a manager to at least apologize for the outrageous wait. <br><br>The issue isn&#39;t your food. It starts with your managers and then the wait staff that don&#39;t really understand customer service. <br><br>Our entire experience could have been different if our server would have shown an ounce of care and if the managers would support the servers when the issue is out of the servers hands like long food delivery times.<br><br>What will you do to fix this Cheesecake Factory?

We haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory in a long time. We were nervous because of the reviews, sometimes I think people are just more likely to review bad... we had reservations at 445 but arrived around 415 and were seated right away (that being said it was a Tuesday before 6 so there were literally probably 8 people in the whole restaurant. The food was honestly delicious. It did take a while to come out but nothing crazy. We had the southwest eggrolls which were awesome. Our bread we recieved as appetizer was stale but they brought out a different batch and it was much better. My husband had a flatbread which he liked and I had the lousiana chicken pasta... wow it was so good and a large portion. My son had the kids tenders and fries and even they were delicious and everything was hot and fresh tasting. The restaurant for the prices I will say as other reviews stated could&#39;ve been cleaner (nothing horrible, just a lot of food or napkins around tables and booth, we had to kind of wipe our table off). I also had a coconut mojito which was the best I have ever had as far as a mojito. And last but CERTAINLY not least dessert..... omg their cheesecake obviously is just the best! We tried the celebration, the cinnabon and the strawberry original. So good! We would be back. I also think at our dinner time they were possibly doing shift change or something which was a tad noticable because our waiter was gone for a while but we still had drinks filled when needed and bread. We enjoyed it!

I came here for my year Anniversary with my spouse and what a horrible experience I ordered a rib eye steak with the works sounds great right not !!!!!!!!!!!!  Just starting to eat my plate and I pull a hair out of my mouth from one of the cooks and a hair on the mash potatoes !!!!!! <br><br>Manager comes offers to get me another plate <br>Does it look like I have a appetite for more hair on my food ? No I wasn&#39;t offered anything in return for my bad first time experience here <br><br>In the words of a wise man fuck this place huge disappointment what a waste of space in South Park Mr Manager next time tell your cooks to shave I like my steak and mash potatoes without hair thanks
I know it&#39;s Saturday night but waited an hour and our wait got bumped up to nearly 4 hours for 2 adults and 2 kids. Ended up leaving.

Decided to sit at the bar and knock out some work on my laptop and the bartender decides to talk my ear off (just because you sit at the bar doesnt mean you HAVE to be social. When you walk into cheesecake if theres free seats at the bar you can sit there freely). Bartender starts telling me about how they failed the health inspection few weeks ago and how the health inspector was unnecessarily tough on them (mind you they were in the news and the health inspector caught them plating food without gloves and dead roaches under the table) so im sitting and conversing and then my food comes out. I order the chicken sandwich w/ fries. <br><br>Half way into my sandwich. LITERALLY HALF WAY lol i notice something weird is rubbing against my gum. I assume its that little weird clear hard piece of lettuce thats on burgers sometime but i feel a scrape against my mouth. So i try and spit it out (at this point the bartender is kinda looking at me to make sure im good) so i spit out an actual piece of lettuce and keep chewing and low and behold. I feel something else and i spit it out. Well what do you know. Theres a piece of wire (fiber wire from the fry basket that the manager later confirms) in my burger! The bartender watches me spit it out and gets the manager. <br><br>Seriously cheesecake factory? Id expect something like this from applebees or shoneys or some horrible place to eat like that, but you guys? Extremely shocked. Please do better. The fact that i find fiber wire in my burger is disgusting. ALSO the fact that you guys plate fold WITHOUT gloves is DISGUSTING. THATS U N S A N A T A R Y. WE DONT CARE IF YOUR HANDS ARE CLEAN OR NOT. USE GLOVES AT ALL TIMES. THATS DISGUSTING.

It has been sometime since I&#39;ve eaten here. I&#39;m still salty at them for getting rid of the pineapple upside down cheesecake.  I&#39;m still in rehab!  Visited for lunch.  All the staff I encountered were pleasant and my waitress was very good.  I ordered the pepperoni pizza, which was thin crust.  It tasted really good, but  I prefer a crispy crust.  If your style is the floppy New York Pizza style, you will really enjoy it.  For dessert I had the strawberry shortcake.  I will not order it again, as the cake part is actually biscuits, hard biscuits.  Maybe if it was a lighter fluffier biscuit I would have enjoyed it.  They did have a skinny side menu, which I thought was nice.  <br>10/19/18

Had a reservation for 5pm but we had to wait 2 hours to get a table.. our server was apparently new at the job and was not ready for a party of 12. It took an hour for them to bring the food out, and then when they did, some orders were completely wrong. Food was okay, nothing too special.<br>The only good thing about this place was the Cheesecake.. <br>very disappointed and unfortunately everyone did NOT had a good experience. Also, very poor management and cleanliness issues.

Ehhhhhh for my bill to have came up $120+ the food was NOT worth it. And it was our first time there. But our waitress was awesome we tipped her very well and we actually don&#39;t do that often because service is usually our problem going places. The service was great, but the food was disappointing

I used to love coming to the Cheesecake Factory. I don&#39;t understand why it takes so long to get a slice of cheesecake. You would think the system would be more efficient by now. But that doesn&#39;t stop us from coming once in a while. I can&#39;t believe I have never written a review for this restaurant. My husband and I care to pick up cheesecake last night. We tried their new flavors. My husband had the Banana Cream and I had the Cherry Ghirardelli. Both were great. The 3 stars was for the hour wait it took us to get our 2 slices to go. (BTW... No that&#39;s not how my slice came. I took a bite and realized I should take a picture lol. My husband ate his too quickly so it&#39;s not pictures.)

Had to update since it&#39;s been a few years since I&#39;ve visited. <br><br>Overall, the Cheesecake Factory is good but highly overrated. Parking is convenient as there is a small lot, as well as the deck. There is valet but it looked as through they are only available at dinner time. I just wish they would update their pedestrian crossing section because if you park in the deck, you risk getting hit by the fast cars turning around the corner. There also isn&#39;t a sidewalk that wraps around the outside so you have to walk in the street until you reach said sidewalk. <br><br>The wine I ordered with my lunch was at a good temperature for a sparkling white, which was extremely refreshing. The wine and cocktail prices were on par with competitors in the area. They didn&#39;t have any specials, if that&#39;s what you&#39;re looking for.<br><br>The food was honestly better than I expected. I went for the lunch special and ordered the herb crusted salmon. It was properly cooked with no complaints. It wasn&#39;t wowing but it wasn&#39;t terrible either. <br><br>Because of my diet, or &#34;lifestyle change&#34;, I declined the cheesecake.<br><br>I view The Cheesecake Factory as being on par with Olive Garden... appears to be fancy, but really isn&#39;t. I could&#39;ve made the same meal at home, but I had a gift card to burn so it is what it is.

On a Wednesday night, my wife and I ordered two slices of cheesecake.  I though what might be a quick process turned out to be a 20 minute wait from the time we placed our order.  This was on top of a 10 minute wait to place the order despite only 1 person in front of us.

The Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant and I&#39;ve been trying to get over here since my birthday in early November.  Finally made it today and of course the food was amazing as always.  Unfortunately I&#39;m going to leave a 3 star review due to the service provided at the bar.  The bartender was at the minimum polite for sure, but there was a very noticeable difference in the service provided to me and my girlfriend compared to the party of three next to us and even the single party on the other side of us.  We weren&#39;t offered dessert. I leftovers weren&#39;t packed up for us but rather the boxes handed to us to bag ourselves. We only got offered water as she was fixing water for the party next to us. Unsure why we were treated differently but it was disappointing.

I have been to this location at least 10 times and several other locations about the same amount of times. I&#39;ve come to expect a certain level of service and experience when I go. The wait is normally long no matter when you go, but on this day, I didn&#39;t have to wait for more than 10 minutes. <br><br>The waitress brought us some bread, but it was cold and not a full order. We looked to the table next to us with the same amount of people and they had twice as much as us. We love the bread here and always look forward to it. Even after we finished our bread, we were never asked once if we wanted some more. <br><br>Before we got there, I had it in my head what I wanted, since the menu rarely changes. I have almost all 1,334 pages memorized. Undoubtably, I wanted some of the fried Mac n Cheese balls. Also, knowing that the portions can sometimes be rather large, I decided I wanted the chicken tenders.
