They say they are Cajun, but as someone who grew up eating Cajun cuisine, nothing about the feels Cajun. I just wanted them because I knew they would bring me a mountain of them. <br><br>Once the food came, I was ready to climb the plate. The chicken tenders came with succotash and an order of mashed potatoes. Everything was just as good as it&#39;s been in the past. Also, when I say they bring you a mountain of food, be prepared to have plenty left over for the next day (or so). <br><br>My wife and I split the lemon raspberry cheesecake (had no clue they even had this) and it was amazing. It&#39;s now my favorite cheesecake flavor. I can&#39;t wait to have it again<br><br>My only real complaint was the service. As I stated, I always expect a certain level of service when I go to Cheesecake Factory and during this visit, I&#39;d rank it at the bottom. I had to flag our waitress down on multiple occasions. I never felt like she cared about us and she never once checked in to see how we were doing. Other than that, my experience was still a good one.

If you order curbside from here, please be aware that its only curbside parking. They will not come out to bring you anything. Also, make sure you check for everything you&#39;ve ordered because they are becoming notorious for not including ordered items. I mean stuff you actually paid for, not bread or utensils. Its so hot outside by the patio waiting that your brain is fried and you just want run back to your car when you receive your order. But take a second and check it first!

Cheesecake Factory lines I hate. But the meal was good, and was worth the wait. They brought me butter and they brought me bread. Dreams of cheesecake filled my head. For my meal I had White Chicken Chili. I wanted every kind of cheesecake, but that would be silly. The options were many, and the service was slow. The best flavor cheesecake is Chocolate Tuxedo.
Excellent food and service. Cheesecake was amazing. I tried to eat a salad then had cheesecake to balance the carbs but just know you will blow your diet here. The temptation is just too much!

On a sunny day, we went for a lunch. We got outdoor patio seating. Avocado spring roll was really good! It is a must to get if you are an avocado lover. The green sauce that comes with was sweet and tasty. Carbonara with chicken was creamy and rich. Grilled salmon was okay. We were satisfied with our lunch under nice weather. It&#39;s been a while since I have been to this franchise Actually I didn&#39;t have high expectation on foods but our choices were good and had a nice lunch!
They need more tables and waiters.But their food is amazing.It is hard to get a table unless you wait at the bar and high tables. (Written by my 9 year old budding food critic)

The Cheesecake Factory rarely disappoints. Food is always great, menu is huge, cocktails are yummy, the service is acceptable and delicious cheesecake (duh!). This particular location is always busy it seems and very loud inside as a result. Each time I&#39;ve gone here I&#39;ve waited 15minutes to an hour at both lunch and before dinner times. I know this can&#39;t be controlled but just letting people know this place is busy! <br><br>Avoid ordering delivery for here though...three times this location completely fumbled the order and left out a few dishes, which were refunded luckily. Unsure if that&#39;s a Doordash issue though?

For the amount of time we waited (close to 1.5 hours), I was not satisfied with my experience here. <br><br>First off, we got seated at this super tiny table that basically almost touched the tables next to us. How are you even supposed to fit more than 1 plate on this tiny table?? Anyways, I ordered a blood orange margarita that came in a martini glass which was a bit odd. I liked that there was no ice, but I was so confused as to why it came in a martini glass.<br>Secondly, our bread which should have came with our appetizer or before, came to us during dinner. We asked for more bread but our waitress forgot. By the time we could have reminded her, it was too late because we were both full with our meals and were ready for dessert.<br>Third, our waitress mixed up our check with another table who ordered like 5 cheesecakes and the most expensive things on the menu. Luckily we told our waitress right away, but after she realized she gave us the wrong check, it took another 15-20 minutes for us to receive another one because she went to go track down the couple who got our check.<br>And lastly, it was SOOOO COLD. It&#39;s smack dab in the middle of the winter, what is the need for 30 degree temperatures inside the restaurant?! I didn&#39;t take my heavy winter jacket off for the 2 hours we were sitting there. So unnecessary. <br><br>I will not be back.

Obviously love the cheesecake here, however I&#39;m not happy that they got rid of the cherry topping. I used to love getting original plain cheesecake with cherries. That&#39;s no longer available. I tried the celebration cheesecake and was pleasantly surprised. It&#39;s very good, layers of cake, ice cream, and cheesecake but taste good together. I also tried the tiramisu cheesecake which was good as well. It wasn&#39;t too heavy and the flavors were put together so well. It&#39;s such a big piece of cheesecake, like they all are, that i didn&#39;t finish but it was enjoyed! I did start off with an appetizer of calamari which was well fried and good portion. It was split between 3 people and we all had plenty. Next I ordered the bang bang shrimp and chicken dish. I barely ate it and didn&#39;t want to take it home. Disappointment everywhere about the dish. It was described as spicy with coconut flavors but there was no spice to the dish. It was actually kind of sweet and coconut flavored, I liked the coconut but really was too sweet for what I wanted. I was expected a spicy, &#34;bang bang&#34; and it was just a sweet mess. I wouldn&#39;t order that ever again. Overall it was a good experience, as a chain like this should be.
I hate this place they told us we couldn&#39;t get arable because we were in the TO GO line and they couldn&#39;t take our name down and they were supper rude. I suggest not eating here.

Let me start off by saying I am normally a huge fan of this place. I am so saddened by how much this place has gone downhill this past year. My husband and I went for dinner and I had the Parmesan herb crusted chicken with green beans and mashed potatoes. My husband had the honey truffle chicken. <br>My meal came out....the chicken &#34;breading&#34; was soggy and not cooked at all. All it was was Italian bread crumbs from your local grocery store slapped onto a thick piece of dry chicken breast. They were out of mashed potatoes so I got macaroni and cheese. The Mac &amp; cheese literally tasted like kraft! The green beans were not even cooked. Ugh. So I sent my food back which is something I never do. My waitress brought it back out and all they did was burn the breading onto the chicken. Literally burnt although the breading underneath it was still soggy as hell. This time they somehow had &#34;mashed&#34; potatoes. Not mashed at all, just HUGE chunks of potatoes with absolutely no flavor. I have ordered this dinner numerous times before and I am so confused how it can be this awful now! I sent my<br>Food back and just didn&#39;t order anything else. You can get better fast food than this! My husbands meal had the strongest truffle flavor and no honey drizzle...not a big deal just not what he thought it would be. Waitress didn&#39;t really care and no manager came over to see what happened. Pretty crappy. Please don&#39;t waste your money (because this place is way overpriced) on anything here besides the cheesecake because the chefs in the back don&#39;t cook that, thank goodness!

This is a large restaurant located in the South Park mall. They are always busy or crowded it appears and there is always a wait which can range from<br> 15 minutes to 3 hours. They have valet service and you can skip the dinning experience and order to go or desserts at the counter in the front. <br><br>I was able to dine one evening when they had the 15 minute wait time. Our buzzer went off and we were seated. The buzzer was greasy. I had hand sanitizer so I was okay. Not sure if it was wiped off between patrons in this flu season. Prior to being seated I had time to review the menu and use the restroom. The restrooms were semi clean. With the high percentage of guests they can clean more often. <br><br>I placed my drink order upon being sat. For some odd reason I reminded my waiter twice about my drink order. He totally forgot it appeared. He seemed distracted. The table beside me had the same issue. The service just was non existent. Unfortunately service can make or break an experience.  <br><br>The menu was hilarious from glamburgers to skinnylicious. Someone who has an extra personality made this menu.  I had the grilled salmon with broccoli and mashed potatoes. The food was good. The salmon was a bit salty, but there was plenty to take home. The texture and temperature of my dish were great. I had the strawberry martini which was sweet and designed in a cute style. I had two meals due to the large portion size of the salmon dish. I decided to skip dessert. I was so full from dinner over eating wasn&#39;t in my plans. There was some dessert options I will come back to try, maybe to go. <br><br>I am all to familiar with cheesecake, but got a chance to try the &#34;Queen city&#34; location. I have a theory they get business because of the name. I hope they can grow on so many aspects.

Ok so let me start by saying typically I love  Cheesecake Factory however each time I come to the one here in Charlotte the experience gets worse! The salad I ordered was supposed to be Kale and Brussel sprouts and instead I get kale and spring mix that looked and tasted like my front lawn. This was after waiting 27 min for it! The manager has horrible customer service skills, he was argumentative and rushed off line he could care less! I will NEVER come back to this location I was trying to give it another try since they brought their rating back up to 92. Just HORRIBLE! The waitress and other staff was nice.

Ordered through DoorDash, was told my food was ready. Went to pick up, staff said they couldn&#39;t find it (turns out it was in the back - it was ready) waited about 10 min for them to figure it out. So when we finally got the food it was cold and soggy. Thai Chicken wraps came without Chicken. Went back, was told it was in the container and then before I walked out the door someone stopped me and said they the chicken, forgot to put it in the order. Also the order was incorrect in almost every way requested. Waste of $63

We stopped by the bar for happy hour to try out their small plates and drinks, we loved everything we ordered. This is a perfect spot for after work cocktails and eats. We felt the portions were large for how much they charged. We will be back!

This place is horrible! I&#39;ve visited other locations and they cater to their quests. When ordering curbside they do not come out. This has happened three times. Always an excuse. Check your food it&#39;s not always at temperatures for eating. I had to go in and get my call in orders. Management used to had situations, now it appears thru don&#39;t care. Since then I&#39;ve included corporate. FYI this location gave me the wrong number on purpose. I was able to get corporate&#39;s correct number. It&#39;s very sad because they can do better. The excuses ate overplayed. I haven&#39;t been back.

Well. so I decided to be a bit generous with my rating because after all, the food was good, the cheesecake was great, and the atmosphere (outdoor) patio was amazing. <br>PROS<br>Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta has now become my favorite pasta. I could not eat it all and I took the remaining home....can I tell you the leftovers tasted BETTER than straight out of the kitchen!!! The Mac and cheese was pretty tasty. I&#39;d get it again. This was my first try at the tiramisu cheesecake, and just like the actual tiramisu,I loved it. The bread, loved loved loved it...I am a &#34;brown bread&#34; fan for sure. CF even won my son, who is not a bread eater, over. Wish we had been offered more since it did take quite a bit of time for our entrees to arrive. We chose a perfect day to be outside on the patio although it was a rather warm day, the fans were sufficient and made outdoor eating quite pleasant. We even had a &#34;little friend&#34; stop by to say Hi (see the picture). <br> CONS<br>The service is super slow . Perhaps with it being beautiful Saturday, servers decided to take the day off?<br>My biggest CON....lack of attention to detail.  The hostess gave us our flatware wrapped in a WHITE napkin and I had on BLACK pants!!!!! Please take note of the importance of NOT giving someone wearing BLACK a WHITE napkin (thus the reason a star was lost). <br><br>Overall, great time, great food, and amazing company. We&#39;ll be back. Looking forward to my next review and I am going to wear black JUST to see if you all are paying attention . <br>Until next time....
Great food not a long wait for lunch, service was slow but the server was just triple sat with customers.

We came on a monday night so it wasnt too busy. We were seated rather quickly for a party of 7. Our waitress was nice and friendly; however, she seemed a tad inexperienced and not very attentive. Several of our water cups were empty for quite some time before she came back to check on us. Our food wasnt hot, it was barely warm. I ordered the pasta di vinci and wasnt offered any grated cheese on top (this is my usual order at any cheesecake factory location). I dont know if it&#39;s their policy but when we have leftovers the waitress/waiter always places it in the container for us or at least offers to do it, she did not do either. Overall the service was lacking and unimpressive. I ended up just ordering a whole chocolate tuxedo cheesecake at the counter and that lady was very nice and helpful. I probably would not choose to come back to this location.

Girls Night with my Niece. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory was on her bucket list. Ever since she relocated to North Carolina that&#39;s all she&#39;s been talking about. I received two tickets to see &#34;The Space Between Us&#34; and decided to make the evening a girls night. <br><br>We grabbed dinner then had the most amazing cheesecake! We arrived around 5ish and sat near the bar. At first my niece was overwhelmed with the wide selection of cheesecake. She finally settled on the Oreo Cheesecake. I had the original with strawberries on top. Of course it was DELICIOUS!!!! <br>Our waitress Danielle was very patient and kind. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to this location once before in college. My Mother Loves the food, I&#39;m not a fan. Yes, the cheesecake is good, but the food lacks flavor. Maybe Im ordering the wrong thing. Of course I&#39;m willing to try again for the sake of my niece. Our next adventure will be Brunch.<br><br>Thank you to Danielle for giving my niece an unforgettable experience! She truly enjoyed every bite!
The impossible burger was delicious!! So was the guacamole  Outdoor searing was nice for lunch, too. The fish and chips were pretty good too.

I would think that knowing there is a very good deal ($20 for 7 items) that is being advertised and is expected to bring a lot of business to The Cheesecake Factory they would have been more prepared and had a system in place. <br><br>I placed an order online at 3:43pm for the 2 burgers/2 fries/2 drinks/1 slice of cheesecake meal deal. I scheduled pickup for 4:30pm. I receive an email stating that I need to go inside to the bakery to pickup the meal. I arrive at 4:35, expecting to wait a bit of course. Outside it said &#34;Pickup orders and curbside&#34;. There was no system, multiple (at least 10) customers just standing and waiting. There was ONE CF employee asking for people&#39;s names and then going back to check and see if their meal was ready. He was not writing anything down so if he went to check for your food and it wasn&#39;t there, you just needed to wait and hope that he would remember your name. After waiting for about 15 minutes a few women come up to pick their food up because they were waiting inside. The CF employee that was checking for everyone&#39;s order told them that since they hadn&#39;t paid for the meal, they needed to go inside to the bakery and pay. They inform him that the CF employee told them to come outside. <br><br>Since I had not paid for my food yet, I went inside to pay. Well there was once again only ONE CF employee assisting customers at the bakery. I stood in line for another 20 minutes waiting to pay for my food. Once I was able to pay, I got a receipt and was told to go BACK OUTSIDE to wait for my food. I finally get my food after waiting another 5 minutes for fresh fries instead of the cold ones in my bag. I checked to make sure my boyfriends burger was correct because I ordered it plain. That was correct, only to find when I got home that MY burger was plain and had nothing on it.<br><br>There needs to be a better system in place for when there is expected to be a large crowd like for holidays/or special deals like the one that is going on right now. I was not impressed.

We arrived at the restaurant at 5:19. At 7:36 we still haven&#39;t been seated. So many people were seated in front of us. It&#39;s a Saturday night. We purposely got here almost 45 min early. It&#39;s my husband&#39;s birthday. My oldest daughter drive here from Harrisburg and now she has to leave. We are beyond disappointed. This WILL BE the last time we ever eat at this god forsaken crap hole!

I had a delicious dinner. The chicken piccata was EXCELLENT!!! I am definitely a fan of angel hair pasta, and this one has a lemon sauce that just kept calling my name. The mushrooms and capers topped it off real fine. <br>   The waiter was fantastic. He had a great sense of humor and was very observant. The bartender knows how to make a mean amaretto sour. <br>   Can&#39;t go to the Cheesecake Factory and not order cheesecake..... The choices go on and on. I decided on the cherry cheesecake and I was not disappointed. It was good to the last bite. <br>    Wish we had a Cheesecake Factory in Charleston, SC.<br>     10 out of 10!!!<br>YUMOLA!!!!

If it wasn&#39;t for the cheesecake no one would eat here. From the hosts to the busboys the crew is inefficient and turn over is slow. Wait times even for a party of 2 was over 2 hrs. While all Cheesecake factories have a wait and are crowded this one has been one of my least favorites. For food, ordered a burger with no cheese, it was over cooked and had a nice pile of cheddar goo. After eating we of course ordered cheesecake but waiting another 35+ minutes just for our cheesecake we ordered as soon as our food arrived. The women&#39;s bathroom was a complete disaster! I will not be back!

Just a little foodie tip, don&#39;t get the ribeye, tasted like it was boiled and then it was thrown on the plate. Worse steak I&#39;ve ever tasted, I&#39;ve had a better steak at Golden Corral. Other than that everything else is good.

Went here for cheesecake after dining at Roosters access the street (which is phenomenal btw!). This was my first and last time visiting cheesecake factory. I ordered the vanilla bean cheesecake which was mediocre. The cheesecake came with more whipped cream than there was cheesecake. The worst thing, I asked the waiter if they could drizzle a little strawberry drizzle over the top and he said sure no problem. He brought out a small dish of what appeared to be gelatinous strawberry filling that couldn&#39;t have been drizzled if you tried. Absolute fail! Oh and I almost forgot, it took TWENTY MINUTES for an order of cheesecake only... We didn&#39;t even order food!!!!

Consistently good service and quality food. This place has an amazing menu and an incredible dessert selection. Bread is served with every order - nice touch.  Lunch menu is available til 4 pm <br>Excellent take out packaging too.

Food was above average! I had vegan Cobb salad, friends got philly cheese steak, and thai lettuce wraps. Not the best EVER, but definitely tasted good... cheesecake great as always. Our waitress was Cynthia. Super helpful, sweet, and friendly. Didn&#39;t bother us too much, was quick on refills. Handling COVID stuff well also. Overall good experience!

Considering I wasn&#39;t expecting much from America&#39;s most unhealthy restaurant, I have to admit, I walked out not totally put-off. So, first, the obvious... Yes, this place is way over priced. And yes, most dishes have an average of 1,000,000 calories. But, I looked a little harder at their novel of a menu and discovered their &#34;skinnylicious&#34; offerings. I question how some of these items (fried samosas, I&#39;m looking at you!) are considered skinnylicious, but I&#39;ll let that go for now. <br><br>I ordered the Tuscan Chicken. The menu touts it as less than 590 calories. I wonder how many servings come on the plate though... It had 3 chicken breasts, for crying out loud! Anywho, I ate about half the plate and boxed the rest to go. It was tasty, with LOTS of oven roasted cherry tomatoes, capers, asparagus and artichoke. Expensive at $16.95 though! The price you pay for less calories? Go figure. <br><br>I landed here on an office outing. While I wouldn&#39;t ever choose it myself, I also might not shudder at the thought of going back if the need ever arises again.

The food is good but the service is terrible at this location. I have always gone to cheesecake factories from different states and locations but this location has bad management and service. A group of 5 of us got there at 3pm and had to wait an hour and half just to get a table (even though tables were open), another hour to get our food once ordering, another hour for cheesecake that was to go and another 30 to 40 minutes for out check! When we asked the manager what the deal was with the waits he just came up with excuses and didn&#39;t even have an answer. This location needs to learn from the others on how to run! This was our second try with this location definetly will be the last!

It&#39;s a chain and always a nice place. Good is fine desserts are good. <br>We went as a group of 20+ we had 2 wait staff one was great the other probably should have started her day over. I find that service is better with not such a big group

I realize I was trying to call the restaurant on a busy Saturday night around 7:30 pm, but I was placed on hold 3 times and each time I hung up after waiting over 10 minutes.  I was trying to reach the bakery to confirm the pickup of an order.  The first time no one picked up after being transferred, the second call back the bakery associate did pick up the transferred line and said they would check my order and place me on a brief hold.  Her idea of brief is over 10 minutes and I hung up.  I tried a final time and was quickly transferred  again even after explaining how I have been on hold twice.  I waited about 12 minutes hung up and decided to leave this tip: have a phone that reroutes transferred calls back to the host or hostess to provided better service.<br><br>Thanks!

Hands down my favorite chain restaurant. I get something new every time. Today I went for the grilled fish tacos...YUM! I also had the low carb cheesecake with strawberries. It did not taste any different then a normal slice and it was amazing! I&#39;m still full 8 hours later (unlike some places). <br><br>Even a few weeks ago I had a bad experience here(shocked) and I wrote to corporate. They handled the situation professionally and more then made up for their mistake. <br><br>I will continue to sing the praises of Cheesecake Factory. LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Disappointed we were 10 minutes late + 4 minutes waiting at the  podium to be noticed. We were informed by the reservation staff non too politely that our reservation was given up and we would need to wait the 1 hour and 20 minutes to get a table. This is our 22nd anniversary we drove an hour in the rain to make the reservation time. We will not be waiting or returning.

Literally one of the worst Cheesecake experiences I have ever had in America or abroad. You expect consistency and at least passable quality when going to a chain establishment, but not the case here at this location. Wednesday night last week stopped in for a late dinner (9PM) after a long day. The server was great very attentive, but unfortunately the same couldn&#39;t be said about the kitchen. Ordered Thai Lettuce Wraps  and my friend ordered a burger - one hour in an empty restaurant to grill some chicken - and plate it with lettuce. Kind of crazy, no apology from the waiter on the wait. <br><br>Food finally came out - there were three chicken pieces on the plate - 3 about the size of two of my fingers side by side. - $14 for that? Sauce was missing from the plate and the lettuce was rotting. I wish I would have stopped to talk to a manager, but after a long day all I wanted was to eat and go home especially after an hour wait in a basically empty restaurant. <br><br>I really hope this location gets it together, because this experience has a previously loyal customer questioning future visits.

We had to wait 15 mins for a table, no biggie! We had the sweetest waitress&#39;s Courtney!!<br>We ordered Orange Chicken and a small plate of nuggets.  We waited over an hour for our food!!!!  Courtney apologizes and said her manager would be over.  <br>Manager barely said sorry for the wait. She was not friendly. <br>Food was ok, management is horrible!!!<br>Too many other places in Charlotte to eat that will appreciate your business!!! <br>Won&#39;t be back!
One of the top restaurants in Charlotte. Clean, friendly, customer orientated, delicioso strawberry cheesecake.  Highly Recommended when visiting Charlotte
Cheese Cake is good. But it took an hour and a half to get our food. The place was very dirty and trash everywhere. Horrible experience!

This restaurant has never let me down. Environment is beautiful and so many food selections. I absolutely Love their Lettuce Wraps! Hands down the best- so much better than PF Chang&#39;s Lettuce wraps and the portions are humongous so I box half up and eat the next day! I crave these so much- I won&#39;t venture to try anything else

I have never had a bad experience at Cheesecake Factory! I love this place. Everything I&#39;ve ever had was hot and amazing. At this location I love the area. I had the miso salmon HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!! I always get an app so we got the calamari. My man got the Cajun pasta and wow full of flavor. I love the brown bread. They got rid of the Asian pear martini which wtf so mad lol but they have tons of other choices.

Love love love love the Cheesecake Factory! Every time I come to Charlotte I have to stop by this place. It&#39;s usually pretty crowded and a long wait Walton the weekends but today (Friday around lunch time) there was no wait... always get the Red Velvet Cheesecake... ultimate favorite That&#39;s all I have to say about that lol

This restaurant has disappointed me every single time I go. I went to this location on January 2. I wasn&#39;t satisfied with my food but I kept it and paid for it. The waiter charged me for my food as well as my friend. He turned around and charged my friend for her food. I tried calling three times to inform them of the error. The third time someone finally answered but left me on hold. I contacted corporate but haven&#39;t heard a thing. I&#39;m disappointed in this establishment. I will not return. #overrated
Always a fantastic time here! Food is great, service is awesome! Short wait, and overall love it here!
The food was really good! Only downfall was the service was slow and it was hot inside.

I would have probably gave this place 5 stars if the 2 hostess didn&#39;t have a crappy attitude but after that, or service was awesome. We only went for dessert and had 3 different cheese cakes. I had the dulce de leche ....... WOW.  So damn good.  So close to five stars lol.

I had always seen The Cheesecake Factory at malls and never had a desire to have a go at it.  Though this passed week I was with family and they had so much good things to say about it, we decided on it for lunch.  <br>The menu had just about everything you could imagine.  The family and I Had a wonderful meal, the food was excellent with  something for everyone.  There was a variety of choices to pick from and the portions were absolutely monstrous.<br>The service was timely, well executed and gave us refills promptly.  We finished the meal with desert and man the cheesecake was outstanding.  If you are in the area and want a meal of what felt like an endless amount of food, you should give it a shot.

We went at 9:30 pm on a weekday so got seated immediately . We ordered Louisiana pasta and Thai coconut basil dish and a kids pasta . The waitress was attentive . However the manager informed us that they are out of Thai dish and said she would buy one entree for us since they ran out or maybe she would buy the cheese  cake . And then the waitress came and rushed us into another dish , bay bay or something saying it was similar just a different sauce . After serving the dish she told us that the manager would like to buy the cheese cake. But we said that she said she would buy the entree if it&#39;s different .The waitress insisted but you got the same dish . I asked how it could be the same when the sauce was different and all dishes would have chicken and some veggies . She said she would inform the manager and the manager came and checked again and asked how the dish was . My husband said I do not even know the name of the dish and that&#39;s when she agreed to buy the entree . <br>Long story short - they tried every way not to buy us the entree . Which would have been okay if they had not offered us in the first place . Anyways we left a nice tip for the waitress . All in all the food was amazing . Packed the cheese cake since it was already 10:30 pm when we left .

Mid level dining in south park. Let me start out by saying that we went here just for the cheesecake. We went on a Friday night. When I tell you it was busy I&#39;m not sure I can verbally express to you how packed it was. We waited in line for 15 minutes to order our cheesecake and another half hour to actually get it. There were two guys behind the counter getting desserts together for the whole restaurant and it appeared as though they only had one speed which was between slow and snail. Once we paid our $20 for two pieces they were ill admit delectable. For the amount of time and effort we had to spend getting it however will probably have me steer clear of this place in the future.

I have visited this location three times and each time the food quality has seemingly gotten worse. Visited CF on yesterday and I&#39;m sure this time will be my absolute last. The quality of the food dishes ordered for my family was horrible. All of us were unhappy with our meals and we&#39;re sure to let the waitress know. We left of course still feeling hungry and extremely disappointed. Never again!!!!!!!!!!!!
A great place to celebrate any special occasion.  We celebrated a birthday with appetizers and cheese cake.  Great atmosphere and great service.

Took my daughter and grandson for a lunch celebration. I ordered the fish tacos. The breaded fish was cold into the first bite. So were the black beans (cheese hadn&#39;t melted on top and the rice which was cold looked like it had some seasoning squirted on it and stirred. My daughter had ordered pasta which she shared with me. The waitress saw the plate sitting and offered to take the fish dinner off but it was still on the bill when it came. Took 15 mins to track down a Mgr to have charge taken off. I&#39;ve eaten here before and was happy but not this time. Maybe Monday just doesn&#39;t work for them. Waitress was friendly and efficient. Kitchen dropped the ball.

Amazing food and impeccable service! Our server was stretched too thin, but when he was at our table of 7, all w/ different drinks, entrees, and all 7 of us got dessert (what&#39;s the point of going to The Cheesecake Factory if you aren&#39;t gonna get dessert?). YUMMY!

Very long lines and big crowds. Last time i went wait time was about 30 min.  Seating area is dark and you have to talk loud to for the person to hear you sitting across from you. The prices are ok with avg price being about $15 per person.  I ordered the Philly cheesteak which was a little dry.  The bread bread basket is just ok would rather have rolls. Next time i will just order to go the dine in experience will not WOW you and is slow.

I went there today for a nice little outing with my son and the wait time was RIDICULOUS. I get that it&#39;s a popular and very busy place but geez, we waited for over what was only supposed to be an hr and apps 10 mins., try 2 hrs and some change overall of a wait period. Then the food wasn&#39;t even worth the super long wait. I ordered a Hibachi Steak entree and it wasn&#39;t at all what was described on the menu. The mashed potatoes that were supposed to be wasabi flavored, were just their regular mashed potatoes and my &#34;well done&#34; steak was very very dry. It didn&#39;t even come with the additional food as described in the entrees components of the dish. I didn&#39;t get any fried asparagus with it and the overall taste was JUST okay. The only thing that was really good was my Island Ginger Cooler drink. That was great.  that&#39;s why I&#39;m rating it 2 stars instead of just 1. Everything was a no for me.

What can I say, we love Cheesecake Factory!  We just don&#39;t go often because we do have some local favorites or places we can get in and out of quicker.  You just have to go in expecting to wait when you get there for a table and again waiting for the food.<br><br>They have an extensive menu which I have tried a lot of, but Kevin and I have found the two dishes that we love and get every single time!  When we have a gift card, we usually get each dish, but if we don&#39;t, we usually get the combo, as these two dishes also come as a combo.  Great amount for us to share!  We of course love it when we have a gift card so that we can have it for multiple nights!  What are the dishes?  Chicken madeira and steak Dianne!  Both the chicken and steak are awesome.  We love the potatoes too!  If you get the chicken madeira, ask for extra sauce on the side because it is fantastic to pour on the mashed potatoes!<br><br>We are full by the time we are done, so we always take our cheesecake to go.  Can&#39;t go there without getting cheesecake as it is awesome and cheesecake is my favorite!  My favorites are the red velvet cheesecake and the apple streusel, which we happened to get both of those this time.  Normally we try out different ones each time, they have some other good ones as well.  I am disappointed that they got rid of my favorite a couple years ago - the oreo cheesecake, but now they have the oreo dream extreme, I&#39;ve had it once, but just give me an entire oreo cheesecake rather than all the chocolate richness in the cake and other layers!<br><br>We will be back!  (PS we are now out of giftcards, anyone who wants to give us one we will be happy to take ;-D )

The shrimp with angel hair was so pitiful. The five shrimp tasted as if they were boiled in plain water and placed on a bed of pasta with unseasoned chunked tomato. According to the menu (see picture) there should be garlic, lemon, herbs and basil. I tasted none of that.   The price was a whopping 19.95!!!   I received clear warning signs of trouble with a 20 page menu. But who would think that an hour long wait time would render the awful overpriced food that I received. This place will never have my business again.

The best thing about the Cheesecake Factory (besides all the Cheesecake) is that their menu is so expansive and there really is something for everyone to eat there. This was only my second time there but every time I have the hardest time picking out what to get because I want to pick more than one! <br><br>We started with Buffalo Blasts as an appetizer and they come with 8 giant pieces! I was shocked when I saw the amount! They&#39;re basically fried Buffalo chicken dip and man were they good! With all the food that was yet to come, we probably didn&#39;t need to get them, but I&#39;m still glad we did. <br><br>My boyfriend and I each got a pasta dish which were very generous portions and both were very very good. My only complaint about the entire experience is that I could tell that my pasta was sitting out for a little while, so I guess we were waiting on my boyfriends meal before they could serve it to our table. It was still good and pasta is always a good leftover choice. <br><br>Of course we ended the meal with Cheesecake. We decided to split one and got the cookie dough cheesecake. It was so so so good. In the words of my boyfriend &#34;I&#39;m glad I&#39;ve had plain cheesecake before this or I would expect all Cheesecake to taste just like this&#34;. It tasted exactly like cookie dough. <br><br>I would definitely come here again. It can definitely get pricy as their menu is so large and you just want everything, but maybe more frequent trips would make me feel like I can just pick one thing at a time!
I never order entree/etc at the Cheesecake Factory. Only cheesecakes.  I usually get waited on quickly and don&#39;t wait too long for my cheesecakes.  I haven&#39;t had a bad cheesecake yet.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory, initially I&#39;m not a big fan because I&#39;ve been there done that since high school back home in Chicago. However I have a teenager and this place ROCKS to teens so we end up here from time to time unfortunately.<br><br>When I&#39;m forced to eat here I enjoy the small plates menu items which include the avocado rolls, salmon rolls &amp; mushroom pizza. Our teenager ALWAYS indulge in the Buffalo Blast as an app and chicken tenders with fries as a main course. The hubby alternates between Jamaican Black Bean chicken and the Miso Salmon. I personally LOVE the Miso however this location is off on flavor and the whole Miso experience. <br><br>It&#39;s pretty weird that Grand Luxe Cafe and Cheesecake Factory are owned by the same company. I prefer Grand Luxe as its much more upscale and the food options are better and much more tasty and presented better. Grand Luxe would&#39;ve been a perfect fit for SouthPark mall, wishful thinking as I&#39;m a Chicago girl and we have it ALL.<br><br>The dessert choices include the Lemon cake/cheesecake, the red velvet cheesecake and the chocolate cake.<br><br>Enjoy if you like 1,000&#39;s of confusing options and the pain of the mall traffic and long waits without the ability to make reservations.

Cheesecake Factory has been my family&#39;s favorite restaurant since I can remember but this location is absolute garbage. My husband and I moved to Charlotte in October and have been here 5 times. Every single time we have received terrible service; the food is never made right and even ordering to-go takes well over an hour even if you order one salad. The servers are rude and aren&#39;t knowledgeable about their menu at all. I ordered Parmesan crusted chicken and Alfredo pasta on the side. Instead of their usual thick delicious creamy Alfredo, it was literally flavorless liquid that appeared to be a mixture of milk and dried Parmesan. And the chicken that should&#39;ve been crispy was completely soggy because it was sitting in that watery &#34;sauce&#34;. I&#39;ve ordered this dish, I kid you not, 30 or more times and it&#39;s never looked anything like this. Terrible location.

Thanks! Our reservation was at 8:30 and once we arrived we were seated within 2 minutes. Great staff and very friendly! Our server was AWESOME! Best experience ever at the Cheesecake Factory. All because we used the YELP app for a reservation.

What can I say...I love popping in The Cheesecake Factory when I am doing some shopping at South Park Mall! My friend and I stopped in and were quickly able to find a couple of open seats at the bar. A few different bartenders helped us out and they were all extremely friendly and provided great service. I went with the kale and quinoa salad (added grilled chicken) and it was so yummy. I would 100% order it again. I couldn&#39;t dare have a totally healthy meal though so I ordered a side of sweet potatoes fries and they were a fried dream come true. Overall, great service and tasty food...TCF does it again!

I visited Cheesecake Factory for a friend&#39;s birthday party. There was a medium sized group of us, approx. 12. Blue, our waiter, was amazing and very attentive. I ate the Cajun jambalaya over rice. My boyfriend had a kale &amp; quinoa salad that was DELICIOUS! Overall, a great experience. I always order the white chocolate raspberry Cheesecake and it never disappoints.

Definitely will visit again. The bread, appetizers, wine, entrees, everything are all excellent. Nicole was incredible. Of course the cheesecakes were awesome, we tried 5 different slices. When they suggest to you to place your cheesecake order now due to the wait, they aren&#39;t kidding. I dont know why so many bad and negative reviews. Maybe the reviewers were having bad nights, or the store was having an off day. I would HIGHLY recommend a reservation to avoid the wait. We had one and they seated and treated us quickly. Great place!
Food and service are awesome! Just make sure to make your reservation because the waiting list is loooong!

I placed an order through DoorDash, received my order minus my desert (strawberry cheesecake) I had to go to the restaurant where I was disrespected by the guy at the bakery as well as the manager! A simple apology would&#39;ve been enough for me instead I a hand pointed at me and was screamed at as she followed me out the door still screaming! I&#39;ve never felt so humiliated in my life! And people tend to say racism doesn&#39;t exist! I beg to differ

My husband and I have been going to Cheesecake Factory for years and had always enjoyed the food and service, but we will NEVER be ordering food to go again. We were looking for a nice meal that we could grab quickly and eat at home and ended up with no meal at all. What they do not tell you beforehand, is that the to go pick ups and the bakery line are the same and you are required to wait in that line to get your food (which if you have been here at dinner time, you know is insane). After waiting in the line for 30 minutes I received cold food, as my food had been sitting there the entire time. After getting to our car, we realized the state of our food and went in to get a refund (we aren&#39;t paying $40 for cold food). The manager did give the refund, but seemed to question the state of the food and took it. I would have been better off ordering the food when I got in line and then it would have been fresh. Instead all we got was 1 hour later into our night. Will not be ordering take out from here again.

We came here because Cheesecake Factory being a corporate restaurant typically you get the consistency. Not this time.<br><br>We arrived around 11:00 restaurant was empty. Maybe 5 tables in the entire establishment, we asked to sit outside (there was one table sitting outside 2 ladies who had just received their food) the hostess- younger girl- double chained gold necklace with her name on it which I cannot remember now and glasses told us &#34;it will be a 10-15 min wait&#34; we looked at each other and asked why? She responded with &#34;we only have one server on&#34; HOW IS THAT MY PROBLEM?? I should preface this that I ran a restaurant for well over a decade and my husband is the executive chef to a neighboring restaurant. His response to me was &#34; we would never get away with saying that&#34; how is having one server on our problem as a paying guest when the restaurant is empty and another sever could easily pick up the table?&#34; Food for thought management.<br><br>We decided to sit inside and I will say the ONLY positive thing about our experience was our<br>Server and his trainee. They were prompt- attentive- polite and didn&#39;t leave us wanting for anything.<br><br>Food- we ordered 2 kids meals to start and an appetizer of the spinach dip followed by the Thai lettuce wraps and nachos. The one thing about cheesecake that we&#39;ve loved is the food is always consistent we order the same things because we LOVE them. Not this time unfortunately. The kids food and dip came out kind of timely- but not for an empty restaurant- it&#39;s come out faster when they were packed FULL. Spinach dip was cold. I didn&#39;t say anything because being one of the industry you just don&#39;t.<br>Then the GAP. For nachos and lettuce wraps it took a good 10-15 minutes for them to follow. The wraps were good. My husbands nachos were luke warm and completely bland- nothing like they have been in the past. He decided not to eat- the sever came<br>To check on us and we explained.<br><br>He then offered to send a manager over. After a few more<br>Moments passed be returned with this response &#34; I&#39;m just going to take them off of the check- I&#39;m sorry about that- the manager is just too busy to come by&#34; I&#39;ll repeat the restaurant was empty. They were &#34;picking up&#34;<br>But 80% of the tables were vacant. After the sever walked away... guess what happened? A MANAGER WALKED BY. Quickly not stoping and touching any tables <br>On his way around (Middle Aged man darker hair wearing a blue-Ish shirt and tie) mind you we were just told 2.5 seconds prior the managers were to BUSY to come by and it was just easier to remove the item from the bill?!!! <br><br>How is this even acceptable?! And of all places a major corporation who doesn&#39;t even pay for advertising bc their reputation is THAT GOOD! How is your manger being too busy to come to a table ok? How is telling paying customers there is only one server on and put us on a BS wait to sit outside (on a beautiful day I might add- your manager didn&#39;t set themselves up for success on that floor plan) and Serving cold food when your restaurant is empty how is any of this acceptable?!
The food and service was extraordinary.    Definitely recommend by me if that&#39;s worth anything.   The cheesecake was great.

For a first timer I must say I was overwhelmed. They had a wide array of choices on the menu. If you don&#39;t know exactly what you want you will be searching for awhile. I will say that the bread they served was GREAT and I could not get enough. I ended up ordering the Chicken Riesling. It was good, but it felt like it was missing additional seasoning in the sauce. <br><br>They are very generous with serving size, and I was able to take some home. Next time I go I will definitely have to try the cheesecake.
Always packed but worth the wait. Love the additional outdoor seating in the waiting area as well as the separate to go/cheesecake ordering line.

When I heard my friends were going to the Cheesecake Factory, I had a feeling of being overwhelmed.  Why?   The menu is overwhelming. The space is overwhelming with ceilings that go higher than the sky.  The noise level is too much.  This place is good for groups, if you don&#39;t mind waiting in lines, loud conversations, and food that is made for the masses.   GO HERE to meet your friends to have fun.  We DID have fun!  I had the fish tacos and they were good.  The guacamole tasted fresh and the taco was actually really delicious.  But, I was still overwhelmed.   Gosh, now that I think about it, the feeling of being overwhelmed started in the parking lot.  Trying to find a place to park here is not impossible, but nearly impossible.  I was so excited all those years ago when The Cheesecake Factory came to Charlotte. It&#39;s amazing at how the years can change us and how we perceive foods and places and even our friends. I think our taste buds change too, over time.   If I could still eat cheesecake without the guilt (as I did 15 or 20 years ago), I would probably be writing a five star review.   As it is, I remain overwhelmed, but will agree that this was good enough for four stars.    If my friends said to meet them again here, I&#39;d do it, especially if I had my earplugs and a tranquilizer.
Was visiting town and my most trusted chain is Cheesecake Factory. The wait for the for was a bit long but it was worth it. The service is phenomenal and the food was amazing.

Visit date 7/30/17- that&#39;s the day they had cheesecake 50% off. The lines where crazy,  with 1 hour and 1/2  wait after your order your cheesecake. It was so busy with no standing space. A lot of ppl was waiting outside. I had the celebration cheesecake AND IT WAS SOOOOOOOOO GOOD, it&#39;s made with cake and cheesecake I WOULD WAIT AGAIN FOR 2 hours!! That&#39;s how good this cheesecake was!!

Surprisingly large amount of vegetation options. I highly recommend getting the veggie burger and requesting bbq ranch sauce on the side. It makes it so delicious! Also I substitute mashed potatoes instead  of French fries. The only down side is how close the tables are together in the section we were in. I felt like I was going to have to climb over the person at the table next to me to get out and our poor waitress had several awkward moments getting in the personal space of the next table when giving us our food and drinks.

I would say overall experience was good. Especially compared to the reviews. We walked right up party of 3 and were seated within 5 minutes. They rushed to clean a table for us. We had our bread and drinks within the next 5 minutes. As far as waitress attitude she wasn&#39;t super over the top friendly LOL but it wasn&#39;t horrible. I had the New Orleans pasta and it was okay. The bread was delicious. The strawberry lemonade is good too.

The Cheesecake Factory has to be one of my favorite chain restaurants that I&#39;m not ashamed to admit I love going to. I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s the fancy cocktails or the ridiculously expansive menu followed by the most decadent cheesecake, but I always feel so fancy when I come here. <br><br>This location is easy to find, but it&#39;s connected to Southpark mall so parking can be a bit of a nightmare. The inside is beautiful with cathedral ceilings, ample seating for dining, and a really nice bar area. I wish they had more seating for the waiting area because there is always a wait. If you&#39;re lucky, you can find seating at the bar and order your meal there as well.<br><br>I have a few staple favorites that are my go-to&#39;s when I come here. I love their four cheese pasta with chicken, the steak diane with salmon and potatoes, and their fried mac n cheese balls. The bread is delicious and unlimited as well. Their cocktails are also always delicious. My favorite cheesecake is the 30th anniversary with layers of cheesecake and chocolate cake topped off with ganache. NOM! I also love the regular topped with strawberries. <br><br>I would recommend eating here for the experience, but just know you will have a wait and you will spend a pretty penny, but you will leave full and satisfied!

This was our second time going to this location.  They are a popular place (both times wait time long)we was given a 20 -25 minute wait time (only had to wait 15minutes). We forgot how dim the lightning is. Lol!! So it was a little hard to read the menu (both in our 30s), eventhough it was busy the volume wasn&#39;t that loud(I was able to hear my wife clearly). The waitress let us know from the beginning what they was out of and the wait time on dessert. She also make sure we were good and food time wasn&#39;t too bad. Overall good food and service,  just long wait time.

I loved Cheesecake Factory until today...I visited as soon as they opened at Southpark more than 10 years ago and have been back often!<br>Today I purchased a slice of the birthday cheesecake TO GO....which came to $11 with a tip from TAKEOUT!<br>I stopped to pump gas and my puppy ate 1/2 of it by the time I noticed....I immediately called them and explained that the slice was for my child.  I have a 30 minute drive home....they kept me on hold to ask a manager for over 15 minutes who told me sorry they could not replace the slice......<br>Oh well...thats the last time I solicit Cheesecake either in Charlotte or elsewhere.

The cheesecake factory is consistently good. All locations are pretty similar. Having been to many others, the Charlotte experience was enjoyable, same food as always, awesome warm bread to start, large portions of delicious food, not a bad wait to get a table tonight either though it is a week night. The South Park mall is also pretty nice. Much larger than expected and some trendy local stores to check out while walking off your CCF meal :-) however, if you do not park nearby and you plan to leave after 9:00pm, best to park by that exit or any mall exit because stores close and you may need to walk the outside of the mall to get to your car from there!

We love going to The Cheesecake Factory any opportunity we can. We love the food and the cheesecakes are amazing. I got the Cajun Jambalaya and my wife got the Shrimp with Angel Hair Pasta. Both were wonderful and the portions were huge. For desert we each got a cheesecake to go. I got the Chris&#39;s Outrageous Cheesecake (which reminded me of German Chocolate Cake) and my wife got the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake, which was simple, but tasted great.
About to get the Chocolate Godiva it&#39;s hotter then lady GA Ga and looks bueatiful like the candy

Honestly just all around a terrible experience. The wait was long which I can understand as it was a Saturday night. I have never been before but my boyfriend has. We finally get seated and after waiting for five minutes we get our drink order in and immediately are feeling rushed as he tried to get us to order our food too. After a few more minutes we finally got drinks then awhile after that got bread. We finally ordered two sandwiches which took over an hour to get out, which again I understand cause they were busy. What I don&#39;t understand is why it took so long to get refills on our drinks or why I asked for more bread multiple times and never got it. He told us to order our cheesecake early so that we would get it in time but then he never took that order either! I&#39;ve been a server before but the absolute lack of effort is just appalling here. We will never return.

Love Cheesecake Factory! We always go there for a birthday or anniversary. We actually went there after we got engaged to celebrate, 10 years ago. Even though there are times where they have a long wait, it is worth it. The food is delicious and cheesecake is even more!

When I come to Charlotte I always go to the Cheesecake Factory to get one of my favorite slices of cheesecake. Well on March 7th 2019 I had the worst experience I could possibly have had. When coming into the location I was the third customer in line at the cheesecake counter. The restaurant was not packed even though that should have nothing to do with the people who are not ordering food. So once I order I stepped to the side to wait. After about 2 to 3 minutes she took my cheesecake out of the display case and sat it one the counter. Then another almost 20 min went by before I was given my order. The elderly couple that was in front of me came back up to counter to inquire about what was taking so long. There are two individuals behind the counter and they are ignoring her. After she tried to get their attention the third time I walked up to counter and asked her what she had. Then I said excuse me to the individuals and asked them what was taking so long with we order (Let me add that the customer that ordered before me but after the elderly couple already got her order a long time ago). The lady behind the counter told me that they have to do the orders for the entire restaurant. I asked her what does that have to do with the people who are not ordering food. She finally gave the elderly couple their order. So I tasked her my order is just sitting there why can&#39;t you just give it to me so I can leave. She replied that they go by the tickets. Then she gave me my order. It makes no sense to me. If someone walks up to the counter to order some thing the is already made and sitting there why can&#39;t they get it and go. All they have to do is put in on a plate and hand it off. There is no reason why they should have to wait all that long time to receive something that is just sitting right there. The other customers are ordering are sitting in the restaurant enjoying themselves. I&#39;m standing and waiting for something that could be taken care of instantly. If there were so many orders as she made it out to seem them the cashier that rung me up should have turned around and put my order on a plate and bag and gave it to me. I would not have minded waiting 2 minutes for her get the customer order in front of me instead of waiting over 15 minutes and having my order just sitting there staring at me while other people are breathing all over it. If you are presented with the opportunity to appease your customers in any way it should be taken. I came from 4 hrs away and I make sure I come by everytime to get some food from your restaurant. Once I left the restaurant the wife came back into the entry way to talk to me. She too was visiting and was very unhappy with the way she was treated. And she said she was not coming back. Things like this is how you lose customers!

Came here just to order cheesecake and go, took 20 minutes after we ordered to get the cheesecake. There were three people working just to put cheesecake in a box to go and it took them 20 minutes to do so?? There&#39;s gotta be a faster way.

I was so excited to find a Cheesecake Factory here in NC. I am from Md. It was always really good in Md, not just the Cheesecake! I was with my mom and sister, we decided to share some app&#39;s. We ordered the Factory Nachos. It consisted of burnt chips, brown avocado and brown jalapeños. We also ordered the Eggroll Sampler. It was mushy and sauces were warm. The small Greek salad was drenched  spicy dressing. It ruined it! Bathrooms were dirty with no toilet paper and trash was running over. Silverware was dirty and missing some parts. Music so loud you can not hear anyone at the table. Even the waitress could not hear your order. I will never drive 57 minutes to eat here again!

We came in on a weekday afternoon so there was no wait. Our waiter Blue was friendly and patient while we decided, but he had to be reminded a few times for small things. He also never refilled my only drink (water). Anyway, it was my husband&#39;s birthday and I was surprised that the Cheescake Factory does not give a free slice of cheescake on your birthday (even if you can prove it). I guess they would end up losing money. Instead the waiter sings happy birthday which we all could have done without. I had the lunch margherita pizza and Caesar salad, both were huge portions, fresh, and delicious. My husband had a turkey burger with a garden salad; which I also sampled and it was tasty.  My niece had steak diane with mashed potatoes which is apparently her go-to favorite dish when she visits the CF. We also ordered 3 slices of cheescake to go (since we we all so stuffed from lunch): Coffee and cream, lemon raspberry cream, and cherry Ghirardelli chocolate. My coffee and cream slice was savory and rich. It took two days to finish it. Hubby inhaled his in one sitting later that evening.  We will be back for other special occasions when we are in the area. We are still waiting for a Cheesecake Factory to come to Columbia, SC!
Michelle was the most amazing bartender ever! She was attentive and charming! She made my Cheesecake experience the best, 12/10, would definitely come back. Thanks, Michelle!

I am a frequent visitor of The Cheesecake Factory and this by far was the worst experience. The wait wasn&#39;t long at all, which most people know isn&#39;t always the case. That was THE ONLY PLUS. My Louisiana pasta came out and the pasta was hard and dry and the chicken was overcooked. The three other people with me waited another 7-8 minutes before their food came out. My dad also ordered the Louisiana pasta and had to request for more sauce because it was so dry. The waitress walked by us numerous times and never asked if we needed anything or if everything was ok. I had to finally ask to speak with the manager. At the end of the meal the waitress Good morning gave us boxes and walked away. She never asked if we needed the check or wanted dessert. I had to flag her down. This was my dad&#39;s first experience and he said he would never come back again.

Don&#39;t try to call in a to go order, they&#39;ll tell you hold on a second and then not answer the phone for 25+ mins until you actually reach the place....apparently calling in B order means please stay on hold, and place the order when you actually get here

Food is all good but you are there for the cheesecake. The Godiva cheesecake is amazing. I&#39;m sure the others are good also but no idea. Menu goes on for pages so lots to choose from. Only negative is there always seems to be a line and often a very long line.

Last night, I called and made reservations for today at 2pm to celebrate our son&#39;s end of middle school time. I was told to arrive at 2pm because the table would be given away at 2:10pm. Our party of four arrived at 1:45pm to learn the person who answered the phone did not record our reservation. The hostess was less than helpful and gave us a pager to wait like the other 25 parties there! Dissatisfied, I grabbed a manager who was gracious enough to rectify the situation. <br><br>Our waitress was kind and pretty attentive. Our entree selections included shepherd&#39;s pie, shrimp scampi without tomatoes that arrived with tomatoes, kids&#39; pizza and a Cuban sandwich. Everything tasted ok. If you do have the shrimp pasta, know that it comes with five shrimp, not many noodles and barely any &#34;sauce&#34;. Oh and we did have a good appetizer, the buffalo blasts!<br><br>Known for their cheesecake selections, you can&#39;t go wrong. I have a caramel pecan turtle concoction waiting in the fridge for me now. It will make up for the beginning of our experience.

The food was awesome. We enjoyed both are meals. The cheesecake was amazing. The food took a while to come out. Maybe because they have such a large menu. I bet the kitchen is crazy. Overall it was a good experience.

The potatoe soup was like a bad bash of mashed potatoes! Not soup! Sandwich dry and we were supposed to get salads and she brought us fries. It was all horrible. But the cheese cake was delicious! If you go here just stick with the dessert. Coffe burnt tasting also!
Ananzing cheese cake I only go there for that k tried the food and it was HORRIBLE now you can try for yourself but I HATED it

Love everything there is about the Cheesecake Factory from the fancy decor to the open airy feel it just feels homey. Starting with the food it&#39;s best to order an appetizer/snack to save room for the cheesecake. I ordered the Godiva cheesecake and it was delicious. Servers suggested great ideas and I would return.

This is the first place family wants to come from out of town, but this location is always an excruciating wait for a table or just the cheesecake line. The food is just ok and the service takes forever. If you are missing something when your food gets there, we never get it before we are finished.

I know that this is a Chain Restaurant but .....that is where the negative connotation stops, The food, which there is a million choices ( I think 260 items to be exact) is just prepared outstandingly ! It has been over a year since I have been there and I was at Southpark yesterday and drove by and saw the Valet parking..it looked like it was not too busy so we went in!   I am so glad we did. We had a great waiter, Adam, and he was knowledgeable and friendly. I always get their Tropical Ice tea, it is light and refreshing. We ordered some old favorite appetizers, The Avocado Egg Rolls, Avocado, Sun-Dried Tomato, Red Onion and Cilantro Fried in a Crisp Wrapper. Served with a Tamarind-Cashew Dipping Sauce.  Then the Grilled Artichokes, so delicious and a great aioli! We ordered a great Beet and Goat Cheese salad in a delicious vinegarette! And then for the CHEESECAKE! We had the Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecke, heavenly! With a huge flower of Chocolate Ganache on it. I took three pieces home to my family, an Original, A Dulce Caramel, and a Chocolate mousse.  This is not a inexpensive place but so worth every penny. And there is not a better Cheesecake around!  I would say, go  and save room for the Cheesecake but the food is really delicious, so go hungry!

Never going to this location again! Went to the mall with my boyfriend and decided to stop in for lunch short notice, so we weren&#39;t exactly dressed in our nicest. We ordered our drinks and our food never even came. We were even approached by a custodian/janitor who asked if we were &#34;just hangin out.&#34; Meanwhile, watched people come in after us, be seated and even leave. Zero Stars if I could.

So, came here for happy hour.   Nothing happy here.  Left in a sad minute.  The only happy hour items on the menu is half price appetizers from 4-6.  Disappointing because I was looking for happy hour drinks.  None.  Been to the same chain and they had happy hour drinks.  What a shame.   I left. <br><br>This place needs to turn my frown upside down! <br><br>Oh and they have a low sanitation rating.

I really enjoy the Cheesecake Factory and for more than just their cheesecake. They food is pretty consistent flavor is usually there and great. My only dislike about this place is the lighting. It can tend to be really dark inside during dinner service. I don&#39;t know if it is to set a mood, but having to use your phone to see the menu is never a good look.

Got here at 5:50 didn&#39;t get seated until after 9pm finally received our food 9:45 and It was cold this is the worst service I&#39;ve experienced at this this location, never the best service however this was the deal breaker the waiter even lost our CC ‍I love Cheesecake Factory won&#39;t be returning to this location EVER!!!
Great food! Always enjoy going here! Great atmosphere and good service. Will def go back!

I have never been to the Cheesecake Factory and got my order in a timely fashion and nor is it ever correct. Yesterday we put our name down and we were told it would be a 2:45hr wait. My group decided to wait and it turned out to be a 3.5hr wait. Our server was very professional and worked very hard but I was disappointed when I asked to substitute chicken for Ahi Tuna. I specifically stated three times &#34;if the up charge is over $21 then I will take the salad how it comes.&#34; She responded &#34;that shouldn&#39;t be an issue&#34;. The salad I ordered, the Chinese Chicken Salad, was originally a $16 salad. The seared Ahi Tuna Salad was $19. I paid $24 (not including tax) to substitute Tuna for chicken. If you think about the price, $16 is how much the Chinese Chicken Salad cost (with the chicken included). To add chicken to any other salad, it is about $5 to $6. If you subtract the chicken and add $8-$9 Tuna, the total cost of the my salad should have been $19. I have never had a good experience at the Cheesecake Factory and I only return for a party that I am invited to. I could not recommend the Cheesecake Factory.

To whom it may concern,<br>Yesterday was an awesome day, as my family gathered together to celebrate a high school graduation. My nephew requested that we gather for lunch at The Cheesecake Factory. For obvious reasons, in light of the past violations found, we were hesitant  (i.e.: cockroaches ,sanitation rating,  and etc...). Moving on, we initially had no other concerns....until our waitress began disappearing for long moments of time. She was polite, but her attentiveness was lacking. She received the bare minimum for a tip... though she didn&#39;t earn one-third of it. When my aunt and my cousins food came out; the french fries were not fully cooked and the sweet potato fries were cold, the sourdough bread had been toasted and burned. They described the experience as trying to chew wood. When they experienced this failed attempt to consume their lunch.... and the waitress finally decided to show up, we asked that their meals be compted. She agreed, but offered a solution for my aunt, which was to place her meal on different bread. While they did exactly that, the condition of the sandwich once returned was not suitable for a dog. My aunt refused to eat it for obvious reasons. I took a picture...hoping to upload it, but that is clearly not  an option. My cousin lost her appetite after our long wait to eat and her experience. We then asked the waitress would she extend the courtesy of providing them with a free piece of cheesecake.... she said of course. Only later... she tried to bill them for it. This is when Eric the Manager entered into the picture. We explained the experience to him, which he then went on to insult our intelligence by informing us that it is sourdough bread, therefore that kind of bread is already hard. We know that... but this was over toasted and burned sourdough bread, so imagine how much harder it got!!!!!!!!! He also proceeded to tell us that he &#34;TOUCHED&#34; the bread and only some of it was really hard.  NOOOOO.... all of it was really hard. He did agree to give them a free piece of cheesecake, but that did not replace the sad experience of our visit. However, we thanked him... while he offered no APOLOGY!!! for the kitchen ruining their meals!!! My cousin is a chef and would have never let those meals leave the kitchen!!! This illustrates a lack of pride to serve patrons... by serving them something you yourself wouldn&#39;t eat! We were very disappointed!<br><br>Kindest Regards,<br>THD

I don&#39;t go here all that often but today I came there with my gf and her sister and kids for dinner and let me tell you how unwelcoming the host is. The girl had an attitude and look on her face as if she hated her job with a passion.<br><br>Let me give you some advice girl, if you don&#39;t like greeting or dealing with customers, maybe you should work in the back washing dishes instead of in the front where everyone can see your resting female dog face?<br><br>Thank you

Before I start my review, I want to make sure that everyone knows this is only a review on the cheesecake and the process of buying the cheesecake. My sister and I came up to Charlotte to shop at the mall and decided that before we left to go back home we would stop by the Cheesecake Factory and get a few slices of cheesecake to go home. My sister had been to this location to get cheesecake before but I hadn&#39;t. We didn&#39;t think about how crazy the place might get but at around 4pm we decided we were done shopping and headed to the Factory. The line just to buy cheesecake was out the door. We stood in line for around 25 minutes just to place our order for the cheesecake and then was told to step aside into another line where you waited for another 10 to 15 minutes for the staff to pull the cheesecake slices you ordered. When I had finally gotten to the register I asked the lady working if it was always crazy like this....she of course laughed and said absolutely (note for next time). I wish they would come up with a better system to process and take the cheesecake orders and if it is always that busy maybe invest in a few more employees to help out. Regarding the cheesecake itself, I ordered two slices a turtle pecan and tiramisu. I loved the tiramisu but wasn&#39;t crazy about the turtle pecan (too much actual cake and not enough cheesecake). Overall i&#39;ll definitely be back to grab some more cheesecake but i&#39;ll make sure I set aside enough time to order it.

I&#39;ve always loved The Cheesecake Factory but it will be a LONG time before I go back. Ordered the club sandwich and ended up waiting almost an hour. The waitress claimed that our order got &#34;bumped&#34; out of the system. I&#39;ve worked in restaurants before.... and that&#39;s not a thing. It took her 45 MINUTES just to check on our order. I could have literally ordered my same meal via Door Dash and received it in the amount of time it took her to even CHECK for our order. I&#39;m honestly just in disbelief that service could be that poor.

Curbside to go is a joke!!! Placed an order for some Tex mex rolls... they said 45 mins. Walked around the mall for 45 mins, pulled up to curbside to go spot and nothing/no one. Called several times to check on my order only to be placed on hold for 15 mins then after hanging up and calling back, placed on hold again! Got fed up and walked into the restaurant only to learn that they didn&#39;t even place my order. An hour and a half of my life that I can&#39;t get back and no Tex Mex rolls. Don&#39;t waste your time on this chaotic joke of a restaurant. The food is good but the service consistently sucks! One star is generous...<br><br>So I went to the contact page as<br>Suggested... an equally frustrating and convoluted<br>Experience. How about giving me some real contact info if you are interested in hearing more about my experience. Way to add insult to Cheesecake Factory. Another example of their disregard for customer service

The menu is too big for anything to really taste special. It all sounds good in the menu description, but when you get your food it&#39;s just &#34;meh&#34;. Cheesecake is great, of course. <br>Happy hour is 2 hrs (4-6). Mostly fried foods on special at that time. Interestingly enough, they serve the best blue cheese l have ever had.  This place is usually crowded.  Saturdays are ridiculous.
Nice environment, friendly staff, expensive lame tasting food but the cheese cake was good!  Stick with it.

We were there from out of town and this is our 4th visit to this restaurant and it is by far our favorite. I wish they had one in Charleston! We put in a order for an appetizer that never came out . It was brunch time and busy so that may be why. My husband got the mushroom burger and said it was the best he ever had .. I ordered the piccata and it was tasty. Only complaint I had was we were sat in the bar area where you sit on a long bench with chairs . We were sat about 6 inches from another couple and it was like we were sitting with them and we had to sit and listen to them smack and make gross noises while they ate . And we also couldn&#39;t get up til they left .. they had scooted the little table right up to ours and we couldn&#39;t squeeze through the spot... it was awkward and I didn&#39;t enjoy that. I&#39;ll be sure to request that we Don&#39;t sit in that area anymore ...

Love this Cheesecake Factory! The food is just right every time i eat there! This time. We had fantastic service at the bar during happy hour. The happy hour food deals are excellent, though there are no drink specials.<br><br>We enjoyed the artichokes-my fave and the artichoke crab dip. Both were absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection.<br><br>I wish we had a Cheesecake Factory near me!

I&#39;ve had Cheesecake Factory many times and each time I think the food is average. It&#39;s way overpriced for the quality served. Today I got the fish tacos, $15. The presentation looks great but the I could taste everything but the fish. The fish was unfortunately bland. I&#39;ve had better for a lot cheaper at food trucks. I think everything on the menu is way overpriced and there are just way too many items to choose from. <br><br>I think the cheesecakes are worth the money, they are delicious, but the actual food is really not. I&#39;d enjoy the experience more if it wasn&#39;t so pricey. I usually don&#39;t dine here but a friend of mine wanted to for the cheesecake. <br><br>The service is so so. Our waiter smelt of cigarettes which was a super buzz kill and really unappealing because we were about to eat. He came and went really quickly just to take our orders and serve the food but we never got a refill. We hardly saw him. I&#39;d also like to mention that the floor is always slippery at every Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been too and this one is no exception. Maybe it&#39;s the wax they use but they should reconsider this as it is prone to lead to accidents and injury. <br><br>Probably would only come back for dessert but nothing else.

Epic fail!  Whatever you do, don&#39;t order from curbside takeout.  Not only did I wait on the phone to exactly 27 minutes before my order was taken but once I arrived no one came out to deliver the order after 30 minutes.  We then went inside and was told they couldn&#39;t find the order and that they have not been able to get to any curbside orders because they were so busy so everyone in the curbside parking is just waiting there for nothing.  Total incompetence.  We were so frustrated we just walked out.

Had better service recently but I also didn&#39;t get a to go order. Came for lunch on a weekend and they weren&#39;t that busy. We gave the hostess our name and she told us to move to the side and we will be called very shortly. She made it seem like it wasn&#39;t gonna be long. She also didn&#39;t give us a buzzer. We ended up waiting a bit before we were called. Our server was friendly and greeted us quickly. I got the egg roll sampler. It was good but definitely not worth $12 for 4 egg rolls cut in half. My sister in law the the chicken and biscuits and she liked it. My husband got the salmon and thought it was ok. We got a few cheesecakes to go and went on our way.

The service was spotty.   We were sat and waited 15 minutes before a hostess was flagged by me.  Then the mgr came and offered apologies and free dessert to each of us.  The food was very good.  The fried catfish was a hit and the tuscan chicken was just in need of a little salt.  The chocolate cakes were delish and the lemon cello

Cheesecake Factory is one of those places I found very late in the game. I&#39;m from Connecticut, so there wasn&#39;t one near me until about 2016. So when I moved to Charlotte, it has quickly become reliable for a few things: crab bites, and Jamaican Pepper shrimp. This go round I had the lunch special, spicy Cesar salad and grilled Brussels sprouts and it was really good. In addition, the drink, was extra good, also a summer special. It had tiki in the name which was really cute.
This is a great spot for a company lunch meet-up.  Always great Flavour and great size plates; enough for lunch and dinner later.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY HERE<br><br>The staff is disrespectful and unprofessional. <br><br>I placed a take out order and an hour later had received nothing. Meanwhile, many of the people in line behind me had already ordered received their food and left. It got so bad that people were asking me what was going on. <br><br>Finally three bags arrived at the register. One belonged to a woman who had also called in (and received her order immediately when she walked in.) another was passed out into the crowd. The final bag remained on the counter while the woman at the register decided to get back to taking orders. <br><br>Annoyed at this point, I waited until the woman was done, and asked for a refund.
