To which, she responded by shoving the final bag in my face (without checking a ticket or receipt-- meaning she knew it was mine.) <br><br>I persisted on getting a refund, and was eventually greeted by a manager RYAN who didn&#39;t apologize and defended the woman&#39;s actions. He finally gave me my refund, and the cashier in the background muttered &#34;thank you for the free food.&#34; <br><br>Quite hardly the service I&#39;d expect. <br><br>Don&#39;t waste your time on this mediocre food and FAR subpar service.

I dined here for a friend&#39;s dinner celebration last night and received awful service. I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak with a side of French Fries. I received my Philly Cheesesteak 15 minutes before I even received my French Fries. So by the time I received my fries, I wasn&#39;t hungry anymore. I then asked for a to-go box. Today as I proceeded to finish my leftovers, I noticed the Philly Cheesesteak was undone! I am very unhappy and disappointed with my experience here. I will not be going back to this location again and I do not recommend this Cheesecake Factory.

Last night, I had a 3 hour wait. I would never, ever wait three hours to eat anywhere were it not my granddaughter&#39;s birthday wish to eat at the Cheesecake Factory for her birthday.<br><br>Upon getting &#34;beeped&#34; I approached the front counter where I was confronted with YOUR POLICY that made YOUR HOSTESS RUDE. She informed me that &#34;policy&#34; said we could not be seated because all 6 of us were not there. Two were at the bar closing out our check and one was in the mall because as a 73 year old, he needed to sit. YOU do not have anywhere near the seating needed for waiting guests.<br><br>Are you kidding? Do you really expect everyone to be there immediately upon beeping after three long hours? My lord, I wonder why the fire marshals have not ordered you to clear the doorway of scores of people waiting to be seated. Your food staff had huge difficulty navigating the immense crowd. Think guest safety. When Saturday night crowds are big and it is 10 degrees outside, perhaps you can isolate a better waiting area.<br><br>Everything about The Cheesecake Factory gets high marks but not your corporate policies or customer accommodation  (therefore the 2 stars as an average for food vs. &#34;policy&#34;). It is a very selfish attitude that causes customer-staff friction and it is needless. Yes, it spoiled our meals and left a sour taste that even you cheesecake can not remove.

This chain is always reliable. I don&#39;t go often, maybe once a year or two.  It does have good food, good service, and good dessert. I tend to get overwhelmed by the menu though! They have everything from american to mexican to asian. It is a bit crazy if you think about it. <br><br>I ordered the lunch everything pizza, which comes with a salad this time. The portion was huge! This one order is certainly two meals in one. It was very good! I know the bowtie pasta dish is good as well. <br><br>This was the first time I had the banana pudding cheesecake with fresh banana slices. It was amazing! Not too sweet. In fact it was perfect!
Extremely good food and a variety of choices. Also, a pleasant and relaxing environment.

Things are fine unless you get to go or carry out. I&#39;ve ordered the last two times as a to go and have been terribly disappointed with the quality and product. It&#39;s best to go and get a table at least you can send back an item that doesn&#39;t meet expectations and notify the MGr. Forgot it about once you have left the building you are just pissed with underwhelming entree!!

My wife and I ate here yesterday for lunch.<br>My wife small side salad as an appetizer.<br>Last night she had diarrhea and vomiting.<br>We went to the Dr. today and they believe she got food poisoning from the salad at this restaurant!!<br>Thanks

Went to celebrate family&#39;s Bday. It was pretty busy, but was seated quickly. Had to wait over 30 mins before food arrived and 15mins before sever provided bread. Once food arrived it was cold! When we complained to manager we were told a new meal will be made. We waited an additional hour before we asked our server (who we had to track down) to put in to go bag. Do you know, no one offered us gift cards nor comp us our meals????. I will never eat at this place again.

Pretty cool spot. The layout is amazing and the staff was polite. The food was fresh and fun. The Hot Chocolate my son got was great, but my pasta meal blew it away. The Stuffed Garlic mushrooms are OK, but still priced well at right below $7. <br><br>The Cheesecake we got for the ride home, didn&#39;t make it far. As always in Charlotte great diverse Staff and Customers...both important

Great food! All that said, I placed a call in order and they said 20-30 mins until order would be ready, which wasn&#39;t a big deal. I drove to the store and told them I was there, they brought my food out 45 mins later. It took nearly 1.5 hrs for me to get my food after I placed the order on the phone.

It&#39;s good to know when you have been away on the road for months and go to the factory there is your bartender.  Roland is the bartender of the year, someone who can make a drink along with a conversation of any kind.  I left for HI Jan 5 and the whole time I was comparing my drink at the factory there in Honolulu.  Thanks Roland for being well rounded.  <br><br>Jean

After waiting TWO hours, me and my company were seated outside in the cold rain like dogs. The food was not up to par and I will NOT be coming back. Worst birthday outing ever! Very disappointing in TCF because we have been loyal customers for years.

Best cheesecake in town!! The noodles are very good, but are way to big of portions. The burgers were undercooked and the restrooms were quite unclean. The wait was 45 minutes to an hour, but when I checked my watch we had waited for 1 hour and 45 minutes! The cheesecake and food were very overpriced and the wait staff only visited the table about three to four times. It truly does have amazing cheesecake though! I recommend going here at 4:30 if you want to be able to eat at 7:00, though!
I&#39;m always ready for cheesecake! Mushroom burger never disappointed me my gf got four cheese pasta was delicious! John served us and he was very nice and fast! Love this place.

I&#39;ve been to this particular restaurant about 50 times over the past 15 years. The food is pretty delicious and flavorful, considering the portions are enough for 2-3 people and over 1,500 calories for the heavier meals. The variety of cake flavors is what sets this place apart from nearby bakeries/cakeries. I have experienced the best of service to the worst of service such as a waitress spilling a full cup of ice water on me and not giving a damn or properly cleaning up the table, and/or just yesterday waiting for 30 mins to order 6 cheesecakes to go and them giving me only 5 and not giving me the correct cake initially. They only had one freaking job !!! And the cakes are already premade ! The flow of how the employees move is rigid and extremely inefficient. How do you have waiters with huge orders wait in line like everyone else? Are you serious? The lady at the bartender was probably the most effective employee there when she quickly gave me some water despite the kajillion drinks she had to make before and after my request. Shape up your employees&#39; sense of urgency and accuracy and more people won&#39;t be so turned off by your customer service.

Again this is another chain. You ate in one, you ate in all. If you like the place well you&#39;ll like this. If you don&#39;t well you won&#39;t!<br><br>It&#39;s decent priced and its packed again just like anything in South Park. Main reason I don&#39;t even want to go to the area. I&#39;m honestly finding myself eating more and more home.

This was the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at the Cheesecake Factory. It took us more than 20 minutes to get our bread and drinks (we ordered water), we then never got refills, our appetizers were thrown on a plate, and it took us 45+ minutes to receive our meals. We understand that sometimes the kitchen gets backed up but our waiter had a 15 minute conversation with other guests while we wanted our drinks to be refilled. Finally when we were served our meal there was hair in one of our meals.

Our waitress was awesome on Easter Sunday.....<br>I tried the pineapple shrimp and chicken with white rice<br>The rice wasn&#39;t as tender as I like it but the flavor of the sauce on top of the chicken and shrimp was tasty.<br>And of course I had to get a slice of cheesecake to take with me

OOOOOOOah!  What a great experience.  So many options, unusual options on the menu, servers galore and looking up to the ceiling and across the restaurant you get such wild ambiance.  Kids and adults enjoy the atmosphere and loud children cannot be heard more than two tables away because the Cheesecake Factory hums.<br><br>Your menu is a spiral-bound book.  Take your time and get lost in the offerings.  <br><br>Beware the &#34;skinny&#34; options.  Yes, they are low calorie and low fat, but to me they are so lacking in flavor and substance that one would have to be on a very strict diet to be subjected to the skinny life.  <br><br>Otherwise, far from the skinny life are many wonderful salads, sandwiches and entrees.  Iced tea is endless and refills are prompt.  The bread is crusty and warm.  I especially liked their soups with the bread.<br><br>You will be full when you depart as the portions are generous.<br><br>Enjoy.

Not worth the wait...so come mid-afternoon or pick another place. <br><br>Good food, expansive menu for entrees and of course, pages of dessert choices featuring things other than simply cheesecake. <br><br>Bar can have VERY irregular service even when the place is empty. <br><br>Outside dining is great--but place your ENTIRE order or you&#39;ll be waiting forever if you want dessert.

Explained to the manager that my alfredo noodles were not done and he replied &#34;I&#39;m sorry&#34;. I boxed it up and threw it away once I got home. There was no salvaging the meal. The ambience, the drink I had and the staff was nice which is the only reason there&#39;s stars selected at all. For the price charged, the food should AT LEAST be cooked until it is done.

The food was better than expected but the other aspects were far worse.<br><br>I got a decent parking spot so I was in a good mood for my dinner.  Appetizers came and we were so hungry we tucked into them and in no time they were gone.  More bread.<br><br>The entree, I don&#39;t want you to continue reading.  Wait ten minutes staring at this sentence.  Wait ten more minutes staring at this sentence.  I bet you just kept reading.  I didn&#39;t have that option.  With a squad of hungry children flailing about we waited over forty minutes after the apps, and that is even longer than our order time, for our food.<br><br>It took forever and our waiter avoided us most of that time.  It was excruciating with children flipping over complaining they are starving.  I was feeling the same way.  I made it through part of my meal and then I didn&#39;t feel well.  I wanted to pay and leave.  That took far longer and we had some bill errors that had to be fixed.  The entire thing took even longer.  I wasn&#39;t feeling well and the moment I got my credit card back I bolted for the door.<br><br>Get your dessert here and you are fine.  Order an entree at your own risk.  I suggest Maggianos for drinks and food, and the factory for cake.

Horrible service! This was my first and possibly my last time eating at this location. I&#39;ll probably stop by and get a slice of cheesecake but that&#39;s all. <br><br>My waitress kept forgetting about us(my daughter and I). I ordered a burger and added mozzarella cheese. My burger was supposed to come with fries but I never received my fries. My waitress later apologized and offered to boxed them up so I can take them to go. She later returned with the bill and NO fries stating that the cost of the mozzarella cheese ($1.50) was removed from my bill instead. She placed the bill on the table and walked away. About 10 -15 mins went by and I was still waiting to pay my bill. I got impatient and walked to the bar area near the patio to pay. At first the waitress standing there was hesitant to to process my bill but I explained what was going on she processed it and walked away. I could have walked out without paying or without leaving a tip but that&#39;s not me. <br><br>Next time I will stick to just the cheesecake!

Another disappointing visit to Cheesecake Factory. Based on last night&#39;s dinner I think I am done with them.<br>We arrived shortly after 6 and were seated in the front area of the restaurant, through the bar. The lighting was ridiculous..SO dark. I couldn&#39;t even see the booth or menu and saw other tables using their cell phone light to look at the menu. When did the lighting change?<br>Our waitress was such a disappointment, first forgot the lemon for the water, forgot bread, after two requests, and then brought out of one wrong meal.<br>The wine selection isn&#39;t that great and the wine we both ordered was horrible.<br>As for the entrees, again, the crab cakes were blah. My friend got the Chicken Romano and was a pile of spaghetti with breaded chicken, which I found very bland.<br>After attempting to order another drink, not another glass of wine, I never received it. Finally asked for the bill, which reflected that second drink. <br>The worst part about it, $70 for two drinks and two entrees. Isn&#39;t this the Cheesecake Factory? Sorry, I have no issue paying $70 when the food and service reflect the price but Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t that place.<br>I will not return.

I don&#39;t know why people like this place. Very crowded and long wait for everything. Food is ok nothing special. The cheese cake is over priced and can get better other places. 3 Stars cause our service was good. Would have gotten 2 for the price, wait and quality of food. But server was very good.
Sooo yummy. It&#39;s often pretty noisy but it&#39;s worth it for the food. Santa Fe salad is delish (lunch portion or half dinner size is more than enough.) Red Velvet cheesecake Divine!

If you want horrible service and mediocre food at best, then make sure to take your friends and family here! You will be welcomed with uncaring front staff that will promise you to wait for just few minutes when in reality, your group will wait for hours to eternity. Once you&#39;ve all been seated, expect for waitstaff to get your order and wait for another eons. After that long wait, you&#39;d all be served tasteless bland food and questioning yourself why in the world you took your family and friends here in the first place?! Some of you have giftcards you say? Well, like some of the 1-star reviews here, you&#39;re better off calling Uber Eats and Foodie Call to get the tasteless bland food delivered right to your home and avoid the horrible service altogether. So, if you&#39;re still reading this, go do yourself a great favor and keep Yelping to find a better place to eat for your family and friends to eat and actually enjoy. Charlotte is a growing city with so many wonderful restaurants nowadays and unfortunately this place is NOT one of them. You can thank me later ;-)

I stopped in here for the national cheesecake date 1/2 special. I&#39;ve been to various Cheesecake Factory&#39;s all over and this one was no different - delicious cheesecake. Despite be very busy due to the promotion, the line moved quickly and efficiently. I&#39;ll definitely return for cheesecake.

While in town I wanted to treat my mother to a lovely dinner because she had never dined at this franchise before. I had been years earlier with friends of mine and I said that time I had to have my mother try this place as well. I told her she would be in store for a great treat and that&#39;s what she got.<br><br>As we entered this place to put our name the list for a table, the line was out the door and there were many patrons sitting outside in the nice sitting area for there name to be called as well. The wait was about 30 minutes for a table. That was fine since we didn&#39;t have anywhere in particular to go this Saturday afternoon. <br><br>The 30 minutes came and went fast by us people watching others going in and coming out of the mall. Once we turned in our buzzer it was still a 5 minute wait to get seated still. We finally were placed in a busy, small corner of the restaurant by the hostess. This was cool because it was just 2 of us and enough space for both of us.<br><br>Our waitress came and introduced herself within minutes of us sitting down. We looked over the menu for awhile. After bringing our drinks the waitress informed us that she was leaving for the day and another waitress would handled us from here on out. This was fine as long as we still got top notch service.<br><br>The menu was filled with all kinds of things, chicken, pasta, hamburgers, and things like that. I had a very hard trying to choose what I wanted to eat. It was either the Parmesan chicken or the Seafood pasta. I ended up choosing the chicken and my mother chose the &#39;glamburger&#39;. Both were great choices. My dish came with 3 chicken breasts, green beans, and mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were out of this world!!!!! They were absolutely amazing. The chicken and green beans were good but I couldn&#39;t get enough of the potatoes. My mother enjoyed her hamburger and fries. It was a pretty big burger too. We both had tons to take home. <br><br>Then came the dessert!!! How could you go to this restaurant and not order cheesecake?!?!?!?!?!? I&#39;m not a huge fan of cheesecake but I do love a Strawberry cheesecake and that&#39;s what I got and my mother ordered the Key Lime cheesecake. Only complaint I have about my cheesecake is the bottom crust. I didn&#39;t particularly care of it but the rest was delicious.<br><br>My mother really enjoyed this little dinner we had!!! I&#39;m so glad that I was able to have her dine here with me for the first time!!! I&#39;m sure this won&#39;t be her last because she is now HOOKED!!!! I&#39;m sure she would want me to take care of the tab again also!!!! LOL!!!!

This is he first time I have eaten at a Cheesecake in YEARS. Decided, why not? Well, ended up leaving before receiving all of our food. To start off, my other and I each ordered a cocktail. Mine came maybe 10 minutes after ordering it but it took my other&#39;s close to 30 minutes to receive his drink. And that was after complaining. Apparently the bar ran out of one of the ingredients required to make his drink but the bartender just didn&#39;t have time to go grab it from storage..... we also placed an order for the chicken samosas, the loaded tots and the cheeseburger egg rolls. 30 minutes after placing our food order we finally received the cheeseburger egg rolls and the crab cake bites.... (what??????). That is when we found out that they were out of the tots... the waitress never came back to tell us about the tots being sold out and just decided to bring us something else?? Finally our samosas came and as she was bringing them to our table, half of them, including the sauce came flying off the plate and splattered all over the ground. Needless to say, this experience has reminded me why I haven&#39;t been here in years and definitely do not plan on coming back again.

Spoiler Alert!!! I didn&#39;t have cheesecake! I know! I know! <br><br>I used to love Cheesecake Factory. I mean I would find any excuse to go here...but after a while things changed, the food was different and I stopped going. And then my friends came to visit from Virginia and where did they wanna go????  Our good old standby...of course! <br><br>And here we go:<br><br>Drinks: <br>My favorite for a long time has been their Georgia Peach. Vodka, Peach liquor swirled with raspberries and topped with a mint leaf so it looks like a peach in a glass. Perfect! Always delicious, and most certainly expect to order two! Mmmmmm! <br><br>Appetizers:<br>We ordered the wings without the sauce. They were okay. A little dry but we just doused them in blue cheese and ranch. There are plenty of other options so unless you&#39;re craving wings try something else. We also ordered the Buffalo Blasts. Now these things are freaking delicious! It&#39;s chicken, cheese and buffalo sauce stuffed in a wonton and fried. You can always sign me up for anything with the words &#34;fried, chicken and cheese&#34; in the description. They were ahhhhmazing! Crispy on the outside juicy flavorful meat stuffed on the inside (and they are not stingy with the filling) served hot with ranch dressing...like Nike says Just Do It! You can thank me later! <br><br>Dinner: <br>I ordered the Herb Crusted Salmon. It comes with mashed potatoes and asparagus over a lemon sauce. I&#39;m a huge fan of the lemon sauce (always ask for extra) but last night the salmon just didn&#39;t do it for me. Don&#39;t get me wrong, portion size was not the issue. But it was just very bland. The potatoes are chunky with pieces of the red skin, not a favorite for me but that&#39;s just my personal preference. The asparagus was cooked perfectly and dipped in the lemon sauce....simply divine! <br><br>Overall, the meal was just okay. Nowhere near as good as I used to remember but not bad by any means. I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back...and yes I&#39;ll make sure to get a piece of cheesecake.

It&#39;s always a treat to go and eat here. This past week I was there twice once for lunch and a early dinner. What I truly appreciate about this restaurant is the portion sizes are substantial no matter what time a day you decide to eat there. I&#39;ve been there for brunch and still had left overs. Dinner was again exceptional!

If I could give this zero stars, I would. It&#39;s been a while since I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory and I will tell everyone I know NOT to go there, at least not to this location. <br>We got there early to put our name in for a table since the wait is usually long and they do not take reservations (which is absolutely absurd). They said it would be an hour wait which was fine since the rest of the people that were eating dinner with us were not scheduled to arrive until the time they said we would have a table. When our pager went off early we went to get the table and get some drinks &amp; appetizers while waiting on others to arrive. They said we couldn&#39;t do that and had to have the majority of our party present to be seated. This would have been good information to have when we put in our name. It took an HOUR AND A HALF to get a table after our name was called initially. Then once we were seated, it took over an hour to get any food. Had this not been for a birthday &amp; we could have all gone somewhere else, we would have. It was absolutely unacceptable to make people wait that long especially when the restaurant didn&#39;t have that many large groups. The two managers kept telling us, &#34;oh we&#39;re wiping down a table for you right now.&#34;  DO NOT go to this location. The food was extremely over priced for what we got on top of everything. There are so many other restaurants around there that are much
Pretty good food pretty good service huge menu great ambiance terrific place to go for a family meal. Serving sizes are huge.  The cheesecake is absolutely delicious the Oreo is my personal favorite
Steak, and appetizers are good, as well as cheesecakes. Waiting/Service could be a little better.

We love Cheesecake Factory! We make it a point to stop in here for lunch anytime we are leaving Charlotte to go home to Columbia. Today we had a great experience! <br><br>We started with Tuna Tartare, which was beautifully presented and very fresh. We loved it, and it was a nice diversion from some of their &#34;not so healthy&#34; appetizers. For lunch, I ordered my favorite Louisiana Chicken Pasta and the S.O. ordered teriyaki chicken. Both were excellent! Our server was awesome and we really had a great lunch with several drinks. We don&#39;t love corporate places, but this place is an exception to that rule!

Friendly service and delicious food. The menu can be daunting, but my family has been there enough times that we typically order the same items (Steak Medallions, Chicken Madeira, and Meatloaf). We did try the Chicken Lettuce wraps this time and they were delicious!! (Reminded me of a mini Bahn Mi in a lettuce cup. Yum!)  <br><br>We used the new Cheesecake Factory app on our iPhones to track our food as we ordered and used it to for payment, too. We didn&#39;t have to wait for a check and didn&#39;t need to pass around our credit/debit card either. It was pretty cool!

We&#39;ve been coming here for years, and will continue too if they keep up this excellent service. There are times when it&#39;s absurdly crowded and waiting for an hour for a table. <br><br>I&#39;ve probably had the Herb Crushed Filet of Salmon over a few dozen times. Consistently good, what can I say. <br><br>Avocado Egg Rolls for your app is a sure thing, ask for the ranch to dip with, believe me, it will change your outlook. <br><br>Staff most of the time are tentative, occasionally there are times when service is slow, but that&#39;s expected with high volume locations. <br><br>Most definite recommendation. The menu is overwhelming, and I&#39;ll need to try more to get a better understanding overall, but so far everything has enough taste to keep coming back.

Avocado Egg Rolls are delicious!  We ordered the Chicken with Lemon Couscous &amp; Blackened Shrimp dinners.  Of course had to get the chocolate mousse cheesecake to go...the best!  The Cheesecake Factory has something for everyone.  Only bad thing about this location was cleanliness...our table wasn&#39;t very clean when we sit down and overall sanitation could be better.

OK so why does it always take a bad experience to bring me to Yelp to post a review!<br><br>I love adding food pictures (944 of them if you want to know) , but tonight there was no food, so inevitably there are no photos of food.     <br><br>Why you may ask?       <br><br>Well, let me explain.<br><br>It was around 9:45pm or so when we entered the restaurant, there were no lines or waiting, so we (my wife and I) were promptly seated in what I will refer to as man bun hell.<br><br>After being seated between two groups of folks along the bar seating area, we were just getting a taste of the evenings adventure as it took approx 5-6 minutes for our server to come over and take our drink order.  We ordered ONE Chicken Marsala to be split, It was not long after that our bread and water arrived, but that was all.  By now it was around 10pm as this was clearly stated by our guest at the table beside us as it was getting late and they were ready to leave.  It was about 5 minutes later that the table to the  right of us received their meals and they had time to finish their food even after ordering 5 deserts to go.  At last look, it was 10:38, we had run out of time, patience and understanding.  Our server appeared to be distracted by a table we will refer to as &#34;friends&#34; since he was at that table for at least ten minutes - socializing.<br><br>He did bring by an empty plate for us to share our meal should it ever arrive.  We received two refills during this time. At no time was an apology given for the lack of food coming from the kitchen.  The table to the right was cleaned and a new group of four guest were seated.  The hostess stated that they would be taken care of &#34;she promised&#34;......I stated that &#34;they should not believe the lies&#34;, as we were obviously not taken care of.  They brought this to their service attention, but our own server arrived and I made it clear that we were leaving.  He suggested that we speak to a manager, however it was too late.  I stopped by the hostess stand but the manager came by.<br><br>During this time, the server was observed laughing and showing no interest toward any guest.<br><br>Upon leaving the restaurant I called and was promptly placed on hold for seven minutes.<br><br>I understand busy nights, but this was just not the case.<br><br>I will be following up on this review........

Came here at a really busy time and the restaurant ended up being out of the item to make one of the appetizers. The manager personally came to our table and apologized while also offering another appetizer at no charge. Great service! <br><br>The food was absolutely delicious. Been here several times and will always come back for the Thai lettuce wraps and the white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake.

I like Cheesecake Factory not just for the cheesecakes. Good selection of food for lunch or dinner.  I had the shrimp and chicken gumbo and was able to get brown rice with that which is great. The menu has plenty of burgers, sandwiches, steaks, burritos, etc. good selection of salads as well. <br>The downside to Cheesecake Factory is the wait to get a table. They are usually pretty busy during normal meal times. I was with a large group and was told the wait would be 30 to 45 minutes but we only waited about 20 minutes.

I have been to CF a number of times but I haven&#39;t been back in a while and I felt the need to write a review for my most recent visit. I had the pleasure of taking my entire family (wife and 5 children - 14, 10, 10, 7, 5) plus a 6 yo friend of my 7 yo daughter to eat at CF for my 7 year old&#39;s birthday dinner. I realize it was 7pm on a Wed night (not a weekend night), but it was still busy. So - it was crazy, to say the least - loud, annoying, yelling, constant battles between the boys, unnecessary comments and touching, eye rolls and sighs...you know the drill.<br><br>But CF and my server were FANTASTIC and handled it all with serious grace and professionalism. <br><br>Look - the food at CF is good. Very good. Yes, the Factory Burrito is flippin huge and enough for an entire village to eat. Yes, their cheesecakes are absurdly large and delish. Yes, their menu is a bit overpriced, especially some of the kids&#39; meals. But it is truly hard to complain due to the quality of the food.<br><br>But my issues with CF in the past have almost entirely been about service. Not THIS time, however. <br><br>I got there early to get a table (b/c they still have that stupid &#34;no reservation&#34; rule, ugh). The Hostess was very nice and went out of her way to help, even making sure my name stayed at the top of the list while I waited for my family to arrive (2 cars). We were settled into a large, round booth-thing. ONE SERIOUS ISSUE - the booth&#39;s seat fabric was TERRIBLE. It was literally missing in multiple places with stuffing popping out. Unreal. It wasn&#39;t uncomfortable or anything, just VERY ugly and not what I expect for Southpark and the prices they charge.<br><br>Anyway - our server was amazing. She was constantly there, getting constant refills for my camel-like kids, never getting upset about all the yelling and things being spilled. She got our food out ASAP and was always (somehow) happy to help us with the (stupidest) requests from my children (including needing crayons to color - which she somehow found - and paper). I honestly cannot say enough about her and the rest of the staff there. THANK YOU - it was so nice to be treated with such courtesy and respect even when busy in a huge restaurant with &#34;difficult&#34; patrons.

Having been to The Cheesecake Factory many times, we anticipated great food and great service. That is exactly what we got tonight. Our server was attentive to our table, including our two children, and she made sure we enjoyed our meal and our experience at The Cheesecake Factory. Having seen other people try several other menu items, we each decided to try new things. We started off with the Fried Macaroni and Cheese and Guacamole &amp; Chips. My wife had the Lettuce Wrap, I had the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, and our guest had the Pasta Di Vinci. We will each have these again one day soon...unless we decide to try something new again. We always enjoy our meals and service at The Cheesecake Factory. (Sorry we did not post pictures this time, we were really hungry).

Not the place to go to if you are in any hurry or hungry. I was fine with the 1 hour wait, but then to order food and after an hour still hasn&#39;t arrived. Finally an hour and 15 min later food does arrive. Food was good, had the Steak Diane which had steak medallions and mashed potatoes. Came out hot and flavored just right. The wait was discouraging, but food made up for it a little. Sever could have checked in on us a little bit more often. So to clarify we arrived at 6:15pm and paid our bill and left at 9pm.

The food is ok at this restaurant, but in my opinion is quite overpriced and not worth the massive lines that are ALWAYS there.<br>But what IS worth the wait? THE CHEESECAKES! You will wait about 20 minutes (expect to add to that on a Saturday night) to order and receive your cheeaecake, but it is soooooooooooo worth the wait. They have at least 30 different varieties to pick from (which makes for a few minutes of intense anxiety when deciding) and I haven&#39;t had a bad one yet! <br>Take my advice, go eat your meal somewhere else and take the money you save and then come here and buy extra slices of this heavenly cheesecake!
Subpar services. Takes them an hour to bring you the food. Barely refilled my drink. I would blame amjads evil eye but this time its CF&#39;s fault.

I ordered a salad off the &#34;superfood&#34; menu that proclaimed to have a plethora of nutrious goodness and ended up in a bowl fit for three people comprised mostly of iceberg lettuce. Dissapointing. The service was slow, too. <br><br>However, I also got an avacado tartare, don&#39;t remember which fish was used. That was adorable and tasty but it had waaaay too much soy sauce that was not on the side and included hella fattening pita chips, a classic American adulteration of something supposed to be so pure, gah. It was tasty, though.

Let me start by saying, Ive been to the Cheesecake Factory plenty of times but as server this was the worst experience of my life, and I&#39;m not even exaggerating. <br>The server Leticia started off decent.... she didn&#39;t know how to discuss one of the entrees with my cousin and was coming off very rude and stand off ish. On a Monday night we waited approximately 35-40 minutes on our food. Our water was empty for almost 30 mins while we waited for our food that had to be sent back several times. My aunt ordered a pasta dish that had a basil drizzle as a garnish (that was not listed) and sent it back, it took 20 mins to receive that entree (everyone was finished with their meal). There was many server errors within this experience such as bringing sauce when food is complete, not enagaging in our request, slamming spoons on the table for dessert, the list can go on. My biggest issue is ordering a salmon for  $21 and it was cold...which is ok however, when I asked for it to be sent back, when it came back to the table the entree was STILL cold! At this point I wanted to talk to a manger or something, CJ the manager who came over had every excuse in the book as to why my salmon, mashed potatoes, asparagus and cream sauce was borderline freezing (as if taken out of the cooler). He was standing there kind of going back and forth with myself and my cousin (both of which are server) trying to justify my cold dish. I specifically told him to make me a BRAND new piping hot salmon and I want it to go because we are on a time constraint and we have to leave. 2-5 minutes later he shows up with my ORIGINAL salmon in a to go container over a plate and it is STILL cold. I am pissed the h**l off! <br>This night was supposed to be an amazing night for my family and I and turned out to be the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had or one that I&#39;ve ever seen. To top it off this fool comped my dessert as well as my aunts food but my Salmon that had issue was still on the bill. <br>Because I know how this industry works paying $158 for this experience is not sitting well with me and I do not recommend this location whatsoever, this restaurant was very unprofessional and unpleasant as if it was their first day on the job. <br>My family and I will not be returning!

Check your bags people! I waited 45 minutes just to pick up cheesecake, which is fine because it was busy. I ordered two slices and once I got home I threw them in the fridge; We weren&#39;t ready to eat them yet. Whelp my fault for not checking apparently because neither one of the slices I ordered ended up in my bag. I even left a tip when I paid for my order at the dessert bar (which I doubt people do often) and was extra nice to the staff because I could see they were running around busy and stressed out. I wanted to be kind because I felt like they could use a boost. Super annoyed. Won&#39;t be making that mistake ever again.

So listen... it&#39;s not BAD. They&#39;re just not consistent. And when I say that, I mean it in every sense of the word. You could get something spectacular one night and order the same dish again the next night and not get the same quality.<br><br>I went there with the lady and another couple to celebrate achievements on all of our parts. The girls ordered drinks, which they thoroughly enjoyed.  And then the food came out.<br><br>I ordered...uh... some jamaican jerk thing? With chicken instead of shrimp? Jeez, it&#39;s so hard to remember when the menu is that big. I&#39;m sure that there are a bunch of jamaican jerk things with chicken. But this one had beans and a mango pineapple salsa! And plantains!  The chicken was excellent, the slaw was good (but room temp, not cold), the beans were okay (they lacked seasoning), and the yucca was seriously overcooked. I was with my Irish buddy who had never seen plantains before and he asked me if I ordered shit (yes, they were that charred and shriveled. I gotta say, I don&#39;t blame him). However, it&#39;s really hard to mess up the internal flavor of a plantain, and overall, it was fine.<br><br>The lady ordered Fish Tacos, and she was not pleased. But I can&#39;t blame her, they had soaked the damn thing is so much sauce that the actual tortilla broke when she tried to pick it up because it was too saturated. She said it also lacked any flavor, though I didn&#39;t try it.<br><br>The cheesecake IS consistently wonderful though. I do wish they gave a weeee bit bigger slices, but what can you do. <br><br>I do enjoy coming here, I really do, but... it never turns out to be as good as I think it&#39;s going to be. Phew. Feels good to get that off my chest.

Love this place!! Yes you have to wait a while to be seated. But every time we go we put our name on the list and keep an eye out at the bar area since it is first come first serve and end up getting a table there before the buzzer goes off so we turn it in. I have been here so many times for lunch &amp; dinner. Tonight we came for dinner with my husband and step daughter. I always order the same thing barbecue ranch chicken salad is the best!! My husband gets something different all the time and loves everything he gets. My step daughter always gets four cheese pasta and loves it all the time she gets it. Tonight we all shared chocolate moose cheese and it was delish!! <br><br>You have to be very patient when you go there. The waiters guys &amp; gals are awesome for the amount of people they have to take care of. Always so positive and friendly.

Where do I start. <br><br>The tableware was dirty and our waiter had an attitude when we asked for another set. <br>The service was slow to non existent. The restaurant was not busy and the waiter only had three tables, one of which had already closed out and the other came as we were leaving. There was simply no excuse for the poor service.<br><br> The fried calamari was horrible. It had no flavor. <br><br>This place has really gone down hill over the years.

Not that great.......when we arrived they told us there was a 40 minute wait but we got called after 10 minutes which was nice. After 20 minutes, we were finally served our drinks and delicious bread and butter. Our food came about 40 minutes after we ordered which was pretty annoying. I had Salmon, mashed potatoes, and broccoli which was just ok. The salmon had a nice sear but was lacking a bit of seasoning. The mashed potatoes were amazing but the broccoli was cold and hard. My grandparents and aunt and uncle all had the avocado egg rolls and buffalo blasts. They all liked the buffalo blasts but the avocado egg rolls were not so great. Then the complications happened, my aunt asked for ranch because she didn&#39;t like the blue cheese the buffalo blasts came with and my grandmother asked for a salad since she said the food was too greasy for her. We waited 20 minutes and got nothing, so we told the manager. Nothing either after 10 minutes. FINALLY, we got our ranch and salad and they told us sorry and didn&#39;t charge us for it. Overall, I wasn&#39;t impressed by The Cheesecake Factory so I don&#39;t really recommend it.

If you want carry out be ready to wait. My husband was on hold for 5 minutes so I called. It took awhile for someone to answer  &amp; when they did I told them that my husband had been waiting 5 minutes on hold to place an order. He responds, &#34;Well do you want to place an order?&#34;. I responded, Not if I have to wait another 5 minutes&#34;, to which the employee says, &#34;Five minutes is good for this time of night&#34; (8 PM). I then hung up. Cheesecake Factory your food is not that good &amp; we don&#39;t patronize restaurants who act like they&#39;re doing us a favor to serve us. I punched in one star but meant to do no stars!

I don&#39;t normally complain when going to restaurants, but this was the worst experience I have ever had in my life. The wait time is ridiculous for horrible service and overpriced food. The sweet tea I ordered was terribly sweet and when I politely told our waitress that and asked if I could get a Coke instead she rudely replied (and I quote), &#34;Well, I mean it is sweet tea so what did you expect.&#34; And then she never brought a different drink back nor returned to our table. I definitely will not be returning to the restaurant just like she never returned to our table.

We all know that the Cheesecake Factory is amazing in every way, but what makes this particular location is their staff. Our waiter, Greg, was nothing short of amazing. He was personable, patient, and made us feel right at home. He went above and beyond to make sure our evening was time well spent at the Cheesecake Factory. If you ever stop in here, I would recommend requesting him!

A menu that is a mile long and a wait time going to an hour and a half with no ability to make a reservation is asinine. When we finally did get to the table to sit, we weren&#39;t greeted for about 15 minutes and that was the best part of the evening. After taking our orders, our waitress didn&#39;t check on us again until the food was served but but by that time my wife and I had no water just ice cubes sitting lonely in the bottom of our glass. I ordered the Miso Salmon and my wife ordered the Petite Filet. I wasn&#39;t pleased at all with the Salmon because it was pink in the middle and my wife didn&#39;t really care for the Filet because it wasn&#39;t cooked to order. We decided not to have the food sent back because it would&#39;ve taken forever and two days to get the food back. <br><br>The wait staff seemed like they could care less and on many occasions they were simply MIA. They tried to push desert on us but we were ready to go and get desert someplace else. This is not the type of service I expected because I&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake locations across the states and this was the worst experience. The staff needs more customer focused training and being attentive not blind to the needs of your clients. I based on this experience couldn&#39;t recommend you to spend your money here unless you enjoy mediocre service. I don&#39;t write my review lightly because I understand that business can get packed and scheduling issues can affect service but if you&#39;re in SouthPark, fix that if you expect to stay relevant!

The food here is always amazing. The variety is one of the best things about the menu. The only drawback is no reservations and you can end up waiting a long time at peak hours on the weekends. Cheesecake selection is great and will make the end of the meal special.

I have been dining at this CF since it opened. I have also dined at CF in Miami and other cities. I have never had anything but wonderful experiences here. I can always count on great service and wonderful food. Last visit was on October 12th. One of these days I&#39;ll be able to say I&#39;ve tried everything on the menu, but it will take a while We love The Cheesecake Factory!!

I would give this place no stars if I could :) y&#39;all can kiss my ass. Today was my birthday, we were enjoying the appetizers our waitress was amazing she was great, but my mom took a bite of my dads burger and literally pulled the longest piece of hair out from her throat. That is literally the most disgusting thing ever. Everybody lost their appetites. Fuck the manager, he was barely even sorry. He didn&#39;t seem sorry at all. He basically was like &#34;oh, sorry.&#34; Me and my family all have short hair. He a bitch. Sorry for the vulgar language but he ruined my birthday dinner and we&#39;re going home hungry. Our waitress was more sorry than him. We really paid $100 for food we didn&#39;t even touch. Then he had the audacity to say &#34;but I offered you another burger&#34; ... you really think we finna eat another one of them shits after that nasty ass hair came out..? You gotta be shitting me. We&#39;re literally so disgusted and the manager was so damn rude. Fuck y&#39;all but primarily fuck the manager, I hope you see this, you a bitch on soul. Thank y&#39;all for the AMAZING birthday dinner.

Starting with the good! I love love love the cheesecake and the variety in both entrees and desserts. You always get plenty of food for the price which isn&#39;t going to break your pockets. The staff is always nice, attentive, and quick. That&#39;s where the good ends.<br><br>In the past I frequented this place like every other weekend but as of last year that is not the case. I hate to say this is no longer my favorite place. Cleanliness has become a issue. Barely wiped tables/ seats and crumbs on the floor are too obvious for me to ignore. The food has become very inconsistent and can sometimes be sent back a couple of times before satisfactory or just giving up on the dish completely. <br>It can be super busy so reservations would be nice but that isn&#39;t a big deal if you don&#39;t mind waiting. <br>Overall its just decent at best now with exceptional cheesecake and good service.

Where to start!!!! Everything was amazing from the atmosphere to the cheesecakes to drink time at the bar.  Such a splendid place the food was great. I came here for a family reunion and after church Sunday I suggested the cheesecake factory. Everyone in the group was happy about their order;the spaghetti wonderful we started with a whole thing of appetizers the crab cake appetizer great; the bang bang shrimp oh my gosh! Bistro shrimp amazing grilled pork chop with mashed potatoes and asparagus; outstanding, fried shrimp and just everything!!!! Take a look at the pictures

Love this place!!!!! I ordered some wings without thinking to ask how they were cooked since I am allergic to shellfish. I realized after I had ordered my grilled fish tacos. The serve spoke to the manager and they took it off my bill. What made me love this place more besides the delicious food was that the manager (forgot his name) brought out my plate personally and stated it was totally shellfish free. I really appreciate the fact that he took the time to bring my plate out and acknowledge my special needs. We joked around and he was very nice and accommodating. He was awesome! <br>Now on to the food. I love coffee so I know good coffee when I taste it and their caramel macchiato was amazing. The fish tacos were really good and omg the Mac n chz are a must Have! I chose a simple fresh strawberry cheesecake for dessert.  Usually when a place says fresh I don&#39;t expect it to be really fresh. But the strawberries taste so fresh and sweet and it all went perfect with the cheesecake. I will definitely be going back very soon!

First time to eat here. Don&#39;t understand why we had to give our name and wait to be called before being seated as we were one of the first customers they had and the place was still empty.  It did fill up fast though.  Over all a good experience. Was busy at opening with people waiting to get in. Service seemed a little slow and we had to wait quite some time for our food.  Mostly the only complaint I have.  Though a slice of cheesecake was a bit much at $7.95,  but I guess they have to make their money someway. I would eat here again.

Today was the first bad meal and customer service experience I&#39;ve experienced at any cheesecake factory. I had my usual dish of cajun jumbalaya pasta and it was obvious my portions were reduced and the care taken to prepare the dish was not evident.  The usual food presentation was gone.  My rasberry lemonade was awful.  They have even decreases the portions for cheesecake as well.  Lastly our waitress was very slow. We will not be eating at this particular<br> cheesecake factory in the future.
The burrito and fried cauliflower was sooo  good! My husband sent his Jamican chicken back. It was not to his liking. However, he is Jamaican so he had high hopes lol.

My wife and I have never really had a bad experience at The Cheesecake Factory at SouthPark Mall. Wait staff has always been on point and very attentive. Several times our servers have informed us on options that we were not previously aware of such as paying our bill through the iPhone App, new available Cheesecake options, and even pointing us to the bar for their happy hour specials. <br><br>I would give this location a five star rating but there is one issue I have, consistency. The last couple of times we have gone to do the happy hour in the bar area, our apps that were ordered were different in taste each time. My favorite app are the potstickers, but I ordered them three times and all three time they were different. One time they were overdone, next time they were overloaded with the sauce, third time they were near perfect.  Same type of deal has happened with entrees ordered where one time my meatloaf was dry and the next time was slightly undercooked. <br><br>My only negative is the consistency of the food sent out. Other than that, this location of Cheesecake Factory is a great one.

This used to be my absolute favorite go to restaurant for the last several years. Anytime we had a special occasion we have always gone to the cheesecake factory. My birthday is January 28 and we went there to eat Sunday the 29th. To give them credit it was an insanely busy day, but that was no excuse for the horrific tasting food that they put in front of me. I ordered the sweet corn tamales and I&#39;ve never ordered anything else there because those are my absolute favorite things. The plate was scolding hot the food was stone cold it tasted horrible even my guests tasted it and couldn&#39;t believe how nasty it was.<br><br>One of my friends ordered the cheeseburger with bacon on it and macaroni and cheese and ordered it medium-well... it came out about as raw as steak tartare!!!! They brought her burger then eventually they brought her bacon and even later they finally brought her fries. She ordered ranch dressing to go with her fries and it tasted awful. She&#39;s just a young girl and she was so embarrassed and thought she had done something wrong because her meals so bad that my insisted they take it off my tab. Her mother ordered the chicken Parmesan with carrots and mashed potatoes. She said it was actually quite good except that the carrots or better and not at all what she expected from the description on the menu. <br>All in all, we were there for four hours from the time we sit down at our table until the time that we finally were able to leave. <br><br>Our meal was handled so poorly by the manager that I decided to find a new favorite place for my birthday. This actually makes me quite sad, but I can always order takeout cheesecake, and I found a copycat recipe for my sweet corn tamales. So if I really want them that bad I&#39;ll make them myself.<br><br>Our waitress was actually quite good, it just wasn&#39;t her fault that the food was coming out slowly and was not prepared correctly. She was delightful and really tried hard to keep us from getting out of sorts.
Sitting here and it&#39;s horrible already.  It&#39;s been only 5 minutes.  I hope this doesn&#39;t ruin my daughter&#39;s birthday.

Cleanliness - zero star.  Breadcrumbs on the table and the seat.  Menu was covered with old spilled food and grease.  It was really gross.<br>Food - one star.  Fish and chips with cole slaw.  Fish batter was way under cooked.  I ate one of four pieces and hope I don&#39;t get sick.  The cole slaw had no flavor.  The fries were excellent.<br>Service - three stars.  My water glass was promptly refilled except the lemons were not replenished.<br>Will not return to this location.

This past Saturday I decided to go online and order a to-go meal using the curb side delivery service. Now I realize the SouthPark Mall is busy, but at 3:30pm on a Saturday I thought I would be safe. However, all the designated curb side parking spots were taken, with cars parked permanently there, not people waiting for their food. I found a nearby parking spot and called the number and after it ringing for a good 2-3 minute someone finally picked up and I said I had a pick up. I waited in my car for another 15 minutes, called again with no answer so decided to just go in. This place was chaos, after waiting another 15 min to talk to the hostess she caught someone who was going to help me. Only she walked away and I never saw her for another 10 minutes until I finally left without my meal. I don&#39;t know why this place has a curb side delivery if they can&#39;t operate it efficiently. I came from a target before, and used the same car delivery and within 2 minutes I was on my way. So this was highly frustrating and disappointing. Please remove this service if you aren&#39;t going to operate it effectively.
Open until midnight. Huge menu. International menu offerings. Large servings. Don&#39;t forget dessert!

Received decent service at the bar. Ordered food and it came out wrong. Ordered one slice of cheesecake to go and waited over 20 minutes (still waiting while I write this review). If I hadn&#39;t already paid, I would have left the cheesecake behind. The excuse was &#34;we&#39;re just really backed up right now.&#34; Pretty disrespectful of someone&#39;s time

We have eaten at many Cheesecake Factory locations. This has been by far the worst. We ordered a to go order, waited 45 minutes, got home to have no toppings on my salad, brown avocado in our egg rolls, brown guacamole in my husbands sand which side and zero toppings on our nachos.

The service at this establishment has declined in the past five years. However it does remain one of my favorite places to eat due to the food and environment. They have great sweet tea. Our favorite apps are the fried cheese and the fried zucchini. Highly recommend. For lunch I typically get the turkey club with regular fries. I do frequently order the sweet potato fries as well which are fantastic. When it comes to cheesecake you really can&#39;t go wrong with any of it!! I love the chocolate raspberry truffle though. PERFECT!

We cam here on for happy hour during National Cheesecake Day. Happy hour is M-Sat from 4-6p. Sadly, they do not have any drink specials during happy hour. :(<br>The food though, is amazing! $5.50 for actually small plate sizes, which is a lot. I made the &#34;mistake&#34; of ordering 3 apps for the 2 of us, so much food! We ordered the mac and cheese balls, cheese and spinach dip and southwest chicken rolls. Everything was really good though the cheese and spinach dip could have benefited with some seasoning. The mac and cheese balls and the southwest chicken rolls were very hearty, we had to take a lot of food home with us. <br><br>What I did not like was how much the Long Island Iced Tea costs (I docked 1.5 stars for this), I blew $10.70 for a watered down drink. It did not feel like that much alcohol was in there. I won&#39;t be buying drinks from here again. <br><br>The half off THE FIRST SLICE of cheesecake was a great deal, my boyfriend and I each bought a slice. I got the caramel turtle while he got the tiramisu. The caramel turtle was amazing, wasn&#39;t too cream cheesy and had the right amount of sweetness. The tiramisu was just meh, I wouldn&#39;t get it again. <br><br>Don&#39;t forget to complete the feedback survey, you get $10 ecredit towards your next purchase. Pretty worth it if used during happy hour (there is no fine print saying you can&#39;t).

Mmmmmm.... Ok so with the Cheesecake factory, there are some pros and some cons. <br>Bad news first:<br>Cons: You will wait. Awhile. For a Table. They are always packed. Its a popular destination. The food is OKAY. I mean its called the Cheesecake factory not the Food factory. <br><br>Pros: You can peruse the menu at your leisure while you wait. Its posted outside. Dim lighting...I love me some romantic mood lighting on dates. My dish of choice is the Louisiana chicken. The chicken is fried to perfection and the pasta is delightful. They serve you bread when you are seated which is warm and delicious. The cheesecake. OMG the cheesecake. I haven&#39;t had one I didn&#39;t like. They have any kind you can think of. My favorites are the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle and the Banana Cream. Ok now my mouth is watering.
Alex was our waiter and he was awesome! We celebrated our 35th and our daughter&#39;s 5th wedding anniversary ... dinner was delicious and of course the cheesecake was the best!!

Now I found my second favorite item on the 100 page menu. The truffle bacon cheese bread. It&#39;s delectable and delicious. I really coulda just had that - since it&#39;s was like a grilled cheese - an awesome high brow grilled cheese cut into 4 strips! I&#39;m only giving 3 stars cause the pasta a order was ok. Basic. But my shrimp were terribly over cooked. Which I paid extra to add em. Live and learn.

Great atmosphere; great food and of course the cheesecake is amazing. Went for lunch and there wasn&#39;t any wait time. Host and Wait staff was amazing and friendly. I love Mexican food and I decided to get the factory burrito and it was huge and tasty. Plus after you have a great lunch, visit the mall for some retail therapy, then come back to Cheesecake Factory for your cheesecake to go.

Consistently terrible service.  From bakery cashiers who lick their fingers to separate bags, to messing up orders, and extremely long waits (even for pickup), this is by far one of the worst CF locations ever.

I haven&#39;t even gotten my meal and already having a terrible experience. Took 7 minutes for a server to come and greet us, never introduced herself, brought over our drinks. Bread hasn&#39;t even come to the table. She&#39;s more focused on all her other tables and guess what? They all have bread..<br>Driver over an hour and a half for this?
Worst service ever!!!! Drinks stayed empty, server ignored us and one person in our party got the wrong order.

(Revised) GRADUATES BEWARE!! Please do not waste your time coming here if you have a large party. There were 15 people in my party including children. I had my fiancé leave my graduation early (after I crossed the stage of course) so that we could have a table by the end of the ceremony as they do not take reservations on Saturday after 11am. Surprisingly not being busy at all when he arrived he was able to put our names down and was told it would be 1 1/2 hour wait which was ok considering the graduation was not over. Every time we asked how much longer they would tell us it wouldn&#39;t be much long until we were seated, not realizing how much time had passed. To make a long story short, we waited 3 1/2 hours to be seated at a table that was not ready (receptionist told us to follow an employee where we would be seated and the table was not ready so we had to stand in front of customers that were eating, employees still putting together tables and chairs that they found around the restaurant and somehow forgot how to count as they didn&#39;t have enough for us to sit). After trying to get everyone seated a receptionist who seemed frustrated with having to help put tables together she decided it was ok to talk to us with attitude as if she wanted to start an altercation with a family member of mine. Mind you that WE had been EXTREMELY PATIENT AND UNDERSTANDING THE ENTIRE TIME. While this was happening I happened to glance down at my silverware that was placed in front of me, only to find that it had someone else&#39;s leftover food (possibly spinach) on the fork! At that point I made the decision to leave. My mother spoke to the manager who handled us in a careless way as if he had NO CUSTOMER SERVICE TRAINING AT ALL, he did nothing to accommodate us. My advice to Cheesecake Factory is, DO NOT TELL CUSTOMERS YOU CAN HANDLE A LARGE PARTY IF IT IS SUCH AN INCONVENIENCE. We went over to Maggiano&#39;s where we were literally seated within 10 minutes, enjoyed our meals with no problems from the delightful staff who congratulated me and gave not only a complementary dessert but I was offered a job as a Pastry Chef ( I graduated from Johnson &amp; Wales). My family and I have been loyal customers to this establishment for as long as I can remember but this experience put a bad taste in our mouths. We will not return to this location and I am making it known that this place clearly needs help.

This location is fantastic!  There is tons if great shopping that can be had prior to your cheesecake fulfilling experience.  Some things I would like to mention about the restaurant:<br>-The waitstaff are extremely nice and very helpful.  You will never worry about your cup going dry!  They also get the food to you in a hurry so that it doesn&#39;t every get cold, if it isn&#39;t supposed to be, waiting to arrive at your table.  <br>-The bathrooms are always clean and fully stocked.  <br>-The bar is an awesome area where the bartender is super nice and can help you pick the perfect cocktail to complement your choice of cheesecake (or food).<br>-The food ranges from pasta to salads to seafood to anything you can think of.  There is no shortage of options when it comes to this menu!!  <br>Lastly, the music they play is always best enjoyed on the outside patio on a nice afternoon with a glass of wine.  The patio is my choice of seating!!  <br><br>My only critical review would be that the waiter who brought our cheesecakes to our table reeked of cigarette smoke.  Not such a big fan of the stuff and kind of makes me nauseated.  (Not really a feeling I&#39;m going for after stuffing my face with awesome food)<br><br>Love this place!!

A huge thank you to Jamie for accommodating my large party. I love his personality and he is an asset to your establishment. Also my server Courtney was wonderful, PATIENT, and constantly kept our glasses full.<br>The food was as expected (tasteful, large portions and fresh.) Our only problem was a salad containing beets and asparagus arrived without those items. The cooking staff should have informed the patron or the server of the issue. A manager did address it once the mistake was realized and informed us that they were out of beets.<br>As for the other meals, the food was hot and fresh. Well seasoned and the chicken is never dry. Their meatloaf is double the average serving you would receive in other places.  Most people will have enough for a box to go. Good food, good service.
The wait to eat was very long.  Also the wait after placing order for lunch was very long.   Glad we were not on a dead line or in a time crunch.

Usually I like coming here...but today the waiter seemed condescending.  Also there was four orders of shrimp bistro that the customers said were bad. The manager listened to the complaints and said sorry and walked away.  After 15 minute and no return, we asked for him again and had the food removed from the ticket. Bad all the way around.   Seriously thinking never to come again and tell coworkers to avoid.
Cheesecake Factory, is challenged by managing the crowd it attracts but never disappoints  on variety.
Besides the ludicrous decor, I enjoyed eating here. Even with the Eye of Sauron watching me.

For such a highly recommend place the service and wait time was awful. My family and I went March the 23rd, we got there at 2:30 and were told we had to wait an hour and a half despite there being a good 20% of their tables left. It being my aunts birthday we were going to wait the asked time. When the hour and a half was up we went back to get seated ,and were told that &#34;there was a problem in the kitchen&#34; that had set them back half an hour, so we waited another half an hour; went back and checked, another fifteen minutes. At this point we&#39;re debating whether or not to stay, but we were told &#34;you&#39;re third in line&#34; , and waited inside. While waiting in line we were listening in on the manager to see who was being called next and noticed an odd pattern of wait times, upon further listening and observing we noticed that the man was being racist. I can&#39;t remember for the life of me what this man looked like other than he was tall and white. People of color would come in and get a three hour wait time then some white people would come in and get an hour, which is absolutely absurd. After waiting a little more we were seated and asked for another manager, we complained about the mans blatant racism and ridiculously long wait times; he said he&#39;ll take care of the problem and apologized, he was very nice but only came back at the end of the meal to say that he would do something nice for us; he never did. All of the food was good other than a steak being burnt, and the waitress was the nicest we could&#39;ve had, despite the manager being awful to everyone in his path. After we finish we pay and leave; once we were home we called corporate to alert them of the wreck that the Charlotte Cheesecake Factory was, and after two weeks we were sent a twenty-five dollar apology check for something we drove a hour and a half for and paid at least 175 for, we were never called back or assured that the manager was taught some basic human decency.
Waited over an hour to receive a to-go slice of cheesecake because the ticket was lost.

I love the Cheesecake Factory and this was my first time visiting this location but my mother and I are truly disappointed and concerned. When we initially received our food it was cold so we sent it back. After the food was returned as I was finally enjoying my meal I noticed a mixture of rice in my steak gravy. We both ordered Steak Diane w/Shrimp Scampi neither of which are served with rice. After bringing it to the attention of our waiter he went to speak with his manager. A few moments later the manager (Liz) comes to our table and after explaining the issues we&#39;ve encounter ed offers us free dessert. You can&#39;t be serious right? There is obviously an issue going on with food handling and cross contamination in the kitchen and you are offering us free dessert. We advised that we&#39;d prefer for that plate to be taken off as we were no longer comfortable eating from the establishment. She finally takes a closer look at the plate and says &#34;Oh my I don&#39;t know how that happened let me take this away&#34;. After another few mins our server comes back asking the outcome of us speaking with management so we advised that after taking the plate she NEVER returned or attempted to gain agreement on a proposed resolution. Our waiter then goes to look for the manager to follow up and returns advising that she proposed to take 25% off of that plate. We expressed our dissatisfaction with that resolution as that meal could not be finished and this was the second issue with that plate. A few mins later another manager (Justin) comes over and after moments of conversation agrees to remove that meal. During our interaction with Justin it was stated that the previous manager advised of a proposed 25% off because the majority of the meal had been eaten which was an outright LIE. Whether the plate was half empty or half full if signs of contamination are shown there is a major issue. Thankfully those weren&#39;t peanuts on that plate which could have caused me to go into anaphylactic shock. Please be careful eating at this establishment. We appreciate the care and concern shown by our waiter Marc and manager Justin but I doubt we will return to this location.

It&#39;s disappointing to say that Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t exceed my expectations. I&#39;ve been an avid Cheesecake Factory fan for years but now I realize why I never compliment the service. <br><br>The food is amazing as well as their fantastic cheesecakes. There&#39;s a large variety so there really is a little something for everyone.<br><br>However, I&#39;ve come to realize that I have the same issues almost every time I come as far as the amount of time I&#39;m waiting on food/service. <br><br>Today I happened to want to surprise my family with some cheesecake and tried calling ahead numerous times to put in a to go order and no one picked up the phone. I understood and shrugged thinking that it must be busy. I am a server and working in the food/restaurant industry has given me a very forgiving perspective. Come to find that when I walk in the door, it is completely dead and the hostess is letting the phone ring nonstop without picking it up. <br><br>Now this could be the hostess&#39; fault for ignoring her duties and I will always come back for the food--but I urge Cheesecake Factory to put their employees to be the absolute best they can be.

I ordered calamari,had better in maggianos, ordered stuffed mushrooms..had better at Olive Garden.. There is something about this place that just doesn&#39;t give me the &#34;I want to go back the food was that good&#34; vibe... Cheesecakes are great,so I guess I could come back for some of those!

Ive eaten at Cheesecake Factory at other locations and had a much better experience, so here we go....We arrive around 12ish on a sunday, which was a horrible time at the South Park mall, dont do it, unless U are jus that bored.  We waited approx 1hr, didnt leave because we knew all the other restaurants would have the same wait time. Once we were seated it went all down hill from there. We didnt get a &#34;hey how are U&#34; nor good afternoon, The waitress Whitney K. acted as if we were a bother the whole time. I ordered the veggie appetizer, had to ask for sauce, then I ordered the fish and chips-  asked her if I could substitute the the cole slaw, she said &#34;no its a Garnish and we cant do that&#34;. She never asked if I wanted to maybe pay extra for a salad or maybe another item. I had to ask for vinegar for my fish, not really understanding at this point why I didnt jus pay and leave. I was so done so no matter what she said or did I wasnt hearing it. Next I asked for the manager, he proceeded to listen and apologize. <br><br>The food really wasnt good after all this mishap, we paid and I left no Tip, which I have never done, this could have been my child. But I feel U should give 100% at work at all times, if not GO home, plenty of people need a job. Im not always happy at work either but I make sure I dont reflect this in my service to the public. Once a manager or owner of a business has mastered this with there employees U will have happy customers who will wait and return. I went to Olive Garden the next day, and the staff were all 100% my waiter earned the 20% I left him. I never asked for anything, he was very professional and they were busy on Memorial Day!!<br><br>Now this tops it off, before leaving I saw Miss Whitney show my receipt to the manager, I left no TIP, she made a weird face to him....really do U expect me to leave my hard earned money to someone who was rude to my family???  I wont return, my coins will B spent elsewhere....ENUFFSAID

Confusion is not inherently bad, for when one thing is mistaken for another, it only means that the two entities share similar qualities. The Cheesecake Factory is a place of much confusion, but the confusion only testifies to its goodness. <br><br>The atmosphere and architecture can be confused for an Indian palace.<br><br>The kind wait staff are indistinguishable from Chick-fil-A employees.<br><br>The menu can easily be mistaken for a phonebook. <br><br>The bathrooms parallel dimly lit, royal throne rooms of old. <br><br>The bill has an uncanny resemblance to the U.S. national debt. <br><br>The cheesecake, however, is distinctly unique. It cannot be confused with anything else, for it is the object that other great and wonderful things are confused with. It is, indeed, the magnum opus of the dessert world.

Our first visit to TCF ever! Really loved our appetizers got the pork belly sliders, definitely recommended! Also loved the Georgia Peach blended drink. Service was wonderful and surprised by the quickness of the staff. We will be back to this location!

I went to this restaurant 2 years ago so I&#39;m not sure if it had changed but when I went the service was one of the only good things about this place. The wait was unbearably long, restaurant was packed, the menu was ginormous so it was impossible read all the items and choose. It&#39;s was super expensive but wasn&#39;t even that good. Our waiter was amazing though.

1 hour wait today, be patient.  Strawberry Lemonade is always good!  Little crab cakes as app. is a must try.  Hibachi Steak is fantastic and my favorite.  Headed home with fresh strawberry cheesecake.  Small groups are better on the weekends.
Had a great lunch. A little pricey but worth it. The food was good and so was the service. Highly recommend.
I ordered curbside and paid extra for sautéed asparagus. I get all the way home and there&#39;s no. Sautéed. Asparagus. Annoying.

The Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant. Some may find it odd that I rarely even get cheesecake here. Their food is very high quality. A huge menu which I&#39;ve had the pleasure of trying out most of their options. A meal can range anywhere from $12 (for a burger) to $30 (for the filet). $20-25 per person is the usual on how much I spend. What makes it so great is the food is worth the price but portions are usually double or even triple size.<br><br>My favorite appetizer is the fried macaroni and cheese. My favorite entree is the ribeye. And the best entree for the money, is the Cajun Chicken Littles. About 10-12 normal sized, delicious, hand breaded, crispy, chicken tenders, a scoop of awesome mashed potatoes, and some very good corn succotash; just a $15.99 price tag.<br><br>Highly recommend TCF.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite chains. I really enjoy the dessert. The service is always very nice. One takeaway is that this establishment is always busy so try to make reservations. The atmospheres inviting and the decor is very stylish.

The menu is long so many good options. We get a salad to start . Arrived on time for lunch menu the first waitress is friendly but she is on time for leave her shift then a second waitress no much friendly and rush the thinks around her name is Denisha. No make time pleasant this is why 2 star

I really want to give this a 2, but since the food was good...I have to make it a 3. I ordered the southwest chicken sandwich...and a few minutes later the water told me they are out of the bread it comes on, so I needed to order something else. I asked if I could just have it on a different type of bread and he said no. Apparently, the ingredients are &#34;pre-measured&#34; for the type of bread it goes on....WHAT?!?!? Just change the damn type of bread! If a kitchen can not just make the sandwich fit on a different bread, we have problems. So, I ordered the chicken avocado club, and it was decent. Chicken was cooked well, fries and ranch were very good. Husband got the lunch shepherd pie and he said it was good as well. I&#39;d suggest skip it for food (it&#39;s a chain...I mean, it is what it is), and just go for cheesecake.

Below average food! Ordered buffalo blast and stuffed mushroom. Terrible! The buffalo blast - such a waste of dish and presentation. The mushrooms had cheese that had dried up!<br>Raspberry cheesecake- not great either. The syrup tasted like - cough syrup !<br>Sorry to say but Very disappointed!

Great go to restaurant when you are just not sure what you want or you are dining with finicky folks.  Their menu is so all encompassing you&#39;ll have a hard choosing a dish.  Simply cannot go wrong with a salad from Cheesecake Factory, Santa Fe is my go to one and I get it near on every visit.

Took 9 family members tonight for dinner. We got there at 3:00pm but didn&#39;t get seated until 5:00pm. They were honest when I checked in and told me it would be 2 or 2 1/2 hour wait so I can&#39;t fault them for that. There was several different types of food ordered and all of it was good. But I ordered a NY Strip steak and it was not as good as I expected it to be I rate it on the low end of good. The interaction of the family was great and most cleaned their plates. The desert cheesecake was outstanding. The service was very good Angel B did an outstanding job serving and her personality was bright and cheerful.

Always a long wait, usually 2 hours. Service can be great or can be terrible. But most importantly, they were recently rated &#34;B&#34; in cleanliness because employees were using bare hands in food prep and service and other problems.

The wait staff was too busy. We didn&#39;t get the attention we needed. She was stopped we 3 times before she could get back to our table to get our dessert order.  We drove all the way up from Columbia for my daughter&#39;s birthday dinner and was slightly disappointed. The portions were smaller than I remember. The bathrooms were filthy and the display case for the cheesecakes was nasty. I was disappointed. It has been a year since our last visit and the trip was a total waste of drive time and money.

Their food used to be good now it&#39;s just bad.  Food is very inconsistent. You get too much sauce another time you get hardly any. Ingredients left out of dishes. No garlic or basil in scampi sauce. Food is flavorless and takes a at least 40 minutes.<br><br>I had lunch at the bar Roland seemed impaired.  First he forgot to ring in my order, He did apologize for the mistake and gave me 2 free rounds of drinks to make up for it. But he kept repeating himself and breaking stuff. There is a older man, heavy set with grey hair and glasses that I have heard  cursing and throwing a check book at the computer. Both times I couldn&#39;t find  a manager.<br>I gave them one star but that is generous.
