Took extremely to long to have food brought to our table and was not worth the wait.. With a sanitation rating of 94 not sure about it either after seeing their cleanliness of the restaurant it self. Hope it&#39;s not always this bad. NOT WORTH THE PRICE !

It&#39;s always pretty busy because it is attached to the mall, but all in all, the service isn&#39;t bad, the food is mediocre, and the cheesecake... Well that&#39;s obviously the best part. The only bad part is, the selection is overwhelming. If you can even consider that a bad thing? <br><br>When I go, I usually stick to a pasta dish or their meatloaf. Which is my favorite thing there. For their appetizers, I recommend the lettuce wraps. <br><br>Expect to wait if you don&#39;t make a reservation, but if you get there early enough, or at an &#34;off&#34; hour, you won&#39;t be waiting long. (Their outdoor seating is nice).

I went here for my birthday last month and we went on a Tuesday night. There was 15 minute wait so don&#39;t expect to be seated immediately. The seating is also limited for those waiting. We got seated at a table that wasn&#39;t properly set up with plates and silverware. The lighting in the back is dim which I didn&#39;t enjoy. However, the service was excellent. My server helped me make a great choice for dinner. I got the fried cheese to start and the Alfredo with shrimp for dinner. Both were delicious! We got the Oreo cheesecake and it was so good.

It pains me to write this review, because ordinarily, going to the Cheesecake Factory is such a treat! (We don&#39;t have one in Greensboro, NC). Sure, it&#39;s not &#34;fine dining&#34;, but the food is always good and the portions are so large! With that said, my sister threw me a baby shower at this location on 2/13/16. They don&#39;t take reservations per se, but my sister was assured, 3 weeks ahead of time, that they would hold the back room open for our party of 25. My sister called the morning of the shower to make sure everything was still a go. This was around 10:45 am and she was notified that there was already a line of patrons outside the door. We hurried to the restaurant and arrived around 11:30 am and were told that the room and tables we were promised had already been taken!!<br><br>We decided to stay and wait, as invitations had been mailed out, and it was too late to change locations. Suffice it to say, we did not get seated until after 1 pm. This was difficult for me because I am 9 months pregnant and hadn&#39;t eaten because I never anticipated the wait. <br><br>I ordered my favorite, Chicken Madeira, which was good as always, but the occasion was really ruined by the long wait.

Let me tell you about our amazing experience at the Cheesecake Factory! I&#39;ve been meaning to write this review for awhile. My boyfriend and I just came for cheesecake, which was amazing per usual. We also asked for our leftover bread to go, but Jonathan L came in clutch and gave us AN entire loaf. We will definitely come back to this location. His service was also on point!!

I have been wanting to go here forever. It was well worth the wait and everything I hoped it would be. Awesome waiter, the food was incredible, and not overly pricy for all you get. To end the meal we got a red velvet cheesecake. We told the waiter when we first for there that we were celebrating our anniversary.  When he brought the cheesecake it had happy anniversary written in chocolate sauce on the plate. Totally awesome!

Amazing.  When we arrived they explained the hour wait and said to come back in about 50 minutes because the pagers only work in the restaurant.  We walked around the mall and then came back in time to get to our reserved time.  Everyone loved their food, the service is impeccable and the cheesecake (or other dessert) is divine.  The menu is a touch overwhelming, but there are options for everyone.

Told it would be a 45 minute wait.  Waited almost 2 hours instead.  When we noticed people that came in after us getting seated thought we should see why.  The girl seated someone else in our place.  Something about the pager went off to someone else&#39;s.  No apologies.  Was very disappointed that they could really care less about the mistake they had made. The girl who sat us at this incredibly tiny table was not at all friendly. At least the waiter and food were good.

The wait was terrible...waiting to sign in to wait is asinine. The waitress was like a roller coaster....one second she was a good peak and then she was a bad valley. Like always it was a $100+ meal that should have been $25 due to the failure to fill drinks, bring hot food and the length of time that it obviously took to make the cheesecake. Thank heavens that I don&#39;t live in Charlotte.

Three of us sat at a high top table and received terrible service. The waiter had four tables and neglected ours the entire time while catering to a table of young women next to ours. We waited a total of over an hour and a half from start to finish. All of this honestly wasn&#39;t that bad because the food was good so I didn&#39;t really care BUT I ordered cheesecake to go and he gave me the wrong kind. Really upsetting and traumatizing. Overall terrible experience.

Surprisingly bad. Waited over an hour to then find out they gave out our table by mistake. Kids food took longer then ours. 3 completely undercooked pasta dishes. Missing fries on a kids meal. Really bad!

Last time we came was 3.5 hour wait but this time was 45 minutes! Loved everything, food was great, the nachos were AMAZING! We got the lemon raspberry and the salted caramel cheesecake. But, our waiter barely came to our table to check up on us and was not organized. I think that is due to the fact that they were understaffed. I still love the Cheesecake Factory!

I came for some birthday cheesecake here after having a horrible experience at another restaurant. <br><br>Our server was VERY nice!  We had a great time.  The cheesecake is delicious and the atmosphere is awesome.

Not at all what it use to be! My husband and I stopped in for appetizers and dessert no drinks and spent nearly $50.The food was mediocre and the service was poor!My husband and I decided to enjoy the cheesecake at home.Our server was unattentive until near the end of our meal. Deffinetley not a value.

I have to update and downgrade my review to 4 stars for this Cheesecake Factory. Although the food is always good here, they haven&#39;t been quite as consistent at delivering top notch dishes like my first 2-3 visits. My girlfriend and I have noticed that the quality can vary even when ordering the same dish. Neither the food nor service has ever been bad, however, and the desserts are always exceptional!
The service was good as usual. Ordered the steak, it was cooked to perfection. The waitresses also also really nice. I would recommend this place if you come to Charlotte.

Poor service. One waiter for a group of 15!!! Ordered dinner 45 prior to getting everyone else order and I still didn&#39;t get my food. The server also got the checks mixed up. Charges that were not mine were on my check. He shouldn&#39;t have waited on our table without help. Food got cold before I got my ketchup for my fries, so I ended eating them before they got cold. Reservation was at 6, we didn&#39;t get our food until 8. We didn&#39;t get out of the restaurant until 1030. What a mess of a biethday celebration it was. We made reservations and the service was still poor. Done!

OK, I went in with really high expectations from everything I&#39;ve heard about this place. We went on a Friday night around 8 and only had about a 15-20 minute wait. We were seated and our waiter seemed very nice at first and told us to take our time and soak in everything. I was amazed at the menu, it had anything and everything you could possibly want and then some.  The fried Mac &amp; Cheese balls were AMAZBALLS and our food was delicious. <br>I was very disappointed with our service though, he started off great, and I don&#39;t know what happened, but it seemed like we were bothering him by sitting in his section. He treated the other two tables he was waiting on very different and was super friendly but any time he came to the table we had to request refills on drinks and he just never checked in at all. This was a huge disappointment because like I said I had super high expectations coming in.   <br><br>Bad Service aside, the Cheesecake is to DIE for!!!!! Oh My Goodness, My husband tried the original cheesecake, but I had to go all in. I got the Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake and let me tell you it did not disappoint.  It was a layer of brownie, topped with a coconut chocolate chip cheese cake, topped with chocolate cake, and if that wasn&#39;t fat enough it also had a coconut pecan frosting on it.  Yes it was a completely fat *ss item, but it was so worth it. I would stay on the elliptical all day to have that once a week. <br><br>Overall it was an ok experience.  The food was AMAZING, but the service was very disappointing. :( I will definitely  give it another try and for sure at least get some cheesecake to go.

Love love love this place!! They do not take reservations, or call ahead, so don&#39;t get mad! Just be prepared and arrive at an earlier time if you don&#39;t want to wait long. You can call in, and ask what the current wait time is before you decide to come in. We came last night and it has been awhile. We only had to wait for 40 minutes. I was soooo surprised and so happy lol! The ambience is sooo relaxing! They serve you bread and butter when they bring your drinks. You will easily spend $100 + , so just be prepared, but know that it is TOTALLY worth it! Okay so what do you order? First let&#39;s start with drinks. You can&#39;t go wrong with the Georgia Peach. It&#39;s a frozen alcoholic beverage and will make you think you are on a cruise ship in the middle of the Caribbean! If you don&#39;t like to taste your alcohol, this is the drink for you! Another good drink is the J.W&#39;s Pink Lemonade! This funky drink will get you ready for your delicious dinner! Okay now on to appetizers. The Tex Mex Eggrolls are the best!! Spicy chicken, corn, black beans, peppers, onions and cheese! Don&#39;t forget the Avocado Cream on the side. (I need this recipe!!!) lol. They are so good and you should try them! As far as entrees go, I always get the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta! It&#39;s spicy! It has shrimp and chicken, with onions and peppers and you are going to need plenty of water or several Georgia Peach drinks to calm your mouth lol!! Buttt it is soooo worth getting it! If you like spicy, this is the dish for you! Now on to the desserts! Ummm cheesecake hello?!?! Adams peanut butter cup fudge ripple is really good &amp; I love the Reese&#39;s as well. If you aren&#39;t a cheesecake fan, get Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake. You won&#39;t regret it. This place is worth the 5 million calories you will intake. Sometimes the service is a bit hectic, but it&#39;s only because the servers have so many tables &amp; they are busy. Just be patient, sip on your alcoholic beverages and relax! I promise it&#39;s worth it!

You can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory! I love this location because every time I am here I have GREAT service. I had the crab wontons as an appetizer (my favorite) which are always amazing, and the falafel salad. Anyone who knows me knows that I love me some falafel! The falafel was good but there was something about the dressing that I can&#39;t put my finger on that I didn&#39;t like, but the veggies tasted fresh and was good otherwise! Of course I couldn&#39;t leave there without getting myself cheesecake, and tried the pumpkin pie one which was absolutely delectable! Only other critique I have is that the tables are a little too close for comfort, while the others surrounding us were very friendly my friend and I couldn&#39;t have a conversation without one of our neighbors chiming in. But overall good experience!

So this review was just because of national cheesecake day.  So every year they do half off cheesecakes,  we&#39;ll you would think they would be prepared for this day way in advance and make sure they have enough staff to get this process efficiently.  We got there and people had no idea where the kine was or where people were waiting or where to go to get in the restaurant.  Then it took about 20 mins to order.  So we were excited that it wasn&#39;t too bad because of all the confusion.  But then we waited and waited and waited...  It took 50 more minutes before we even got our cheesecake.  People who ordered after us were getting there cheesecakes before us and there was no organization to the process at all.  You would think they could have just kept pieces of cheesecake already in the boxes so they could give it to people immediately.  <br><br>Sorry this review doesn&#39;t completely reflect the whole restaraunt because we didn&#39;t even eat there so I can not talk about their service at all.  So I don&#39;t want this to reflect them Completely...  But I just wanted to let people know not to go on busy days like that!!

This is our second visit because while the food was mediocre the first time,  the service was wonderful. <br>This time it was my daughter&#39;s 18th birthday.  We were seated in the back corner looking at nothing,  but okay,  the hostess did not know, but there were plenty of tables in the  restaurant.  Then we had a waitress that majored in condescension.  The food was,  once again,  mediocre and the server was rude.   The two stars are for the Cheesecake which did not disappoint.
This time everything was super.  I tried the almond salmon salad. It was amazing.  Maybe the Mojito needed more tequila. Steak Diane was very delicious.

I have never liked the food at CC Factory but mostly the consistent bad service. Today just solidified it for me. We call ahead day before a large group, no reservations.  We show up and a two hour wait and we can&#39;t even sit together.  Forget that. We left for Cantina 1511 and they hooked us up!!
An eternal wait even if you come at off times. Been waiting like an hour for food after waiting 40 mins to get seated. Also bf&#39;s credit card info got stolen here last visit

We waited over an hour to sit but Cheesecake Factory is always amazing. So many choices and the dessert is wonderful. My complaint is that the service can be slow because of the high volume of people coming in!

My one student wrote her review for YELP! Club about Cheesecake Factory, so this is actually Fiorella&#39;s review (6th grade student):<br><br>My experience at Cheesecake Factory was very delightful. The service was excellent because our server Angelo was kind and patient when we were ordering. The cleanliness was very good considering the amount of time the servers have to clean the table, since there are so many customers. The time we had to wait to be seated was understandable because Cheesecake Factory is always crowded. Overall my experience was very good. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends.

Suggestions:<br><br>Be ready with your cheese cake order when your waitress takes your drink order as an appetizer.  Food takes a little while so don&#39;t skimp on appetizer s.<br><br>Tex Mex egg-rolls are a great appetizer<br><br>They have lots of other entries but I really like their hamburgers.  After the cheese cake and appetizer you don&#39;t want to be carrying your food to go.

Amazing Service &amp; Food was incredible! I asked for a recommendation from Roland the bartender and he said &#34;Herbed salmon, mashed potatoes &amp; asparagus!&#34; He was not wrong... The food was perfect! Fresh salmon with sauce that was excellent! Potatoes and asparagus were delicious as well as the bread and sweet tea! The property is beautiful and everything was outstanding!!! An all-around wonderful experience!!!
The food was good. We ate chicken Little&#39;s and the skinilicious turkey burger. Our waitress Melissa W. was great.

I went for the First time Saturday with my boyfriend, the wait was reasonable for two people but do plan on leaving early if you want a table.. we ordered the filet mignon which is pretty pricey, and it&#39;s not at all what I expect it. As one of the more expensive steaks to get it still fat on it. I was disappointed with it. And needless to say I probably won&#39;t be going back anytime soon. I did enjoy the cheesecake it would be worth it if that&#39;s all your going for

Im a regular takeout guy, &amp; every time i call its  <br>Long time to pickup the phone, understandable <br>They&#39;re busy but it&#39;s consistent. Then as of a few months ago they removed the only dish i ordered every time I call!

Finally went to this location and didn&#39;t have a wait... Apparently going on a Monday around 2:00 is perfect! The staff was very friendly, the food super, like usual &amp; the cheesecake amazing! My kids ordered cheese pizza &amp; spaghetti with meatballs off of the children&#39;s menu and the spaghetti was outstanding! I almost wished I had order that for myself! Their appetizer salads are humungous and packed with great veggies! The Mac &amp; cheese burger is out of this world too, very creamy &amp; perfect! My daughters birthday was celebrated here and they brought out the cutest little sundae in a small wine glass and sang to her. Will definitely be returning, hopefully soon!

To start off if you want to go for a dinner I recommend making reservations, the walk in wait time is super long, you&#39;d wait about 1 1/2 hr. They&#39;ll give you a device and when it vibrates you are seated, after waiting about an hour and a half they made us wait another good 30 mins. When we finally sat down we waited a little and they asked for our drinks.Waiting for the food also took FOREVER we waited about an hour and ten mins. And this is not a very everyday dinner this place is more on the pricey side, your looking at about 23 dollars per person. Which might not sound like a lot until you see your bill.

The service was absolutely shoddy. You had to wait for you server and ask for everything twice or thrice.  Basic etiquette was not provided by our sever. This is probably the worst Cheesecake Factory experience I have had. <br><br>The rest rooms were also not serviced well. My wife and daughter complained that there was no toilet paper in the stalls and other patrons were doing their best to clean the stalls so that they could go

If you can&#39;t find something you love from Cheesecake&#39;s extensive menu, something is wrong with you. The white sangria was strong, sweet and delicious. <br><br>Avocado egg rolls are perfect. Crispy exterior and soft flavorful interior. I like it dipped in their homemade ranch better than the sweet dipping sauce the egg rolls come with. <br><br>Chili Rellenos were somewhat disappointing. The hot, melty pepper jack cheese inside is awesome, but the pepper has a very green pepper flavor rather than any spiciness. The crunchy fried outside is good but overall this was a miss for me. Not really worth the calories. <br><br>The veggie burger was made with beets (along with brown rice, farro and black bean) and was not good at all. It was cold and sweet and bland. <br><br>You can&#39;t go wrong with any of the desserts. We had the banana cream cheesecake, which is our standby favorite. And I also tried Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake, made with layers of brownie, coconut cheesecake, chocolate cake, coconut frosting (similar to the topping for German chocolate cake) and whipped cream. It was good, but I&#39;ve had better.

Went back to try Cheesecake Factory again. I must say our visit this time was very good. Our server Alex was excellent and the food was just as good. Even being a busy Saturday our food did not take long at all after placing our order.

I love Cheesecake Factory so don&#39;t get me wrong as this review is totally about this experience. I have been a regular customer to the Cheesecake Factory in Kansas. However this Charlotte one was my first experience.<br><br>I didn&#39;t mind waiting for 1 hr 15 mins and didn&#39;t mind the fading lights. Lights were very dim to read the menu comfortably but I didn&#39;t mind as I knew what I wanted to order. I always start with Avocado egg rolls as they are my favorite. However they weren&#39;t as crispy as I have had them earlier, it seemed they were sitting on the kitchen counter for around 10 mins after being fried. Which resulted in the lack of crispness. <br><br>For the entree I wished to try a new item, the ratatouille toast. The presentation was beautiful and appetizing. The ratatouille was delightful however the toast was burnt and very dry. It was hard to eat but thinking about my prior experience with Cheesecake Factory I gave it a go hoping that the next piece would be better. But I realized it was hopeless cause. This was reported to the manager and he offered to replace it but by then I just lost my appetite. He took it off the bill which was a kind gesture. I wouldn&#39;t have mind paying for it as its all about the having a good experience.<br><br>For desserts it was lemoncello cream torte, which is a masterpiece. Refreshing lemon mascarpone cheese sandwiched between moist vanilla cake topped with streusel.

This is just an OK place.  Every time I try something new, its just OK.  I would rather they have a smaller menu and are able to focus on the taste of their food.  Cheese cake factory is always packed.  I understand if you want to come and have dessert.... But dinner?  Not good, not mind blowing.... Just some mediocre food.  <br><br>The only dish that I actually really like is the fried Mac and cheese appetizer.  <br>And their desserts are good.  <br><br>But the food is never worth the wait to get a table.

I have been a Cheesecake Factory customer for many years and this was my first visit to the Charlotte location.  I saw the reviews on Yelp but decided to give them a try.  I agree the food was great. I had my favorite Bang Bang Chicken and shrimp and my husband had Cajun Jambalaya pasta. The service was not great - we had to ask for bread and silverware.  It also took an hour just to get our food - which is crazy.  The server said &#34;there is a problem in the kitchen&#34; which was not helpful or reassuring.  Didn&#39;t get cheesecake because we were afraid it would take another hour.  Not sure we will be back.

Great service, delicious food! You gotta try the stuffed mushrooms. My husband and I have gone here for our last two Anniversary &#34;early dinners&#34; that have landed during the week which is great! Still a lot of people but the place is so large you can find a corner that is cozy enough to enjoy your meal and company.

Every so often we get the impulse to go to CCF for dinner because of the variety of menu items that will please all the members of our party. But, after we&#39;ve waited two hours for a table, wait for bread to come to the table, wait for our entrees, wait for a server to make sure we are &#34;ok&#34; with our meals, wait for tea refills, wait for our check to be closed out. One conclusion can be drawn: his place is over rated. Way over rated. The

I&#39;ll make this short and simple. The wait time was not very bad for a pre-4th of July dinner eating. Only had to wait 45 minutes or so. The food is good, just like and Cheesecake Factory that I have been to...Wait, it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, the food is AWESOME! The only reason that I am giving this 4 stars and not five is that we had an annoying waiter and waitress issue at the beginning of our service. There were 4 people that saw us in the first 10 minutes of being there. We ordered drinks with 3 different people and then almost ordered dinner with two people. Finally when we got our waitress she was awesome!<br><br>I got the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, awesome as usual! P.S. I need to try something new next time. I got the chocolate cake, 5 stars for that! It even tasted better the next day!

I&#39;d first like to preface my review by saying that I prefer to eat at non-chain restaurants too. <br><br>But of the chains, I have a special fondness for the Cheesecake Factory. Back at my old job in Virginia I would take clients out to lunch quite often, and where did they always want to go? The Cheesecake Factory. Have gone there so much, I really got to try a variety of different dishes, from the salads, to the pastas, to the steaks, salmon, burgers, sandwiches, etc. I tend to order the louisiana chicken pasta or a steak. Or one of their great salads if it&#39;s lunch time. <br><br>I was never a fan of restaurants with such an extensive menu, but Cheesecake does a good job. I cannot recall ordering anything that I didn&#39;t like. Don&#39;t get me wrong, I can&#39;t recall ordering a dish and thinking that it was my favorite ever, but Cheesecake is pretty consistent. And their portions are large so you feel like you&#39;re getting your money&#39;s worth. That&#39;s why I think it&#39;s always busy on Weekends for lunch and dinner. There really is a lot to choose from, which is good when you have a group of people that can&#39;t decide on cuisine that night. <br><br>The service isn&#39;t bad. I think that people in general need to understand that when a restaurant is super busy sometimes the level of service dips a little bit. And not all server is created equal. In every restaurant there are servers who move more efficiently, make few mistakes, and...well...for a lack of a more eloquent way to put it...are just better than others. And unless you&#39;re a regular you probably won&#39;t know who&#39;s who. Having waited tables in the past I probably tend to have more patience with service. That being said I&#39;ve had great service on weekends and off-peak hours here than I did on the weekend dinners that were had here. coincidence? I doubt it. <br><br>Not much needs to be said about the cheesecake. It&#39;s always terrific. <br><br>You know what to expect with the cheesecake factory... huge menu, diverse selection, decent service, great cheesecake.

This review is about their take out delivery service.  <br><br>We have ordered take out from this location for years and it has always been a very simple and fast process.  We usually order takeout because frankly eating at The Cheesecake Factory should not be an all night experience.  You call them up on the drive over and by the time you are there you walk in pay for your food and leave. It&#39;s really genius.  Apparently in the last couple weeks The Cheesecake Factory has decided to expand the &#34;wait experience&#34; of their dine-in guests to their take out guests as well.  The issue that i&#39;m describing has never occurred in the 10+ years we&#39;ve visited this establishment, but it happened the last two times we&#39;ve been there which is what is prompting this review.    Last night it took 21 minutes on hold before i could place my order.  You may say that they are busy.  OK, i get that.  Yes they are busy, they are almost always busy in the evenings.  This hasn&#39;t changed in the last 10 years.  It is also compounded by the fact there is someone there who answers the phone immediately.  it&#39;s not until you say that you want to place a pickup order that you get the hold experience from hell.  I&#39;m not really sure what other types of calls they receive that aren&#39;t pickup orders, but you would think that these types of calls would be handled in an expedited manner. I mean i&#39;m trying to give them money. I mean the primary income for this restaurant comes from selling food right? Who of you would put someone on hold for 20 minutes when they are trying to give you money?  it&#39;s absolutely absurd. Maybe it takes an extra 20 minutes for the order to be prepared because of their &#34;busyness&#34;,  but there is no excuse for someone to wait on hold this long to place an order.  Can the primary receptionist not be trained to take orders? I&#39;ve seen their computers, they aren&#39;t that much different from the terminals at Mc Donalds. Are there more important things that they are responsible for that are making the company more money than they would by selling food?  Lest you think I&#39;m the only one of this opinion.  When we were in line to pay for the order after 20+ minutes on the phone the person ahead of us had the same complaint.  They were so tired of waiting that they just wanted to cancel their order and leave.  Believe me, i felt the same way.  There are too many other good choices of restaurants in the South Park area to waste your time here.  I&#39;m sorry Cheesecake Factory, your food is good, but i&#39;m going to have to take my business elsewhere.
Filled out online form as advised &amp; still no contact .  This is a follow up from our visit on 12/22 where my daughter &amp; I got sick.

My daughter has had a terrible experience the last two times she&#39;s been to the South Park Cheesecake Factory.  The first time the waiter spilled her fried zucchini and argued about getting more.  The second time she was overcharged for her meal.  We usually go several times a month, but with this horrible service we&#39;ll find another restaurant.  There are plenty to choose from in the area.

I can&#39;t belive this place stopped making their eggplant parm. Embarrassingly, I used to go once every week or so but I haven&#39;t been back since they stopped making it. The only really issue is have with this place is their system for purchasing cheesecake. The line is always massive and it takes forever to get your order. Sometimes it takes a while to get your food too but they&#39;re always super nice about it.

I will NEVER go back to this place as long as one of their servers still works there...... So rude and disrespectful! I contacted the corporate office to file a complaint. Absolutely NO ONE deserves to be treated the way I did on today.

The service was excellent. Our waitress Jennifer was very helpful, patient, and knowledgeable. The atmosphere is great. The food... Phenomenal. Me and my friend could not finish it all. They need recliners in this place for situations like this! The meatloaf was wonderful. It came with brown gravy which I normally don&#39;t like on my meatloaf but this brown gravy wasn&#39;t your normal everyday gravy. It was in a class by itself. My friend&#39;s food tasted great as well. Yeah I ate some of her food. Don&#39;t judge me. Lol. The flavor her dish had was spectacular! I will order that the next time. Now we&#39;re full and need to walk it off. Heading into the mall for a little shopping. Until next time my fellow Yelpers... Peace and chicken grease...

The ambiance is the best I have ever seen at a restaurant. The burgers are really good. I get them every time. Also, I am diabetic. They make a low-carb cheese cake made with splenda. I can have cheesecake here! That gets it a 5 by itself. <br><br>One of our visit we got a really horrible server. We sent an appetizer back because we misunderstood what it was. After that she transferred us to another waitress. By that time we had already been waiting for our food for 45 minutes and by the time we got it, it was all wrong.  So why the positive review? This was an isolated incident. AND the manager comped the entire meal and gave us free deserts. So yeah, they still rock.

The wait was long on Wednesday night, we were sitting down looking at empty tables for 10 minutes before we were seated. Total wait time was 20 minutes though.<br><br>The bread they brought to the table was cold and hard and the butter was in individual packages equally cold. The food was good when we got it. I loved the LUAU SALAD. It was so delicious and plentiful. 14.95 is kinda high for a salad but it was worth it.

The food and cheesecake are always great here, but the wait for everything is very long. Took over 45 minutes for our food to arrive. And 15 minutes for our waiter to bring the check to us. I also found something in my drink and had to get a new one.

Nothing says mismanaged like having  over 20 people waiting in line for the bakery and to pick up to go orders and only have one person working the register and taking orders. 15 minutes for the pick up order according to the person on the phone and 30 mins and still not to the register. Unbelievable

Great food.. Slow service, I mean really slow bordering on bad service. We went at lunch when the restaurant was not crowded .. I had the lunch Asian chicken lettuce tacos. They were fantastic. The twins ordered kid meals. The first was the chicken tender kids meal. One of the best kids meals I have seen. Highly recommended for kids. The second  kids meal was the burger sliders they were just ok. The kids fries are served in a silver bucket which the kids love. We had for dessert the Oreo cheesecake.. Safe choice for anyone. It was more than enough for one adult and 2 school aged kids.

I pity the fool that comes to this poorly lit, highly expensive restaurant and orders the Lasagna Verde. The horrid, thick spinach paste of a pasta is atrocious! Tastes like something straight out of an &#34;easy-bake&#34; oven. With the plastic like cheese, it tastes like a frozen food, from a microwave. Only its $14! Oh, and their cheesecake is good and their manager was nice. 2/5 stars. Wouldn&#39;t recommend.
Good cheesecakes, everything else sucks. Went there for birthday, waited for 45-50 mins another hour for food. When food came got burger with buns hard as rock. Never going to this place again.

Stopped in for some cheesecake to go and found the service I received to be very slow and unorganized.  Especially considering there was no line in front of me when I arrived yet I still had to wait 7 minutes just to place my order.

I think the Cheesecake Factory is ok.  Nothing magical, but nothing terrible you know?  I went in on Labor Day at 2:00 thinking the crowd would have died down....but guess again it was freakin packed!!!<br><br>30 minute wait, which I guess in the grand scheme of Cheesecake Factory wait times wasn&#39;t too bad.  The people watching during the wait is always interesting and the massive amounts of food and cheesecake that pass me always make me wonder what kind of money this place makes.<br><br>The service was great, very attentive and friendly.  One thing I do like is the variety of food offered which is both good and bad, I guess.  We had the avocado eggrolls which are pretty tasty, I don&#39;t want to know how many calories were in them but nice chunks of avocado fried in an egg roll wrapper were complimented by a sweet and spicy dipping sauce.<br><br>I had the mushroom burger which frankly was very good.  It was well put together with very flavorful mushrooms and swiss cheese.  The cover the burger in some kind of wine sauce which was welcomed.  Fries....nasty.  Too much salt ruined them.<br><br>We skipped on the cheesecake (I know, blasphemy) but I figured I gorged on too many calories as it was and wanted to be able to look myself in the mirror afterwards.

Battled that traffic and parking to buy a whole plain cheesecake only to be told they are out of plain cheesecake. The CCF out of plain cheesecake?? I tried to order in advance by phone (twice) but the bakery won&#39;t pick up their phone.

Stop in here for dessert after having a good meal elsewhere. Don&#39;t waste your time or money on subpar food. Service was good but food was terrible.  Menu resembled a phone book.  Options are endless.   Our party of four adults and one toddler ordered a variety of food none of which was to our liking as was evident by our leftovers none of which we cared to take with us.  We arrived very hungry and with not terribly high expectations but were still disappointed. Not a big deal. It&#39;s only one meal but in the future will get desserts here and meal elsewhere.  Had joked earlier that we would just get something at mall food court. In hindsight that would have been a wise decision.

Came here on Valentine&#39;s Day, driving 2 1/2 hours from home and arrived @ 1:30 pm and had to wait in a line out the door just to get my name on the list. They said come back in an hour to get a pager. Came back after shopping in the attached mall and waited in the line out the door again to get my pager, and waited about an hour more before finally getting a table for 2. I don&#39;t think I have ever seen a restaurant so busy but they handled it well. Food and service were good. The cheesecake was really good.Ordered some to take home also.

Worst service ever! We were there for 4 hours..food took forever then came out cold. We had to ask 2 different servers to check on our food. The first waiter/server we had was very rude..they must have switched shifts while we were there as suddenly we had a different server. Then a third when it was all said and done. Very disappointed!

Ordered bistro shrimp for lunch.  <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2FHorrible.com&amp;s=23f9c6f25db071175eb6ea81bb7d4276c54683adb46b75cb51de34c1e7213c32" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Horrible.com</a>.  Here for team meeting and 4 of us ordered it.  Apparently the chef dropped the noodles in the boiling water and took it right out .  Pasta was very undercooked.  Waiters response was &#34;well pasta is not supposed to be mushy&#34;.  Smh sir.... pasta is not supposed to be hard either.  Requested to speak with manager.  Manager was friendly but only offered  to have the food remade.  Were on a lunch break.  Limited time. For this price, very disappointing to receive inedible food.

I&#39;m not the biggest fan of chain restaurants, but Cheesecake Factory is definitely way above par for your normal chain.<br><br>The menu is a little pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for. <br><br>The menu is also HUGE. Part of that monstrosity is advertisements (annoying!) but there really is a ton to choose from.<br><br>I have weekly (if not daily) day dreams about the Avocado Egg Rolls. Holy moly this appetizer rocks my world! Yes, it&#39;s an appetizer, but I actually order it as my entree, whoops. These rolls are chocked full of crazy amounts of flavor and texture. The middle is gooey and savory and the outside is crispy and delicious. And the dipping sauce, some sort of cilantro chutney... SHUT UP! It&#39;s amazing.<br><br>I also really enjoy the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes appetizer. These little babies are sweet and salty at the same time. Very filling. Nice presentation.<br><br>My favorite appetizer salad is the French Country Salad. Veggie friendly and delish.<br><br>The only thing I&#39;ve had here I have NOT enjoyed was Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta. It&#39;s pretty boring and lackluster, I do not recommend.<br><br>And last but definitely not least, their namesake... the CHEESECAKES. Oh lord. Yes, It&#39;s okay to come here just for cheesecake. No one will judge you.<br><br>I would like to say I&#39;ve tried them all. Unfortunately I&#39;m in love with the Tiramisu and order it EVERY time. Except for in the fall and winter when The Pumpkin Pecan Cheesecake is in season.

I am sure that this is a pretty standard Cheesecake Factory as far as things go.  Maybe I&#39;m not a fan of this location or maybe I&#39;m not a fan of this chain period, but my last few experiences here have left me disappointed.<br><br>One positive thing I can say is that they have an extensive menu.  In general, you would be hard-pressed not to find something you are in the mood to eat.  <br><br>However, I&#39;ve gone in there before and nothing has sounded appetizing - maybe it&#39;s just too many selections.  I can say that they have decent (but pricey) salads and I had good fish and chips from there.  I went there with a party and my boss ordered the barbecue salmon, which was WAY too salty for her. This was a day we were out to celebrate a co-worker leaving and had a party of four.  We waited almost 20 minutes to get seated, and then another 20 minutes almost before we could order.  By the time our food had arrived, we had been there over an hour.  This was lunch time, which was frustrating.  Our lunch there lasted over an hour and a half by the time we got dessert.<br><br>As far as their cheesecake goes, this has been the biggest disappointment.  It used to be you paid $8 and got huge pieces which were big enough for two to share.  However, my piece last time was about half the size it had been before.  It looks like they are trying to scale back on the sizes.  And when I thought about it, I got one of the specialty cheesecakes and so only about a third of it was actual cheesecake, and the rest of it had toppings woven in.  Not on TOP, as you would expect, but cutting into the piece of cheesecake itself.  The cheesecake part was not as good as it should have been for the price.<br><br>This location is swanky and nice, but every time I&#39;ve been the service was very slow.  And since getting dessert and a lunch special was over $20 at lunch time, it seems a little too pricey for the quality of food and service you get there.  For me, &#34;meh&#34; just kind of describes how I feel about this Cheesecake Factory location.

I love this place everything on the menu is good I&#39;ve never had a bad experience I go here often however if you have never been look the menu up online first it can be very overwhelming because it is vast also this place gets crazy busy so try to go during the week or when your not as hungry because even with reservations the wait can be long during busy times I just wish there were more locations here in Charlotte
Nice and friendly Bartender.  Jeremy was Awesome and he was a cutie-patootie! Was patient for our order... And quick to check and make sure we were doing good and enjoying our experience.

This was our first experience at Cheesecake Factory. Our server Daryn was amazing and with her recommendation we ordered the 4 cheese pasta with friend chicken. Everything was fresh and very flavorful. We definitely left happy and full. Excellent restaurant with superior service and friendly servers, will definitely be returning.

Let me start by saying I work in this mall and have taken my lunch break numerous times here and never had a problem. But today, we took our hour lunch break here during a very slow time of the day and sat in Larry&#39;s section. Not only was the server rude and couldn&#39;t muster a smile the entire time, but our food took an hour to come out. We tried explaining we were on break and only had an hour, only to get eye rolls in response. The end result was all of our food having to be boxed and taken home to eat after work and we ate bread for lunch. Not a pleasant experience, literally all our server had to do was apologize for the food taking longer and smile. Instead we left with empty stomachs and a bad mood.

There was no wait which was surprising. We were greeted upon entrance and the hostess was nice. The waiter came to our table pretty quickly &amp; with waters. While ordering he informed us that he doesn&#39;t typically work brunch shifts so HE will be back to ask US questions. Which was kind of odd. I ordered the French toast (amazing!) my boyfriend ordered the breakfast sampler. His pancakes were not cooked all the way. He didn&#39;t check on us at all before the food came or after &amp; we had to flag him down about the pancakes. He never apologized about the pancakes but just immediately said he would get his manager, the manager that we didn&#39;t ask for. He could&#39;ve easily just offered more pancakes but he didn&#39;t. The manager was nice about it but did not listen when my boyfriend said twice that he wanted them to go. When the waiter came back he pushed my cup towards me, the empty cup that did not get a refill and ASKED ME &#34;get that plate for me&#34;. Bryan B horrible service. Never checked on us. Horrible experience. Another customer had to flag him down for bread.

Located in the South Park mall this is a busy area.  ONE MAJOR NOTE if you go on a weekend be prepared to wait they estimated 3 to 2 1/2 hours on Saturday night!<br><br>The inside of this place is huge one of the biggest CKF I have ever been in. They are one of the better chain restaurants with one of the biggest menu&#39;s I ever seen.  It is pages upon pages of options.  <br><br>The food<br>They always start you off with some bread which is decent nothing specially but always fresh and warm which is key.  I ordered Shepards Pie yes you heard me right at CKF.  It is one of the best I have ever had.  It is my favorite comfort food and it is hard to find at most places.  It had great flavor and the portion was generous. <br><br>Staff<br>Everyone was very friendly I have never had a bad experience at this place.  My waitress was helpful and attentive.  <br><br>Verdict<br>I am not a huge &#34;chain&#34;  guy but CKF is one of the few I would go to if I am in the area.  The food is really good and the selection is second to none.

My family and I came to this location to celebrate my birthday. I thought it would be a fun celebration with good food but the service was absolutely horrendous. Not only did our server disappear, we had to wait for a whole hour before our food was served. For that whole hour we were also ignored and asked for a bucket of ice for our bottle of wine, which came. We then tried to wait to see if she had said anything to the manger but we realized that she hadn&#39;t. So we reached out to the manager about everyone around us were served and leaving before we got served. But the manage handed our check off to another server who never brought it back to the table. Finally we decided to head to the hostess stand to find where our check went. So bottom line, it was horrible service and the management/servers/kitchen was extremely unprofessional and we will not be going there ever again.

Although I love indulging in their desserts, the carrot cake blended with cheesecake is my favorite, the recent inspection earned them a health score of only 83!  Unacceptable for this well known chain!  I might return when it improves.

My family use to love to go Cheesecake Factory for of course the cheesecake.  The food was okay, nothing to brag about.  The cheesecake has gone down hill.  I get better cheesecake from the local grocery store.  What happened?

Went to The Cheesecake Factory for half price slices of cheesecake.  Jamond was my server. He was very friendly and knowledgeable. He was clearly busy but did not miss a step in service. He is to commended for his efforts.  Actually all of the staff were friendly. Karmyne, Lauren and Alona were great their smiles and hospitality lit up the place.  They helped us pick the perfect cheesecakes for today&#39;s festivities.   We tried the new cinnabon cheesecake.  Simply amazing best dessert you have come up with in years.  Servers were awesome as a team as well. Tiffany, Maria, Adriana and Brett were very helpful as well.  Even Sherard was helping and working.  My table was kept up by the 3 busssers.  Christian, Douglas and his smile that just makes you want to smile and Randy Watson aka Vaughn all helped keep my drink full and table clean.  Mike visited my table and oozes hospitality out of his super sweet mustache.  Sadly this is the experience goes bad. <br><br>We had the tomato flat bread.  The basil had black spots on it,  the tomatoes were in consistent in cut size so some were not cooked all the way and were raw in the center.  The flat bread was under done it was mushy and needed to be cut with a knife instead of pulled apart in slices.  The cheeseburger rolls the filling was overcooked and resembled high school sloppy Joe&#39;s then a cheeseburger roll. Most people could of made a better filling with hamburger helper. The kids grilled cheese was cooked perfectly.  I think the food could of been better if the kitchen manager actually managed it.  Instead he spent most his time at the front desk.  Also explains the 84 on the health inspection not long ago. I would have complained but the kitchen manager would just have blamed Jamond because he never does anything wrong his kitchen makes everything perfectly.  I tried to speak with a manager but after the initial visit Mike was told to go back to the kitchen.  The other manager just kept walking by looking at our table but never said a word.  At first I thought he wanted to fight me,  then I thought he was looking at me and undressing me with his eyes.  But I realized that he is envious of you know my manhood and his lack there of.

Why does the cheesecake factory only have 3stars ? The appetizers alone are always banging and who doesn&#39;t like free bread ??? Let&#39;s take a moment and notice the menu options are vast , the prices as well but come on there&#39;s more than enough food given to keep you satisfied and not too hurt on the $$. If you are a cheese cake fan they have one for every person . I simply can&#39;t get enough of the potstickers , the sauce is heavenly . Minus the long waits , it&#39;s not a horrible restaurant ... Try the Jamaican black pepper shrimp , or the Kobe burger , maybe in the mood for egg rolls , both the Tex mex and avocado are delicious .

I went to Cheesecake Factory for my one year anniversary. I ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp thinking that it would be Spicy but it was sweet. Too sweet! I took two bites and are half of my wife&#39;s meal. The server was rude from the get go, giving us a dirty look because we didn&#39;t want an appetizer. After an hour of us sitting there she came by and saw that I didn&#39;t eat my food. She asked why I didn&#39;t eat and I said it was too sweet. She asked if I wanted something else and I said no. It had already been an hour and I had eaten half of my wife&#39;s food. When I got the bill I realized she left my dish on there. I was already mad so I paid it and vowed never to go back. I left an email of my experience at the corporate website and still haven&#39;t gotten a reply. If that&#39;s how they do business, screw them.
Really slow and unprofessional service can be overshadowed by exceptional food, but this place has bad food too.
very slow service . loud kitchen . ran out of dishes . server was not attentive as we would have liked .

If you are a captive of shopping all day at South Park mall it is certainly better than the food court and there are lots of options. However, nothing tastes as good as it sounds and the quality of food is college dorm level at premium prices. It is also incredibly slow. I wont be back and will  plan better in the future if I come to the mall with my kids.

What a disappointment!!!  Traveled nearly 2 hours to celebrate my nieces sweet 16 bday at Cheesecake Factory and it was awful! Waitress was extremely rude and had absolutely no personality.  We explained we were from out of town and were there to celebrate the birthday girl and she said &#34;oh&#34;.  Had to request bread to which we got no response but she brought it.  She was very rude when I asked a question about a dish for my son and it worsened when we asked about my nieces nut allergy.  Food finally arrived and it was COLD!!!  Utterly disgusting!!!

My friend and I drove an hour to eat here for dinner. We received our appetizer and drinks after our food which was very upsetting. The food was great as always but the service definitely needs a little bit of help. I have worked in the restaurant business and usually when an appetizer is brought out after the food it&#39;s completely taken off the bill. Sad to say I don&#39;t know if I&#39;ll be back again

Very extensive menu!!! I had about 5 things I was torn between after reading many reviews but went with what my Dad recommended prior to my first visit...MEATLOAF!!<br><br>Meatloaf was the <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbomb.com&amp;s=bb4f996415a9c2f21137e27cfb68f439a48cec2652b53e9b50dd7e766dbe177e" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">bomb.com</a>!!! Best I have had out in years and you get so much of it!! Don&#39;t get enough of the corn that comes with it and is the bomb also.<br><br>Got the best cheesecake ever also...had a weird name like Christopher &#39; s out there cake or something. Was like German chocolate cake but cheesecake....it was so good!! <br><br>Out of all the wonderful tempting choices, the ones I made I was highly satisfied with. Be prepared to spend some money but it is a fancy (and frigid) restaurant.<br><br>Wish they had more locations in NC and more than 1 in the citys  they are in.

Horrible experience waited 70 min for a table then waited an additional 50 min for a child&#39;s spaghetti and meatball dinner and the adult meals sat under a warmer and dried out. Ordered a cheese cake for desert and was told the bakery staff were on a change of shift and waited over 20 minutes for a desert!  I can not recommend this place due to slow poor service.
Food and service has been outstanding tonight! Came here for a family members birthday, and the staff came out and sang. Will definitely come back!

We stopped in here for an early dinner, we got unsweetened tea which was watered down. I got the veggie burger, very bland and it fell apart. And Brett got the BBQ chicken pizza he said that it was good, but a little undercooked. Overall the experience was very mediocre, we skipped the dessert because it looked like it came in frozen. There&#39;s nothing special about this place. We won&#39;t be back. We make better food at home.

Loved loved this place...i went mainly for cheesecake. Had the original strawberry cheescake. loved every bit of it. Located at fancy big mall in charllote. The wait to get seated takes long but u can waste time browsing through the stores at the mall. They do not take reservations during holidays like today 1st Jan 2015 very busy

As many times as I&#39;ve been here, I can&#39;t believe I&#39;ve never written a review. In a creature of habit, always order the Luisiana chicken pasta without the mushrooms. It was yummy tonight, sometimes the noodles are bit more aldente than I prefer, but tonight they were great. The chicken in the dish was lacking, but nonetheless I enjoyed my meal in in it&#39;s entirety. Surprisingly I don&#39;t even eat cheesecake but the do make some pretty decent food. Tonight we were seated immediately, and our food didn&#39;t take too long to come out. our waitress was in training, and she did just fine. Of course they&#39;re conveniently locate @ South Park Mall, entrance right where the valet stand is, check them out if you&#39;re in the area.
I&#39;m always overwhelmed by their amazing menu. Loved my skinny Licious meal. Good balance to their amazing cheesecakes. Always a treat to visit!!!!!  I just wish the took reservations for dinner.

My two star review went to my server and the cheesecake itself. <br>I was starving when I got there and was told the wait was 15 minutes. I figured I&#39;d order a cheesecake to go while I waited so I can eat something. My pager went off so when I turned it in, I told the lady I&#39;m waiting for my order. She took the pager and called the next name so I proceeded back in line. A guy calls my name and I tell him the same story so he said he was getting me seated since he can&#39;t hold tables and would have my order transferred. He said they were busy. Then he asked if I needed a menu and I said no.( I knew what I wanted. Not the friendliest guy.<br><br>So as I get seated, there was a five minute wait for a server to ask me what I had so I have her the receipt and she took my drink order. I was starving at that point and saw how busy it was I knew I didn&#39;t want to eat there. My cheesecake was finally brought to me after my drink and surprisingly I wasn&#39;t asked if I wanted anything. I couldn&#39;t wait to leave.<br><br>I love the Cheesecake Factory but this left a bad taste in my mouth. The server was nice enough to give me a to go cup for my lemonade.

I came here for my birthday lunch, and as I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in for-ever, it was really nice to kick it old school...<br><br>*Pros*<br>-Outdoor seating. Having spent the entire winter, and well into March in a snowy DC mess, it was great to sit on the outdoor patio at 4:00 in the afternoon with a Root Beer and a cool breeze blowing in my face.<br>-Minimal wait. Maybe no one wanted to sit on said patio, but the waiting area was 50 people deep of couples, families, etc and we only had a 10 minute wait for first available. <br>-That wide variety of menu items you know and love from CF, including a nice selection of lunch portions (and lunch prices). <br>-Friendly staff. Something I miss once I moved to the DMV.<br>-Quality ingredients, and tasty food. I ordered the lunch grilled salmon with broccoli and mashed potatoes for $13.95. The salmon was well-seasoned and cooked perfectly. Other dishes ordered at the table included a cheeseburger, cobb salad, and chicken wings. All were devoured. <br>-Food presentation is great. I love the way they serve the dishes to you with thought and care.<br>-Happy Birthday! My cheesecake plate had Happy Birthday written on it, with a pink candle for me to blow out! They also sang Happy Birthday to me. Ahh never gets old even in my late 20&#39;s!<br><br>*Cons*<br>-My broccoli was served cold. I mean ice cold. <br>-The fountain drinks all tasted flat no matter what you ordered.<br>-When my husband ordered after dinner coffee, and she asked if he wanted a refill she did not tell him refills were not free. Normally, they leave the pot, or bring the pot over and fill &#39;er up. Nope, he was charged another $3 bucks for black coffee. Party foul!<br><br>All in all a great birthday lunch with good times and good food.

The past few times I&#39;ve eaten here the food has been amazing! This includes brunch and lunch. I didn&#39;t expect the brunch items to be that great but I was wrong!  A must try is the Baja Chicken Hash or the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!  My new favorite lunch item there is the Miso Salmon!! Can&#39;t wait to go back! Only reason it didn&#39;t get 5 stars is because of how long it takes to get your appetizer/food.
Terrible. Nuff said. Horrible service, horrible food. Shocking because The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite go to spots. Never again in NC! Happy to be back in Phoenix.
If you have had a long day  are tired of inconsistent service and food try ....   Awesome service ALWAYS. .. in the &#34;BAR AREA&#34; from...Clarke, Amie, Jason, Jeremy ! <br>Thanks. ...Yummy

We just had the worst service and the food wasn&#39;t that great either. The waiter had an attitude towards my mother, he came to the table maybe 3 times, we split a meal and it took 45 minutes to get to the table and when we commented he said that&#39;s what you get for ordering medium well. I never knew that 3 medallions could take 45 minutes as I order medium well all the time. The medallions didn&#39;t have much flavor at all. Bummed we spent the money on it.

Great visit, a brief 10 minute wait on Sunday evening at about 5:30.  Staff was quick to ensure that every need was met.  I had the chicken and shrimp gumbo while my wife had orange chicken.  Both were excellent!! The staff took our sons order right away so he would not have to wait.  Desert goes without saying, it was awesome!!!Great experience, definitely will be a return visit!!!
Cold Crappy Food, Over and Over...<br><br>Why do I Torture myself every time.<br><br>The Manager is W E A K !!!<br><br>Kyle Davis  - Manager

The Cheesecake is to die for!  Of course---very yummy!  The rest of the food was pretty good too.  <br><br>Hostess, Bartender and Server not so much!  I get that this is a busy restaurant and the Host/Hostess are met everyday probably with giving people long wait times, but being pleasant goes a long way. When you immediately start fidgeting with your computer screen punching in buttons with a stressed frown on your face, thankful our parents who have never been to Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t have to endure this rude greeting.  Next, it&#39;s on to the bar for a couple glasses of wine and a virgin daquiri (we told the bartender before we ordered we would make it worth his while :)  -- expected that to get a little friendly response.  No instead an abrupt stomp off to make it.  Comes back we ask for a wine list and bartender seems annoyed we are not ordering food.  Ask about the house chardonnay and he tells me it&#34;s compared to Beringer--blick!  That&#39;s a first!  So we get our wine and settle up immediately, we were going to hang out, but we felt very unwelcome here.  Decide to sit outside for the rest of our wait, the seating outside is really nice and it was a nice night.  Finally, the buzzer rings and it&#39;s on to dinner.  Waiter is pleasant enough but, seems frazzled and not overly friendly.  Takes our drink orders, brings them back with bread basket.  Takes our order and app order.   App comes out, probably good time to make sure everyone has drinks still... nope.  He disappears then, apparently at this restaurant there are no food runners so, the waiter is also responsible for getting your food out to you too.  Seems like a BIG mistake to me--unless your organized and a good waiter/waitress.   We were a party of 6 and like I said first time our parents had ever been here and we were hoping to treat them to a good evening.  So half of our party got our food right away, the other half waited and waited (typically at most restaurants when food comes out seperate like that it is expected that the rest of the tables food is coming up right?).  We saw our waiter take another order, before he got the rest of our food.  No checkback really, and definitely no drink refills, unless  you count the time I flagged him down.  When our waiter finally came back to the table, ingredients from my salad were missing, had to get waiter to go ask for those items.  <br><br>Like I said food was good enough and cheesecake was awesome, but for what you pay to eat at this place and the wait, you expect better service!  There are a ton of great restaurants in our area and for us this is not one we will be in a hurry to return to.  Best part, we also get the impression that the people who work there don&#39;t really care if you come back!

I thought I had already written this but maybe not.  Had around 7 kids and an adult with me and went for lunch.  Well, little did we know we should have reservations for such a party and no way we were getting in.  So we went in the line for a slice of cheesecake each.  Wow, what a selection.  And the line moved pretty well.   I have to say that the value in that cheese cake is pretty strong.  I had one with about 20 ingredients and it was huge.  Everyone really loved theirs.  I look forward to going back.

We came here for my man&#39;s birthday and wait was 1 1/2 hrs on a Saturday note, not bad. We tried the eggroll sampler, Cajun pasta, and chicken Madeira. The dishes were tasty, and healthier than we remembered.  Cheesecake was delicious, vanilla bean and Chris&#39;s outrageous. It&#39;s pricey but worth it for a nice evening.
I definitely recommend this place it had one of the best steaks I&#39;ve had in a while and my wife absolutely love her cheesecake and the service was great love this place!

Good family place. Place seems to be always packed. We had to wait 45 min for a table -normally i would go someplace else- but my daughter really wanted to go there and it was her bday so we ended up staying. <br>Service was great and food even though took a little longer that usual was pretty good too. I don&#39;t know if i would wait another 45 min again but def would go back if there is no waiting time..

This used to be my favorite restaurant, but my experience today has been awful. The food was horrible and the waitress messed up most of my family&#39;s orders. The food was burnt or had something wrong. The wait felt like ages. Don&#39;t come here and expect the best.

I just had the best experience here. They were able to accommodate my special diet due to a genetic disorder. Eating out was always bland for me because I had to get just veggies etc. But today the people here were able to cook my low protein noodles and add a DELICIOUS marinara sauce. I felt so normal for once. Thank you Cheesecake factory! I will definitely visit again.

Even though we have our dinner any where at South Charlotte, when my wife and we discuss about dessert , the first thing which comes to our mind is &#34;Dulce De Leche Caramel Cheesecake ( hope I spelled that correctly) . <br><br>Any sweet tooth friends out there, do not miss this awesome Cheesecake!!

I am VERY disappointed with my visit tonight. To start out I was told it would be a 45 minute wait, no big deal. I was expecting a long wait so that was fine. The problems began when We finally sat down (our party of 4) and  about 5 minutes went by, we were asked what we would like to drink (3 waters and a coke), the waitor took almost 10 minutes to get them to us. Then walked off 5 more minutes pass and we place our order (at 9:40 pm). The table beside us finished there meal, a new couple sat down. They ordered, there food was brought, they ate,paid there check and left. Still no food at our table. Finally at 11:00, two plates were brought to our table and about 5 minutes later the other two. The fries were so hard and old we didnt even eat them. When we finished eating I asked for the check, he asked if we wanted cheesecake, we all said no, he walked away, came back with a menu and said would yall like cheesecake. I politely said &#34;no, just my check&#34; he brought it then after what seemed like forever finally came back to take my card to run it. This was the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at a cheesecake factory.

Food very good :) always delicious!  Very disappointed with our waiter... waited forever for a straw... ordered lunch portion of a pasta and upon arrival to the table it&#39;s a full portion and then I&#39;m told &#34;oh it doesn&#39;t come in lunch portion&#34;. Extremely disappointed... could have split it with my sister had I known... not a big dig if you are going home soon... but not so much if hours of shopping ahead.
Cheesecake factory food is good. Waitress are on point. And the cheese cake is out of this world.love the area it&#39;s in southpark.and the family loves it also.

Now I know why they call it &#34;the Cheesecake Factory&#34; BEST cheesecake I ever had.  I ordered the sea salt and Carmel. The menu was literally 35 pages long, so it takes awhile to decide.  I went on a busy weekend night but my husband went up to the bar and ordered us Mai Tais and they were really good, we sat outside on a beautiful night with our mai Tais and people watched, the time went by quickly.  I ordered some spicy shrimp dish that was delicious, the bread was good and they had something for everyone. I will return.  Good service and not overly priced.

So I have been to a few different Cheesecake Factories and they all have one thing in common. Go there for the cheesecake the entrees and appetizers and all the other meals are more than subpar. I feel that it is overpriced especially since the food really is not all that great. But if you&#39;re looking for a good dessert then that&#39;s where you should go. I would recommend going restaurant hopping and getting your entrée somewhere else and then coming here for dessert.

HUGE disappointment. We had an extremely poor experience on Sun 10/15. Our server forgot our bread, did not bring us appetizer plates for our appetizer, then my husband&#39;s beef was very undercooked. When reported to the server she replied that &#34;they won&#39;t do anything because there&#39;s less than half left&#34; She, herself realized this was a ridiculous statement as demonstrated when she nervously glanced at the plate which was 95% full and only a couple of bites taken. She had already passed by the table a couple of times, glanced at his plate and never once asked if his meal was ok. I ordered the same entree and also had undercooked meat but less so than my husband, however even though there was also a good portion of my meal remaining she did not ask how mine was and if I was satisfied. She proceeded to ask if we wanted dessert, then brought the dessert before clearing the dinner plates, and without fresh utensils or napkins. <br>We&#39;d have requested a manager on the spot but we were in with our daughter who is only home for the weekend and we chose to try and enjoy the remainder of the meal with her. Katelyn was our server and her service was awful and she should be coached. I will be contacting a manager tomorrow, Monday. <br>What a wasted of time and money.

I&#39;ve been here like maybe 5 times and I still love this place. They have a wide variety of food. It&#39;s a very nice place. The only bad thing is sometimes the wait because this place always has people. Of course it&#39;s mostly on like Friday and weekends that the wait is longer but I still love this place. It actually may be my favorite restaurant in Charlotte.

Went to the South Park location yesterday there was a 45 min wait which is so frustrating cause we thought the later we went the less of a wait we would have. Once we finally where seated our server Tavaris was a pleasure he gave us good serves and always came back to make sure our party was taken care of. I was upset that most of the cheesecake was sold out but Tavaris let us know that the shipment had not came in yet. But over all we enjoyed the food and will return

Ordered Curbside TOGO for an Oreo cheesecake, strawberry cheesecake, key lime cheesecake, and a Snickers bar cheesecake. Yummy!!!! They are open on Saturdays despite what it says here on the app! Curbside quoted me about 25 minutes, However it took longer than 25 minutes for my order to be delivered to my car, almost an hour. Ordered at approximately 8:24pm and finally received my cheesecakes at 9:15pm. The curbside waitress was polite and explained to us that the dessert orders were insane tonight so we understood! Cheesecakes were yummy though! :)

I ordered Factory burrito Grade. I had that 10 times before and I know it very well. Came with 90% white rice in it. Taco Bell bean burrito is lot better than this one. So I told my server and he sent manager KYLE. This dude came 20 min later and just started giving explanation. All he had to say was &#39;sorry that it wasn&#39;t made right. Instead he wanted to argue that this is how it is. Nice place but food and service is poor on my experience. Will never go to see his location.

Cheesecake. Yes, that&#39;s what they&#39;re famous for.. And probably the only thing that I will eat here as everything is overpriced and the food is just okay. I came here with a group of friends weeks ago for a get together. I just ordered a drink and my brother ordered a cheesecake and calamari which I shared with. The calamari wasn&#39;t bad as it was deep fried like any other restaurant that serves calamari.<br><br>Cheesecake was wonderful, apple caramel streusel. It was sweet but it wasn&#39;t to the point where my mouth was dry (then again I had Long Islands that helped me wash it down.) One of my other friends ordered a burger, and honestly to come here to order a burger isn&#39;t really a bright idea. The portions are definitely not worth the amount that you&#39;re paying, however this is a &#34;high class&#34; restaurant.<br><br>And be sure to watch out on the floors. They&#39;re super greasy/slippery, as soon as you walk out of the main area and to your chairs. It seems as if you&#39;re walking on some dried oil or grease, it&#39;s kind of nasty to not think that they would not mop the floors every night.<br><br>Overall, I would give it a 2.5/5 but since Yelp has stars I&#39;ll round it and give it a 3, just because that cheesecake was pretty good. But, you won&#39;t find me a regular here.

Been going to this place for years and still the food is delicious.  I would recommend it to anyone. Always busy though especially Friday nights. I recommend the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp but it&#39;s ALL good.

I was shocked at this restaurant after eating at the Cheesecake Factory in DC this past August. My granddaughter wanted to celebrate her boyfriend&#39;s  birthday along with mine and 2 others family members with birthdays next week. 10 of us met at south park at 3 in the afternoon. My granddaughter told the hostess how many and was told it would be 1 to 2 hour wait and given a beeper. We decided to walk around the mall and thought it surly will not be 2 hours. At 2 1/2 hrs we checked and were told it would be another 1 to 2 hours. At this point you think oh heck no, but you have already waited so you continue to wait. At 6:20 after many more checking with the hostess our beeper went off. We were seated at a table for 8, not 10. They then get 2 more chairs and look upset that it was required. Our waitress comes over takes drink orders and my husband orders a mix drink while everyone else orders tea or soda and one young man with us under 21 says jokingly I will take one of what he is having and his mom says no he will not he is underage. When she returns she gives him a mix drink and never asked for ID. My husband drank it after drinking his because he did not want to get her in trouble. She comes back and asks if the young man (18 yrs) with us would like another and we all say no. We waited for our meal for over an hour. When it came out the young man that was served alcohol had no meal. It took another 30 minutes for his to be served. The food was not great, the Steak was tough, black beans were hard and overall taste not good. Then she said they were busy so if we wanted dessert we needed to let her know because it would a while for it to be served. It is the Cheesecake Factory, so yes we wanted dessert. Half ordered desserts to go and half to eat there. They brought out the to go order and then 15 minutes later they bring the other desserts. The to go orders were literally half of the size of the ones served at our table. The only food that was worth the problems would have been the free ice cream sundae. <br>Will not return or recommend. It was a totally different experience from the Cheesecake Factory in DC.
Ok. Short and sweet. The cheese cake is good. The other 9000000 things on the menu is a waste of your time and energy just run.

It&#39;s hard to review the Cheesecake Factory because honestly, if you can&#39;t find anything on the menu there&#39;s no hope. The food is good and the waiters are always very attentive when we go. Best time to go is on a week day during lunch time. Weekends get crowded which is very understandable for anything attached for a mall. But we always call ahead to see what the wait time is before showing up. Don&#39;t forget to stop by the cheesecake counter or get the eggroll sampler! It&#39;s a chain so my expectations are lower than a 5 star steakhouse.

Ummmm.... I wish I could have given this place a 5 star, but no. Every dish I have gotten here has always been delicious, let me just say that. I always get the salmon dish, one of them is not on the menu anymore (which is sad ), but they have another one that is delicious. The Cheesecake of course is fantastic (the Godiva, I highly recommend). Here comes a bit of a rant. If Cheesecake Factory is reading this, PLEASE start taking reservations on weekends. A close friend of mine loves this restaurant, so we decided to take her on a Saturday night to this place to celebrate. They do not take reservations on weekends. I get there and there is literally a 3 hour wait... My jaw dropped, this place was packed. I could hardly get in the entrance door. People were running into me, I was running into them, yikes . I don&#39;t see how many of those people even got seated. There is no way. We ended up taking our party else where. Just be aware of this if you decide to go there on a weekend night. Service is just ok, some are more attentive than others, but a nice place. I will be going there again, but not on a weekend night. On weekdays it&#39;s quick to be seated.

The food was very good but the service was terrible. My waiter made a series of rude jokes to my family and we never once got a refill on our drinks. It took 30 minutes for our cheesecake to come and when I ordered a piece to go he gave me a much tinier piece than the others. Totally not worth the $8 I spent on it.

My best friend loves coming here because of the assortment of Cheesecake available.The quality of service and food remains consistent every time we come. Never disappointed with what I order it always works out. One of my favorite appetizers are the lettuce chicken wraps.<br> <br>But forget about getting into this place for any special occasions like Valentine &#39;s or Mother&#39;s day. Its literally crowds waiting to get in, you would think the restaurant was giving away cheesecake for free. This place stays active considering it&#39;s the only location in Charlotte. I just dislike the long wait to be seated but overall it&#39;s a restaurant for a good time with friends and a variety of entrees at a reasonable price.

Really love this place.  It has been several years since I ate at one (probably while I was still living in Columbus - and that was over six years ago).  Sadly, I live in Columbia, SC, and this is the closest Cheesecake Factory to where I live.  My sister loves it here (well mainly for their cheesecakes), so we decided to make a small road trip up here several days ago.<br><br>Unlike the name suggests, you can order more than cheesecakes here.  Even though we were originally going to have lunch here, we decided just to stick with cheesecake for dessert. Looking at their menu (briefly might I add and going on when I actually did have dinners here), you can get your typical dinners here (chicken, stekas, pizza) and price wise, it is the about the same as other dinner places you might go to.  The menu does seem overwhelming (as we were only looking for desserts) as this particular location was also running ads for other businesses in the area (not aure if all locations do this as well).<br><br>Loved the decor as well.  It made you fell like you were eating at a classy place without having to be overly dressed and not paying over the top prices either.

Thai lettuce wrap is <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbomb.com&amp;s=bb4f996415a9c2f21137e27cfb68f439a48cec2652b53e9b50dd7e766dbe177e" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">bomb.com</a>! It&#39;s like your own little build your own lettuce wrap station. Cheesecake wise, the red velvet cheesecake is delicious.. Makes my mouth water just thinking about it. I do recommend sharing the slice of cheesecake because the slices are good size but a little too sweet to finish it on your own. I think it&#39;s a cute place to have a date

I don&#39;t usually give negative feedback but my husband and I spent two hours and 10 minutes here for lunch today. While the food was delicious, the wait was unreasonable. The wait for a table was about 40 minutes but that was expected considering the crowd. We were seated beside an empty table and placed our order. About half an hour later a family of ten was seated beside us and we still had not received our food. We shared a waitress and she was extremely pleasant, but much more attentive to the larger party. She told us our food was coming right out three times before we got it, I honestly think she had forgotten about us. By the end of our meals, we just barely beat the other family out the door, and that&#39;s because we got our cheesecake to go. I hate to say anything bad about such a nice girl and good food, but over two hours for lunch is ridiculous.
